title: British Foreign Minister Ernest Bevin at desk
Scopenote: Photograph of British Foreign Minister Ernest Bevin seated at his desk.    From: Beth Gore.

title: Tighe E. Woods before House banking committee
Scopenote: United States Housing Expeditor Tighe E. Woods today told the House Banking Committee that the need to expand rent control stems from the nations new defense effort. He urged the committee to support a 24 month continuation of controls. The administration wants a stronger law, with authority to bring back under control areas that have previously freed. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of General Mark W. Clark, Mrs. Clark and an unidentified man
Scopenote: Mark W. Clark (right), General of the Commanding Army of the American Forces in Italy, visits with an unidentified man (far left).  The woman between them is probably Mrs. Clark.  From:  Beth Gore.

title: Lewis L. Strauss, member of Atomic Energy Commission
Scopenote: Portrait of Lewis L. Strauss, member of the Atomic Energy Commission. Strauss was a former businessman and Admiral. From: Beth Gore.

title: Senator Arthur H. Vandenberg at United Nations General Assembly Budgetary Committee
Scopenote: Senator Arthur H. Vandenberg at the United Nations General Assembly Budgetary Committee meeting at Lake Success. He told the Committee that a proposal of fifty percent U. S. share was entirely inadequate to the total consideration which should be given international assessments. From: Beth Gore.

title: Portrait of Clarence Cannon
Scopenote: Portrait of Clarence Cannon.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Ambassador Gromyko of the Soviet Union
Scopenote: Ambassador Andrei A. Gromyko of the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics, is shown shaking the hand of an unidentified man at an airport. Ambassador Gromyko is on the right.  From: Beth Gore

title: Portrait of Paul-Henri Spaak
Scopenote: Portrait of Paul-Henri Spaak, seated at desk.  He was the foreign minister from Belgium.    From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Georgia Neese Clark in a long formal dress
Scopenote: A formal portrait of Treasurer of the United States, Georgia Neese Clark, seated with long formal dress.  From:  Beth Gore.

title: A 1911 photo of Cordell Hull as a young Congressman from Tennessee
Scopenote: Turning back the pages of history, here is a photograph of Cordell Hull as a young Congressman from Tennessee. This photograph was released on October 3, 1946.    From: Beth Gore

title: Airbrushed Photo of Senator Arthur Vandenberg
Scopenote: Airbrushed picture of Senator Arthur Vandenberg, sitting at his desk.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Airbrushed portrait of House Minority Leader Joseph W. Martin
Scopenote: Airbrushed portrait of House Minority Leader Joseph W. Martin at his desk.  From: Beth Gore

title: Portrait of Stephen T. Early
Scopenote: Portrait of Stephen T. Early.  From: Beth Gore

title: Dean Acheson testifying before Congress
Scopenote: Dean Acheson testifying before Congress.  Photo is airbrushed. Others are unidentified.  From:   Beth Gore

title: Sumner Welles
Scopenote: Portrait photograph of Sumner Welles.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Governor Harold E. Stassen of Minnesota
Scopenote: Portrait of Governor Harold E. Stassen of Minnesota, who is in Washington to attend the Gridiron Club dinner.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Portrait of Robert A. Taft
Scopenote: Portrait of Robert A. Taft.    From: Beth Gore

title: Secretary of War Henry L. Stimson
Scopenote: Airbrushed portrait of Secretary of War Henry L. Stimson.  From: Beth Gore

title: Portrait of W. Averell Harriman
Scopenote: A portrait of a young W. Averell Harriman.

title: Portrait of King George II of Greece in full military dress
Scopenote: Portrait of King George II of Greece in full military dress (airbrushed photo).    From: Beth Gore.

title: A portrait of General Mark W. Clark
Scopenote: A portrait of General Mark W. Clark.

title: Official campaign photo of Thomas E. Dewey for the 1944 campaign
Scopenote: Official campaign photo of Thomas E. Dewey for the 1944 campaign.  From: Beth Gore.

title: A portrait of Omar N. Bradley
Scopenote: Official U.S. Army photo of Lieutenant General Omar N. Bradley.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Ambassador and Mme. Andrei A. Gromyko of the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics
Scopenote: Ambassador and Mme. Andrei A. Gromyko of the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics, pictured at the annual anniversary of the October Revolutions at the Russian Embassy. The Ambassador is wearing the new Russian diplomatic uniform.   From: Beth Gore

title: W. Averill Harriman arriving at the White House to report to President Roosevelt
Scopenote: W. Averill Harriman, United States Ambassador to the Soviet Union, shown as he arrived at the White House to report to President Franklin D. Roosevelt following the 10-day conference in Moscow with Prime Minister Winston Churchill and Joseph Stalin. Ambassador Harriman made the air trip back to the United States in 57 hours.

title: Vice President Henry A. Wallace (L), Secretary of the Treasury Henry Morgenthau (C), and Vice President-Elect Harry S. Truman, Senator from Missouri
Scopenote: Ceremonies at the Capitol showing Secretary of the Treasury Henry Morgenthau (Center), selling the first bonds of the Sixth War Loan Drive to Vice President Henry A. Wallace (Left), and Vice President-Elect Harry S. Truman, Senator from Missouri.  From: Beth Gore

title: Major General Edwin M. Watson
Scopenote: Major General Edwin M. Watson, President Roosevelt's Secretary and Military Aide, today disclosed before the House Committee investigating the FCC, that President Roosevelt had requested a "full and complete investigation" into asserted "pressure sale" of New York radio station WMCA by Donald Flamm to former Undersecretary of Commerce Edward J. Noble. Major General Watson said that complaints had come directly to the President that pressure had been brought to bear on Mr. Flamm, who sold the station in 1941 for $850,000.00, assertedly $400,000.00 below market value. Major General Watson is shown taking the oath before going on the stand. From: Beth Gore.

title: William H. Davis, Chairman, National Defense Mediation Board
Scopenote: Portrait of William H. Davis, Chairman, National Defense Mediation Board.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Portrait of Stephen T. Early
Scopenote: Portrait of Stephen T. Early.  From: Beth Gore

title: Portrait of Admiral William F. Halsey, USN
Scopenote: Portrait of Admiral William F. Halsey, USN.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Secretary of State James F. Byrnes at his desk
Scopenote: Secretary of State James F. Byrnes sitting at his desk, strikes a solemn pose with a clenched fist.   From: Beth Gore

title: British Prime Minister Clement Attlee
Scopenote: Portrait of British Prime Minister Clement Attlee.   From:   Beth Gore

title: Harry A. Truman, a nephew of President Truman, at the White House
Scopenote: Having been a guest of his uncle, President Harry S. Truman at the Potsdam Conference, Sgt. Harry A. Truman of Grandview, Missouri, stopped off in Washington, D. C. today to see the White House. Here the Sergeant is shown walking on the White House lawn.  From:  Beth Gore.

title: Harry S. Truman with brother Vivian
Scopenote: Vivian Truman, younger brother of Vice-President- elect Harry S. Truman, arrives in Washington for his brother's inauguration.  The Vice-President's brother, on the left, is from Grandview, Missouri and is assistant Director of the Federal Housing Authority in Kansas City.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Henri Bonnet signing the United Nations declaration as Edward Stettinius looks on
Scopenote: France became the 36th member of the United Nations in a colorful ceremony at the State Department at which the war-time coalition against the Axis was hailed as "the foundation stone of peace". Photo shows French Ambassador Henri Bonnet, left, signing the United Nations declaration, pledging his country's whole-hearted cooperation in the creation of a world security system because France knows from experience that " from now on...war, once begun, will spread over the entire globe." Secretary of State Edward R. Stettinius, right, looks on. From: Beth Gore

title: Dean Acheson portrait
Scopenote: Assistant Secretary of State Dean Acheson posed for this new portrait a few days ago at the State Department.  From:   Beth Gore

title: Photo of Col. Oveta Culp Hobby, Director of the WAC's
Scopenote: Photo of Col. Oveta Culp Hobby, Director of the Women's Army Corps, wearing the Distinguished Service Medal which she received from Secretary of War Henry Stimson.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Senator Forrest C. Donnell of Missouri
Scopenote: New picture of Senator Forrest C. Donnell of Missouri.  From: Beth Gore

title: Vice President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: New picture of Vice-President-Elect Harry S. Truman, shown on the Senate rostrum.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Rep. Edward J. Hart (D. NJ)
Scopenote: Rep. Edward J. Hart (D. NJ) who voted against continuing the House Committee on Un-American Activities, is reported slated to be chairman of the group formerly headed by Martin Dies. Here Hart looks over some of the booklets and pamphlets inherited from the Dies regime.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Philip Murray, President of the CIO, as he appeared before the House Military Affairs Committee
Scopenote: Photo of Philip Murray, President of the CIO, as he appeared before the House Military Affairs Committee to answer questions about war production shortages. He indicated that the shortages are due to upsurges in military requirements and mistakes of government procurement agencies, and that three-fourths of all manpower shortage figures and complaints would be eliminated if both unions and companies were required to certify manpower shortage conditions. He was testifying that no "work or fight" legislation was necessary. From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of State Edward R. Stettinius, Jr., and Senator Tom Connally
Scopenote: Secretary of State Edward R. Stettinius, Jr., and Senator Tom Connally, Chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, shown at a globe in Mr. Connally's office. The new Secretary of State and the Senate Foreign Relations Committee had just met in the first of a series of meetings to discuss a general review of foreign affairs.  From: Beth Gore

title: Vice President Henry Wallace preparing to leave office
Scopenote: Vice President Henry A. Wallace, who steps out of office when Vice President Elect Harry S. Truman takes his oath of office on Saturday, shown at his office this morning packing books and important documents into trunks. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Guy M. Gillette being sworn in as a member of the Surplus Property Board
Scopenote: Former Democratic Senator Guy M. Gillette (left) of Iowa is being sworn in as a member of the Surplus Property Board. Frank Sanderson, Administrative officer at the White House is administering the oath while War Mobilization Director James F. Byrnes,(center) looks on.  From: Beth Gore

title: Vice President Harry Truman at Senate rostrum
Scopenote: Vice-President Harry S. Truman photographed on the rostrum in the Senate Chamber shortly after the Senate convened yesterday.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Josiah Bailey and Senator Walter F. George
Scopenote: Chairman Josiah Bailey, (D. NC), left, presented to the Senate Commerce Committee Henry A. Wallace's nomination to be Secretary of Commerce along with a bill offered by Senator Walter F. George (D. GA), right, which would strip Wallace of that job's most potent powers on grounds that he "is unfit to exercise them."  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Secretary of Commerce Jesse Jones talking with Senator Walter F. George
Scopenote: Secretary of Commerce Jesse Jones (left), who is fighting to keep his post as Secretary of Commerce and head of the Reconstruction Finance Corporation, talks with Senator Walter F. George, (D.GA), at a Senate hearing.  Senator George has a bill before the Senate to strip all powers over the RFC and other Federal lending agencies now in the Department of Commerce.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of the Treasury Henry Morgenthau
Scopenote: Shown is Secretary of the Treasury Henry Morgenthau, checking the map in his office at the Treasury Building on Russian progress in their drive towards Berlin. The map is kept up to date daily by his staff.  From: Beth Gore

title: Former Vice President Henry Wallace at news conference
Scopenote: Former Vice President Henry A. Wallace sits on table while talking to newsmen following this morning's hearing on his appointment as Secretary of Commerce by President Roosevelt. From: Beth Gore.

title: Eleanor Roosevelt, broadcasting for President Roosevelt, with Basil O'Connor
Scopenote: Mrs. Franklin D. (Eleanor) Roosevelt, broadcasting for her husband, the President of the United States, on his 63rd birthday, shown at the microphones at the White House with Basil O'Connor, Chairman of the National Infantile Paralysis Fund.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Senator Walter F. George (D, GA), discussing his bill with Senator Lister Hill of Alabama
Scopenote: Photo of Senator Walter F. George (D, GA), right, discussing his bill with Senator Lister Hill of Alabama. The Senate had just passed the George Bill, divorcing from the Department of Commerce activities of certain loan agencies.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Leslie L. Biffle
Scopenote: Leslie L. Biffle, Secretary for the Senate Majority, has been mentioned to fill the vacancy of Secretary of the Senate, caused by the death of Col. Edwin Halsey.  From:   Beth Gore

title: Photo of Senator Kenneth McKellar, Tennessee
Scopenote: Photo of Senator Kenneth McKellar, Tennessee, President pro-tempore of the Senate. Man at left is unidentified.

title: Senator Tom Connally (D-Tx) talking to Vice President Truman
Scopenote: Senator Tom Connally of Texas (left), Chairman of the powerful Senate Foreign Relations Committee, chats with Vice President Harry S. Truman, the former Senator from Missouri. This photo is similar to 66-2786. From: Beth Gore

title: Under Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson, Senator Elbert D. Thomas, Utah,  and Secretary of War Henry L. Stimson
Scopenote: Secretary of War Stimson told the Senate Military Affairs Committee that he wanted prompt passage of "work or else" legislation more to boost morale on the battlefronts than for its direct results in war production. Mr. Stimson and Under Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson appeared before the Senate Military Affairs Committee.  Left to right, Mr. Patterson, Senator Elbert D. Thomas, Utah, Chairman of the Committee, and Mr. Stimson.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of President Eric Johnston of the U. S. Chamber of Commerce
Scopenote: President Eric Johnston of the U. S. Chamber of Commerce, urging Congress to make sure that the bulk of the government's housing activities are returned to their pre-war status under the Federal Loan Agency at the end of the war. Johnson outlined the views of the Chamber of Commerce Board of Directors on Postwar Governmental Housing Activities before a Senate subcommittee on postwar housing.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Senator Kenneth McKellar (TN), speaking before the Senate Agriculture Committee
Scopenote: Photo of Senator Kenneth McKellar (TN), speaking before the Senate Agriculture Committee, who said that he would like to confirm every man President Roosevelt nominated and he could not vote to make "totally unfit" Aubrey Williams Rural Electrification Administration  Administrator.  From: Beth Gore.

title: A photo of Senator Harlan J. Bushfield of South Dakota
Scopenote: A photo of Senator Harlan J. Bushfield of South Dakota.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Senator Allen J. Ellender of Louisiana
Scopenote: Informal photograph of Senator Allen J. Ellender of Louisiana.  From: Beth Gore

title: Henry L. Stimson and Rep. Sol Bloom before House Foreign Affairs Committee
Scopenote: Secretary of War Henry L. Stimson in an appearance today before the House Foreign Affairs Committee, urged extension of the Lend-Lease Act with its full effectiveness and "without delay." Stimson is shown with Rep. Sol Bloom, Chairman of the Committee.  From:  Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Admiral William F. Halsey, Jr., appearing at a press conference at the Navy Department
Scopenote: Admiral William F. Halsey, Jr., Commander of the Third Fleet, in Washington for a conference, predicted that fighting on Iwo Jima would be "very tough", but doubted the Japanese fleet would come out to interfere. He is shown here at a press conference at the Navy Department.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Senator Burnet R. Maybank at a Senate Military Affairs Sub-Committee Press Conference
Scopenote: Blaze, Col. Elliott Roosevelt's dog, whose transcontinental airplane jaunt has caused nation-wide talk, traveled two priority grades above Senators, Senator Burnet R. Maybank, South Carolina, said at a Senate Military Affairs Sub-Committee press conference today. Photo shows Senator Maybank during the conference. Unidentified person in background.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Former Vice President Henry Wallace takes oath as Secretary of Commerce
Scopenote: Former Vice President Henry A. Wallace, left, was sworn in as Secretary of Commerce today. Photo shows him signing the official papers as Supreme Court Justice Hugo L. Black, right, who swore in Wallace, looks on.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Portrait of Commander Harold E. Stassen, USNR
Scopenote: Portrait of Commander Harold E. Stassen, USNR.  From: Beth Gore

title: Portrait of Fred M. Vinson, nominated to be Federal Loan Administrator
Scopenote: President Roosevelt today nominated OES Director Fred M. Vinson to be Federal Loan Administrator.   From:  Beth Gore.

title: Admiral William F. Halsey, Jr., USN, Commander of the Third Fleet
Scopenote: Admiral William F. Halsey, Jr., USN, Commander of the Third Fleet, home on leave enjoying a wild turkey hunt in Thomasville, Georgia. Other man is unidentified.  From: Beth Gore

title: William H. Davis being sworn in as Director of Economic Stabilization
Scopenote: William H. Davis, who succeeds Fred M. Vinson as Director of Economic Stabilization, is administered the oath of office by Associate Supreme Court Justice William O. Douglas. From: Beth Gore.

title: George W. Taylor and Justice William O. Douglas
Scopenote: George W. Taylor (left), who was named to succeed William H. Davis as chairman of the War Labor Board, is administered the oath of office by Associate Supreme Court Justice William O. Douglas.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Alberto Tarchiani of Italy
Scopenote: New photograph of the new Ambassador from Italy to the United States, Alberto Tarchiani.  He recently arrived in Washington to assume his post.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Fred M. Vinson standing at desk
Scopenote: This is the first picture to be made of Fred M. Vinson since he took over the chairmanship of the Reconstruction Finance Corporation.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Fred M. Vinson Portrait at Desk
Scopenote: A new informal portrait of Federal Loan Administrator Fred M. Vinson at his desk.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Picture of Paul Porter, Chairman of the Federal Communications Commission
Scopenote: Picture of Paul Porter, Chairman of the Federal Communications Commission.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Senator Milton R. Young of North Dakota
Scopenote: Senator Milton R. Young of North Dakota, who replaces the late John Moses of North Dakota, was sworn in today. Photo shows him at his desk.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of Commerce Henry Wallace in airplane
Scopenote: Air-minded Secretary of Commerce Henry A. Wallace is shown in the cockpit of a training plane at the National Airport in Washington.   From: Beth Gore.

title: William H. Davis, Director of Economic Stabilization
Scopenote: William H. Davis, who recently succeeded Fred M. Vinson as Director of Economic Stabilization. Davis was formerly Chairman of the War Labor Board.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Gen. Carlos P. Romulo testifying before the House Foreign Affairs Committee
Scopenote: Gen. Carlos P. Romulo (right), Resident Commissioner of the Philippines, testifying against war criminals before the House Foreign Affairs Committee. He is shown here with Rep. Sol Bloom, N. Y., Chairman of the Committee.  From: Beth Gore.

title: A portrait of Maj. Gen. Lucius D. Clay
Scopenote: A portrait of Major General Lucius D. Clay, who was  named to the staff of General Eisenhower as Deputy in charge of Civil Affairs in occupied Germany.  From: Beth Gore

title: General Stilwell Presents a Posthumous Medal of Honor to Cathrine Boyce
Scopenote: General Joseph Stilwell, Chief of the Army Ground Forces, presents the Medal of Honor to Cathrine Boyce, in Washington, D.C. Her son, the late Lt. George Boyce, Jr., smothered a live Japanese grenade on New Guinea to save the lives of his men. Left to right: Gen. Stilwell; Lt. Boyce's sister, Dorothy Boyce; Mrs. Boyce; and Lt. Boyce's grandmother, Mrs. Alfred Brown. From: Beth Gore.

title: Fred M. Vinson with Senator Josiah Bailey and Senator Walter George
Scopenote: The Senate today unanimously approved the nomination of Federal Loan Administrator Fred Vinson, center, to be the Director of War Mobilization and Reconversion.  Left to right at Senate Finance Committee executive session this morning:  Senator Josiah W. Bailey, North Carolina; Mr. Vinson; and Senator Walter F. George, Georgia, Chairman of the Committee.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Senator Brien McMahon of Connecticut
Scopenote: Photo of Senator Brien McMahon of Connecticut.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Paul Henri-Spaak, Socialist Foreign Minister of Belgium
Scopenote: Paul Henri-Spaak, Socialist Foreign Minister of Belgium, will represent his country at the forthcoming United Nations Conference at San Francisco.  A survivor of the cabinet crisis the prior fall, Spaak was one of the strongmen of the cabinet.  When Achille Van Acker was asked to form a new government, one of the conditions he placed on acceptance was that Spaak remain as Foreign Minister.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of President Truman's staff when he was Vice-President
Scopenote: The staff when President Harry S. Truman was Vice-President. Left to right: S. Leonard Reinsch, Personal Radio Adviser; Matthew J. Connelly, Executive Secretary; Edward D. McKim, a friend of Mr. Truman's since World War I days, and George C. Drescher, Secret Service Agent. From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Anthony Eden, Edward Stettinius and Lord Halifax leaving the White House
Scopenote: Photo of Britain's Minister of Foreign Affairs Anthony Eden, left, with American Secretary of State Edward R. Stettinius (center) and Lord Halifax, British Ambassador to the U. S., leaving the White House after a lengthy conference with President Truman.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Alfred Schindler
Scopenote: Photo of Alfred Schindler, who was nominated to be an Assistant Secretary of Commerce.   From: Beth Gore.

title: John W. Snyder, St. Louis banker, who was nominated by President Truman to be Federal Loan Administrator
Scopenote: John W. Snyder, St. Louis banker, who was nominated by President Truman to be Federal Loan Administrator.  This was the first major appointment to be made by Mr. Truman since he became President.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Secretary of War Henry L. Stimson,(left) Secretary of State Edward R. Stettinius, Jr.,(Center) and Secretary of Navy James Forrestal(right)
Scopenote: Secretary of War Henry L. Stimson,(left), Secretary of State Edward R. Stettinius, Jr.,(Center), and Secretary of Navy James Forrestal(right) leaving the White House after a conference with President Truman.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of President Truman and President Sergio Osmena of the Philippines conferring at the White House
Scopenote: Photo of President Harry S. Truman and President Sergio Osmena of the Philippines conferring at the White House.  Left to right:  President Truman, President Osmena, and Secretary of State Edward R. Stettinius.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Portrait of Charles Ross
Scopenote: President Truman announced today that Charles G. Ross, 39-year-old Washington correspondent for the St. Louis Post-Dispatch, will become his Press Secretary on May 15.  When Mr. Truman first took office, it was announced that J. Leonard Reinsch, Managing Director of three radio stations owned by James M. Cox, would act as secretary, but since then Mr. Cox has asked that Reinsch be allowed to return to his post with the stations because of the urgent need of his technical knowledge.

title: W. Averell Harriman and Ambassador Joseph C. Grew
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman today got a first hand, up to the minute report on Russia from W. Averell Harriman, the American Ambassador to Moscow. Ambassador Harriman is shown here, right, with Undersecretary of State Joseph C. Grew.  From:  Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of State Edward Stettinius and British Foreign Minister Anthony Eden
Scopenote: Secretary of State Edward Stettinius and British Foreign Minister Anthony Eden conferring at a table. Mr. Eden indicated after the talk that top Anglo-American diplomats will not decide when to depart for the San Francisco security conference until Russian foreign commissar Molotov arrives here for some important big three discussions.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of State Edward Stettinius (left) greeting Russian Foreign Commissar V. M. Molotov (right) with Russian Ambassador Andrei Gromyko looking on
Scopenote: Russian Foreign Commissar Vyacheslav Molotov (right) is shown at the Washington Airport being greeted by Secretary of State Edward Stettinius, Jr.(left).  Russian Ambassador to the United States, Andrei A. Gromyko, is in the center.  From: Beth Gore

title: Russian Foreign Commissar V.M. Molotov (right)and Secretary of State Edward R. Stettinius at the White House
Scopenote: Russian Foreign Commissar V.M. Molotov (right) leaving the White House with Secretary of State Edward R. Stettinius after a second conference with President Harry S. Truman.  From: Beth Gore

title: Harry Dexter White at Desk
Scopenote: Reports in Washington say that Harry Dexter White, now Assistant Secretary of Treasury in charge of Monetary Research, may get the post of Secretary should Morgenthau resign.  From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman and U. S. District Judge Lewis B. Schwellenbach of Washington, leaving the Blair House
Scopenote: President Truman (left) and U. S. District Judge Lewis B. Schwellenbach of Washington, leaving the Blair House after they had lunched there. Judge Schwellenbach, an old friend of President Truman's, was said to be in line for a high Government post.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Mayor John B. Gage of Kansas City, Missouri
Scopenote: Mayor John B. Gage of Kansas City, MO, an old friend of President Truman called on the Chief Executive at the White House and said he found him "completely unchanged".  From: Beth Gore.

title: Edwin W. Pauley, American member of the Allied Reparations Commission
Scopenote: Millionaire Edwin W. Pauley, Treasurer of the Democratic National Committee, was named by President Truman to serve as the American member of the Allied Reparations Commission meeting in Moscow. Mr. Pauley went to Moscow with the personal rank of Ambassador.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Philippine presidential candidate Manuel Roxas
Scopenote: Photo of Philippine presidential candidate Manuel Roxas making a brief speech after casting his ballot at Manila polls in the election on April 23.  Roxas was accompanied by a jeep-load of heavily armed guards because of threatening letters received, according to his headquarters.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Portrait of General George C. Marshall
Scopenote: A 5 x 7 formal portrait of General George C. Marshall.  From: Beth Gore

title: John W. Snyder of St. Louis being sworn in as Federal Loan Administrator
Scopenote: John W. Snyder of St. Louis (left) being sworn in as Federal Loan Administrator.  The ceremony took place at the White House with Associate Justice William O. Douglas administering the oath and President Harry S. Truman (center)looking on.  From: Beth Gore

title: Edwin Pauley being sworn in by William O. Douglas as the American member of the Allied Reparations Commission, as President Truman looks on
Scopenote: Edwin W. Pauley, who was named the American member of the Allied Reparations Commission, is shown taking the oath of office, as administered by Associate Justice William O. Douglas, at the White House. President Harry S. Truman is in the center of the picture.  From: Beth Gore

title: President Truman Walking with Captain James K. Vardaman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, accompanied by his new Naval Aide Captain James K. Vardaman, walks to the Blair House for luncheon today. They are accompanied by Secret Service men.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Captain James K. Vardaman, Jr
Scopenote: Captain James K. Vardaman Jr., USNR, is the new naval aide to President Truman.  He is a native of Mississippi   From: Beth Gore.

title: Press Secretary Jonathan Daniels talking to reporters in his office
Scopenote: Jonathan Daniels, White House Press Secretary, talks to reporters who piled into his office  hoping for an official announcement by President Truman of Germany's surrender.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Charles Ross, Press Secretary, on his new job at the White House
Scopenote: Charles Ross, recently appointed Press Secretary to President Harry S. Truman, was breaking in his new job at the White House.  Mr. Ross (seated), is shown with Jonathan Daniels, Press Secretary to President Roosevelt.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Undersecretary of State Joseph E. Grew making a special broadcast from Washington, D.C
Scopenote: In a special broadcast from Washington, Undersecretary of State Joseph C. Grew warned that Japan has prepared herself for a long time to carry on the war after Germany's defeat.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Fred Vinson at press conference
Scopenote: Today's press conference was a momentous one for War Mobilization Director Fred Vinson.  He announced the lifting of the midnight curfew and the revocation of the ban on horse racing.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of President Truman receiving a buddy poppy
Scopenote: President Truman received another Poppy. This one came from the American Legion and Mrs. Charles B. Gilbert of Norwich, CT, it's President, is shown making the presentation.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of President Truman and President Sergio Osmena of the Philippines
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and President Sergio Osmena of the Philippines as they conferred at the White House today.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Charles Ross after taking the oath as Press Secretary, with President Truman and others looking on
Scopenote: Charles Ross kisses the Bible after taking the oath as Press Secretary of President Harry S. Truman.  Left to right:  Associate Justice Wiley Rutledge, who administered the oath; President Truman; Charles Ross; and Mrs. Ross.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of newly sworn in Press Secretary Charles G. Ross with press in White House
Scopenote: Photo of newly sworn in Press Secretary to President Truman, Charles G. Ross (at desk), meeting the press at the White House for the first time.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Lt. General Albert C. Wedemeyer
Scopenote: A new photograph of Lieut. Gen. Albert C. Wedemeyer, Commanding General in the China-Burma-India Theater.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Senator James E. Murray of Montana
Scopenote: Portrait of Senator James E. Murray of Montana.

title: French Foreign Minister Georges Bidault with     Acting Secretary Of State Joseph C. Grew and French Ambassador Henri Bonnet
Scopenote: Left to right:  Acting Secretary of State Joseph C. Grew; French Foreign Minister Georges Bidault; and French Ambassador Henri Bonnet, leaving the White House after a conference with President Truman which reaffirmed the United States "complete willingness" to relinquish to France a part of the American Zone of Occupation in Germany.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Margaret Truman photographed for the first time with her Irish Setter pup, Mike
Scopenote: Margaret Truman, daughter of President and Mrs. Harry S. Truman, photographed for the first time with her Irish Setter pup, a present from Democratic National Committee Chairman Robert E. Hannegan. Mr. Hannegan suggested the name of "Casey" for the pup, but Miss Truman liked the tag of "Mike" which she gave him. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Sergeant Jake Lindsey being presented the Congressional Medal of Honor by President Truman
Scopenote: Photo of Sergeant Jake Lindsey of Lucedale, MS, being presented with the Congressional Medal of Honor by President Harry S. Truman before a joint session of Congress. Here the President, back to camera on the rostrum, presents the award to the Sergeant as General George C. Marshall looks on. In front of the flag are Senator Kenneth McKellar, President of the Senate and Speaker Sam Rayburn, while seated in the front row are the Sergeant's family with an Army officer as an escort. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Sgt. Jake Lindsey being presented the Congressional Medal of Honor by President Harry S. Truman before a joint session of Congress
Scopenote: Photo of Sergeant Jake Lindsey of Lucedale, MS, 24 years of age, being presented with the Congressional Medal of Honor by the President before a joint session of Congress. Lindsey was the 100th infantryman in this war to receive the honor. He won it for smashing almost single-handedly a strong enemy counter-attack near Hamich, Germany, in November, 1944. President Harry S. Truman is shown, left, shaking hands with Sergeant Lindsey, center, as General George C. Marshall, Chief of Staff, right, looks on. In the rear are Senator Kenneth McKellar, President of the Senate and Speaker Sam Rayburn.

title: Lt. General Albert C. Wedemeyer
Scopenote: A new informal picture of Lieut. Gen. Albert C. Wedemeyer, Commanding General in the China-Burma-India Theater.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of State Edward R. Stettinius entering the White House gates
Scopenote: Secretary of State Edward R. Stettinius entering the White House gates for a conference with President Truman. Mr. Stettinius had flown from the San Francisco Conference for the meeting.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Brig. Gen. Manuel Roxas, Filipino leader and patriot
Scopenote: Liberated a month prior at Baguio, Brig. Gen. Manuel Roxas, Filipino leader and patriot, is shown working at his desk in his Manila home. Despite the insistence of Gen. MacArthur and the late President Quezon that he go to Australia in the dark days of Bataan, Gen. Roxas resolved to stay in his native land and aid his people through the crisis. Insiders regarded Roxas as Sergio Osmena's chief rival for the presidency, if the Philippines were granted independence and elections were held to select a chief executive of the first Philippine Republic. Roxas could not engage in politics while in the army, and he was close-mouthed about his plans, but it was believed he would be the winning candidate when elections were held. From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman receiving His Royal Highness Prince Abdul Ilah, Regent of Iraq
Scopenote: In a ceremony held for the first time since the end of Word War II, President Harry S. Truman receives His Royal Highness Prince Abdul Ilah, Regent of Iraq.  The Prince and President Truman are shown standing on the White House's front portico, with the honor guard.  Standing to the left, second row, is the President's military aid, Col. Harry Vaughan.  To the right in the second row is Capt. James K. Vardaman, the President's Naval aid.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Portrait of Harold E. Stassen
Scopenote: Portrait of Harold E. Stassen, sitting at desk.  Mr. Stassen was a former governor who was a delegate to the United Nations conference.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Mrs. Harry Truman and daughter Margaret at National Airport in Washington, D. C
Scopenote: Latest informal photo of Mrs. Harry S. Truman, wife of the President, and her daughter, Margaret.  Photo was taken at the Washington National Airport yesterday. Mrs. Truman was christening hospital airplanes (this was the famous occasion when Mrs. Truman couldn't break the champagne bottle).  From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman awarding Stephen T. Early the Distinguished Service Medal
Scopenote: Stephen T. Early, associated in the White House for over 12 years as Press Secretary and aide, before leaving to take over a job as Vice-President of the Pullman Company, was presented with the Distinguished Service Medal by President Harry S. Truman. The ceremony was held in the Rose Garden of the White House and was attended by the White House staff.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Pres. Truman presenting the Distinguished Service Medal to Stephen T. Early
Scopenote: Stephen T. Early, Press Secretary and Aide at the White House for the past 12 years, prior to leaving to accepted the position as Vice-President of the Pullman Company, was presented with the Distinguished Service Medal by President Truman. The ceremony was held in the Rose Garden of the White House and was attended by the White House staff, shown in the background.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of President Truman and General Mark Clark in the White House
Scopenote: General Mark W. Clark, Commanding General of the American Forces in Italy, received a hearty welcome from President Truman at the White House today.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of President Truman and General Mark W. Clark in the President's office in the White House
Scopenote: During a visit with President Truman at the White House, General Mark W. Clark requested and received the signature of the Chief Executive for his autograph book. At the time, General Clark was Commanding General of the American Forces in Italy.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Acting Secretary of State Joseph C. Grew appearing before the House Postwar Military Policy Committee
Scopenote: Photo of Acting Secretary of State Joseph C. Grew appearing before the House Postwar Military Policy Committee. Grew said he believed strongly that American young should have military training in time of peace. He said his view was based on 40 years of experience in foreign service, including 10 years in Germany and 10 years in Japan before World War II.  From: Beth Gore.

title: General Carl A. (Tooey) Spatz, Commanding General of Strategic Air Forces, with President Truman
Scopenote: General Carl A. (Tooey) Spatz, Commanding General of Strategic Air Forces,(right)with President Truman at the White House.   (See also 89-66.)  From: Beth Gore

title: Joseph Davies, President Truman, Admiral William Leahy, and Harry Hopkins
Scopenote: Two envoys of President Harry S. Truman today reported to him at the White House in an early morning meeting: Harry Hopkins, just back from Moscow, and Joseph E. Davies, who was in London. Left to right, standing: Mr. Davies, Admiral Leahy, the President's Personal Chief of Staff; and Mr. Hopkins. The President is seated.  From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman Awards the Congressional Medal of Honor to Marine Private 1st Class Luther Skaggs, Jr.
Scopenote: In a Rose Garden ceremony at the White House, President Harry S. Truman awards Marine Private First Class Luther Skaggs, Jr., 22, of Henderson, KY, with the Medal of Honor. Skaggs lost a leg in combat when he was seriously injured but continued to return enemy fire with a rifle and hand grenades for eight hours before receiving medical attention. Secretary of Navy James Forrestal is on the right. From: Beth Gore

title: Captain James K. Vardaman portrait
Scopenote: Latest portrait of Captain James K. Vardaman, Naval Aide to President Truman.    From: Beth Gore.

title: Bernard Baruch (right) talking with Senators Elbert Thomas, Utah and Harry Byrd, Virginia
Scopenote: Bernard M. Baruch today called for the removal or destruction of all German heavy industry to "break once and for all Germany's dominance of Europe."  Appearing before the Senate Military Affairs Committee, Baruch is here shown seated, right, while Senator Elbert D. Thomas of Utah, left, chairman of the committee, and Senator Harry Flood Byrd, Virginia, standing, talk to him prior to the opening of the hearing.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Senator Wallace H. White Jr
Scopenote: Senator Wallace H. White, Jr., of Maine, posed for this Harris and Ewing portrait several days ago.   From; Beth Gore.

title: Lewis B. Schwellenbach being sworn in as Secretary of Labor
Scopenote: Lewis B. Schwellenbach being sworn in as Secretary of Labor, replacing Mrs. Frances Perkins. The ceremony was held in the Secretary of the Senate's office. Left to right are Mrs. Frances Perkins, Federal Judge Sherman Minton of Indiana, and Secretary Lewis B. Schwellenbach.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Mrs. Frances Perkins (L) congratulating her replacement as Secretary of Labor, Lewis B. Schwellenbach
Scopenote: Mrs. Frances Perkins is shown congratulating her replacement as Secretary of Labor, Lewis B. Schwellenbach. Federal Judge Sherman Minton of Indiana, center, who performed the ceremony, looks on. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan
Scopenote: Photo of Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan as he doffs a mailman's hat during the horseplay that followed his swearing in at the Post Office Department. From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Nicaraguan Ambassador Guillermo Sevilla Sacasa signing the UN Charter
Scopenote: Photo of Nicaraguan Ambassador Guillermo Sevilla Sacasa signing the United Nations Charter on behalf of Nicaragua.  Watching the signing are Mrs. Clara Wright of the treaty section of the Division of Research and Publications of the State Department and Alberto Sevilla Sacasa, brother of the Ambassador and Secretary of the Embassy.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of General Jacob L. Devers, Commander of the Army Ground Forces
Scopenote: General Jacob L. Devers, who has been appointed Commander of the Army Ground Forces, replacing General Joseph W. Stilwell.  From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman shown with Secretary of State James F. Byrnes
Scopenote: President Truman shown chatting with his newest Cabinet member, Secretary of State James F. Byrnes, following the swearing in ceremonies at the White House today.  From:  Beth Gore.

title: Artemus L. Gates placing his flag in position on Secretary James Forrestal's desk piece
Scopenote: Artemus L. Gates, new Under Secretary of the Navy puts his flag in position on Secretary Forrestal's desk piece. When an Admiral is on board his flagship he runs up his flag. Similarly, when Secretary Forrestal's staff is in town he puts their respective flags in this holder on his desk. Left to right the flags represent: H. Struve Hensel, Chief of Naval Ordnance; Artemus L. Gates, newly sworn in Under Secretary of the Navy; Admiral Ernest J. King, Chief of Naval Operations; and F. J. Horne, Vice Chief of Naval Operation.  From: Beth Gore

title: James F. Byrnes with President Truman, after being sworn in as Secretary of State
Scopenote: James F. Byrnes, after being sworn in as Secretary of State, is shown kissing the Bible.  Left to right, Chief Justice Richard Whaley; Mrs. James Byrnes; James Byrnes; President Harry S. Truman. In the background are President of the Senate Kenneth McKellar, Postmaster General Robert Hannegan and Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Dr. V. K. Wellington Koo, the Ambassador from China to the United States
Scopenote: Dr. V. K. Wellington Koo, the Ambassador from China to the United States, is shown as he entered the White House to present his credentials to President Truman.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of General Jacob Devers as he visited Walter Reed Hospital
Scopenote: General Jacob Devers, Commander of the Army Ground Forces, today visited Walter Reed Hospital. He spent his time chatting with some of the wounded officers and men who are convalescing there. He is shown here with Lt. Col. John K. Waters, son-in-law of General George Patton.  From: Beth Gore

title: Left to right:  Senator Tom Connally, Secretary of State Edward Stettinius, and Senator Arthur H. Vandenberg
Scopenote: Delegates to the San Francisco conference wish former Secretary of State Edward R. Stettinius luck as he appeared before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, which opened hearings on the United Nations charter. Left to right:  Senator Tom Connally, Secretary of State Edward R. Stettinius, and Senator Arthur H. Vandenberg. Both Senators are members of the committee, Connally being chairman.  From: Beth Gore

title: Robert E. Hannegan presents Iwo Jima Stamps to Gen. A. A. Vandegrift, Commandant of the U. S. Marine Corps
Scopenote: Photo showing Post Master General Robert E. Hannegan presenting to Gen. A. A. Vandegrift, Commandant of the U. S. Marine Corps, the first sheet of the Iwo Jima 3-cent stamp.  The stamp depicts the raising of the flag on Iwo Jima.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of John H. Bradley and Robert E. Hannegan
Scopenote: Photo of John H. Bradley, PM 2/C U.S.N., who was in the historic picture of the flag raising on Iwo Jima.  Here he is shown receiving a sheet of the issue of the new Iwo Jima three-cent stamp from Post Master General Robert E. Hannegan.  Senator Joseph C. O'Mahoney, Wyoming, shown congratulating Bradley while Hannegan and Gen. A. A. Vandegrift, Marine Corps Commandant, look on.  From: Beth Gore.

title: A formal portrait of Tom C. Clark
Scopenote: A formal portrait of Tom Clark, Attorney General of the United States.  From: Beth Gore

title: A photo of Joseph B. Chifley, Prime Minister of Australia
Scopenote: Portrait of Joseph B. Chifley, former Treasury Minister and Post-war Reconstruction Administrator, who was appointed Prime Minister of Australia to succeed the late John Curtin.  He had been acting Premier during the latter's illness.  From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman arrives in Antwerp, Belgium, aboard the U. S. S. Augusta
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman arrives in Antwerp, Belgium, aboard the U. S. S. Augusta, en route to the "Big Three" meeting in Potsdam, Germany. He doffs his hat to the colors as he steps down the gangplank. The President is followed by Secretary of State James F. Byrnes.   From Beth Gore

title: Retiring Secretary of Treasury Henry Morgenthau bidding goodbye to Treasury employees
Scopenote: Retiring Secretary of Treasury Henry Morgenthau bidding goodbye to Treasury employees. He is shown shaking hands with Betty Gibson of Fredonia, Kansas.  From: Beth Gore

title: John W. Snyder taking the oath of office as War Mobilization and Reconversion Director
Scopenote: John W. Snyder, RFC Director, taking the oath of office as War Mobilization and Reconversion Director, replacing Fred M. Vinson, who had just become Secretary of the Treasury. Left to Right: John Snyder, Fred Vinson, and Chief Justice Lawrence Groner of the Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia. From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of General Jacob L. Devers, Chief of the Army Ground Forces
Scopenote: General Jacob L. Devers, Chief of the Army Ground Forces, telling newsmen during a press conference that he hoped to put 7,000,000 men into a single Pacific punch at the Japanese.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Commander Harold E. Stassen, USNR, at a press conference
Scopenote: Commander Harold E. Stassen, USNR Aide and Flag Secretary to Admiral William F. Halsey, USN, at a press conference in the Navy Department. He urged a strong Navy after the war and commented on the over-optimism about the war and defeatism about the peace on the home front.  Commander Stassen, who resigned as Governor of Minnesota to join the Navy, had the highest praise for the matter-of-fact fighting patriotism of our soldiers, sailors, and marines all around the globe.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of a meeting of three government chiefs with Tom Clark
Scopenote: Photo of a meeting of four government heads formulating plans to assault black market operators and tax evaders. Left to right: Acting Office of Price Administration Administrator James G. Rogers, Jr., Attorney General Tom C. Clark, Secretary of the Treasury Fred M. Vinson and Secretary of Agriculture Clinton N. Anderson. From: Beth Gore.

title: A portrait of Dr. Vannevar Bush
Scopenote: Dr. Vannevar Bush, Director, Office of Scientific and Research Development, posed for this Harris and Ewing portrait a few days ago.  From: Beth Gore

title: General Jonathan Wainwright drinking coffee
Scopenote: After addressing the House today, General Jonathan M. Wainwright stopped to have a cup of coffee with Speaker Sam Rayburn (not in picture) and other members before going to the White House.  From: Beth Gore.

title: General Jonathan Wainwright addressing House of representatives
Scopenote: General Jonathan M. Wainwright today told the House of Representatives that only "the memory and hope of America" sustained him and his men through the dark days of their confinement and the "inhuman treatment" by the enemy. The General was given a thunderous ovation by members of the House.  Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn is seated behind General Wainwright.  From: Beth Gore.

title: General Jonathan Wainwright addressing House of Representatives
Scopenote: A general view picturing General Jonathan M. Wainwright addressing the House of Representatives today. The members gave the hero of Corregidor a great ovation during his visit to the Chamber. Speaker Sam Rayburn is shown on the rostrum behind of General Wainwright. From: Beth Gore

title: Welcoming crowd for General Johnathan Wainwright
Scopenote: A view from the Washington Monument showing the huge crowd which turned out to give General Johnathan Wainwright a hero's reception, today, in the nation's capital.  The shadow of the monument can be seen in the corner of picture.  From: Beth Gore.

title: General Jonathan Wainwright with Mrs. Wainwright greeted while riding up Constitution Ave
Scopenote: General Jonathan M. Wainwright, hero of Corregidor, with Mrs. Wainwright rides up historic Constitution Avenue to the cheers of thousands at a huge civic reception here today.   From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman congratulates Secretary of State James F. Byrnes after presenting him with the Distinguished Service Medal
Scopenote: Left to right:  President Harry S. Truman, Genera George C. Marshall, Secretary of State James F. Byrnes, and General Hap Arnold.  President Truman congratulates Secretary of State James F. Byrnes after presenting him with the Distinguished Service Medal for three years of service as Director of the Office of War Mobilization. General George C. Marshall, U. S. Chief of Staff, and General H. H. Arnold, Commanding General, Army Air Forces, seem elated over the award.

title: President Harry S. Truman presenting the Distinguished Service Medal to James F. Byrnes
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman presents the Distinguished Service Medal to Secretary of State James F. Byrnes for his three years of service as director of the Office of War Mobilization. The ceremony took place on the South Lawn of the White House. Left to right: General George C. Marshall, U. S. Military Chief of Staff; President Truman; Secretary Byrnes; Robert P. Patterson, Undersecretary of War (obscured); Mrs. Byrnes; and Admiral William Leahy, Personal Chief of Staff to the President.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Press Secretary Charles G. Ross holding a press conference
Scopenote: This scene of Presidential Press Secretary Charles G. Ross holding a press conference with reporters was repeated many times after reports came to the White House of the imminent surrender of the Japanese.  From: Beth Gore.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Retiring Secret Service Officer
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) talks with retiring Secret Service agent James E. Sloan, Jr. (right). Original caption: James E. Sloan, Jr., (Jimmy to his many newspaper friends), who while with the Secret Service guarded Presidents from Theodore Roosevelt to Harry Truman, said goodbye to the White House on  this date, ending 32 years of duty. He is shown here with President Harry S. Truman in the Oval Office.  From: Beth Gore

title: Myron C. Taylor at White House
Scopenote: Myron C. Taylor, the Presidential special envoy to the Vatican, conferred with President Truman today on what he called "many subjects."  Mr. Taylor, who returned to the United States last month, would not tell reporters whether he plans to return to Rome or has other plans for the future.  From: Beth Gore

title: General Omar Bradley shaking hands with Senator Robert Wagner
Scopenote: General Omar Bradley, new Veterans Administrator, is shown being greeted by Senator Robert Wagner, New York, Chairman of the Senate Banking Committee.  From: Beth Gore

title: President Truman awarding the Congressional Medal of Honor to Staff Sergeant James R. Hendrix
Scopenote: Youngest of the group of 28 to receive Congressional Medal of Honor awards at the White House was Staff Sergeant James R. Hendrix of Lepanto, Arkansas. Staff Sergeant Hendrix, shown getting his award from President Harry S. Truman, was 19 years old at the time he earned his medal. The former farm boy wiped out two enemy artillery positions and saved the lives of three of his comrades when his outfit was assigned the task of breaking through the Belgian town of Assenois and relieving the besieged garrison at Bastogne.  From: Beth Gore.

title: General Charles DeGaulle, Provisional President of France, placing a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier
Scopenote: General Charles DeGaulle, Provisional President of France, placing a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier. It was the first ceremony at the Tomb since peace was declared.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of General Charles DeGaulle presenting the French Grand Croix De La Legion to five Army and Navy officers
Scopenote: Five Army and Navy heads of the U. S. were presented with the French Grand Croix De La Legion, a honor by General Charles DeGaulle (center), Provisional President of France, in ceremonies at the French Embassy. Photo shows DeGaulle, left, making the presentation to Admiral William D. Leahy, left, as General George C. Marshall, Admiral Ernest J. King, General H. H. Arnold and General Brehon Somervell, look on.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Henry A. Wallace, Secretary of Commerce, preparing to testify before Senate
Scopenote: Former Vice President Henry A. Wallace, now Secretary of Commerce, came to the Senate today as a witness before the Senate Banking and Currency Committee. He is shown here discussing the bill on jobs for all.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Edwin Pauley holding a press conference
Scopenote: Edwin Pauley, United States member of the Reparations Commission, as he held a press conference at the White House.   From: Beth Gore

title: Dean Acheson in his office
Scopenote: Latest informal photo of the new Under Secretary of State, Dean Acheson, made in his office this morning.  From:   Beth Gore

title: Photo of William F. Knowland being sworn in as Senator from California by Senator Kenneth McKellar
Scopenote: Photo of William F. Knowland (left), former Army Major appointed by Governor Earl Warren to succeed the late Hiram Johnson as Senator from California, being sworn in by Senator Kenneth McKellar (right), President Pro-Tempore of the Senate. Senator Sheridan Downey, senior Senator from California, is shown in center of picture. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photograph of Donald Russell, Assistant Secretary of State
Scopenote: Photograph of Donald Russell, Assistant Secretary of State.  From: Beth Gore.

title: News conference With W. Willard Wirtz
Scopenote: Reporters crowd around Chairman W. Willard Wirtz of the Wage Stabilization Board for news of the Maritime strike.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of the funeral parade for Vice Admiral John S. McCain
Scopenote: The body of Vice Admiral John S. McCain is carried in full honor through Arlington National Cemetery where he was buried following services in Fort Myer Chapel. McCain died of battle fatigue following his return to this country from highly successful carrier aircraft supervision in the Pacific.  From: Beth Gore.

title: The lowering of the body of Vice Admiral John S. McCain prior to funeral services and burial in Arlington National Cemetery
Scopenote: The body of Vice Admiral John S. McCain, who died on the coast of "battle fatigue" after returning to this country from carrier aircraft work in the Pacific, is lowered to the ground at Washington National Airport after an air trip from California. Funeral services were held this date and burial was in Arlington National Cemetery.  From: Beth Gore

title: General Jonathan Wainwright with Medal of Honor
Scopenote: General Jonathan Wainwright, wearing his Congressional Medal of Honor, presented to him yesterday by President Harry S. Truman, is shown with Mrs. Wainwright leaving the White House in a convertible following the presentation.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Representatives of England and the United States Holding Discussions on Economic Problems
Scopenote: Photo taken at the State Department where representatives of England and the United States were holding discussions on economic problems. Left to right: Leo T. Crowley, Foreign Economic Administration head; the Earl of Halifax, Ambassador to the United States from Great Britain; Assistant Secretary of State Will Clayton; Lord John Maynard Keynes, Economic Advisor to the British Treasury; and Secretary of Commerce Henry A. Wallace.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Col. Wallace Graham at the White House
Scopenote: New physician to President Truman is Col. Wallace Harry Graham, shown at the White House.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Under Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson appearing before the Senate Military Affairs Committee
Scopenote: Under Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson told the Senate Military Affairs Committee that the Army expects to discharge six million men by next July 1 under the point system. He vigorously defended the demobilization program and said that although some mistakes may have been made in the past the overall job will be carried out fairly and justly.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Collage of photographs of General Jonathan Wainwright at Baseball Game
Scopenote: General Jonathan Wainwright, back in this country after having been a prisoner of the Japs, finds it is the same America and that he is still a top fan.  This collage of pictures made at last night's Washington-Cleveland game shows the General really taking his baseball--and the trimmings that go with it--seriously.  Here he is shown being greeted by Senator-Baseball Commissioner Albert B. Chandler, eating a hot dog, scratching his neck, smoking a pipe and a cigarette, and autographing a baseball.  From: Beth Gore.

title: President and Mrs. Truman departing Washington with Senator Alben W. Barkley
Scopenote: Left to right:  Senator Alben Barkley, Bess Truman, and President Harry S. Truman.  President Truman and Mrs. Truman are leaving Washington for a weekend at their home in Independence, Missouri.  Senator Alben W. Barkley, Kentucky, Senate Majority Leader, was in the party and will leave the plane at Paducah, Kentucky, where he is scheduled to speak this weekend.  The President and Mrs. Truman and the Senator are shown at Washington National Airport prior to boarding their plane.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Paul V. McNutt being sworn in as High Commissioner of the Philippines
Scopenote: In a simple ceremony in his apartment at the Shoreham, Paul V. McNutt (right) was sworn in as High Commissioner of the Philippines by Justice Richard S. Whaley, Chief Justice of the Court of Claims.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of High Commissioner of the Philippines Paul V. McNutt and Brigadier General Carlos P. Romulo, Resident Commissioner
Scopenote: Commissioner of the Philippines Paul V. McNutt, left, receives the congratulations of Brigadier General Carlos P. Romulo, right, resident Commissioner.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of President Truman holding a conference with Robert P. Patterson, Secretary of War
Scopenote: Photo of President Harry S. Truman holding a conference in the Oval Office with his latest cabinet member, Robert P. Patterson, Secretary of War.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Portrait of Col. Wallace Graham
Scopenote: Portrait of Col. Wallace Graham, recently appointed President Truman's personal doctor.  From: Beth Gore

title: Portrait of Mrs. John W. Snyder
Scopenote: Portrait of Mrs. John W. Snyder, wife of the head of the Office of War Mobilization and Reconversion.  From: Beth Gore

title: A Photograph of Harold Burton and his Wife
Scopenote: A photo of Associate Justice of the U. S. Supreme Court Harold H. Burton and his wife.  The picture was taken at a social event in the Capital.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Chief Justice Harlan F. Stone speaking with Harold H. Burton
Scopenote: Photo of Chief Justice, United States Supreme Court, Harlan F. Stone (left) with newly appointed Associate Justice Senator Harold H. Burton of Ohio.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of President Sergio Osmena of the Philippines and Paul V. McNutt, U. S. Commissioner of the Philippines
Scopenote: Photo of President of the Commonwealth of the Philippines Sergio Osmena (right) arriving in this country for discussions on the rebuilding of his country.  He is shown at Washington National Airport being greeted by Paul V. McNutt, Commissioner of the Philippines.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Associate Justice Harold Burton putting on his justice robes
Scopenote: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court Harold H. Burton, former Ohio Senator, puts on his Justice robes with the aid of Earl Hart, Mr. Burton's secretary in the Senate for 10 years.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Dean Acheson with Spruille Braden
Scopenote: The Senate Foreign Relations Committee broke up in apparent disagreement today after hearing the views of Spruille Braden, newly nominated Assistant Secretary of State for Latin American Affairs, on the South American situation.  Chairman Connally would make no comment on the meeting or on the fate of Braden's nomination.  Braden, left, is shown with Acting Secretary of State Dean Acheson just before the meeting got underway.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Admiral Chester Nimitz addressing a joint session of Congress
Scopenote: In an address to a joint session of Congress today, Admiral Chester Nimitz called on his countrymen to make certain that "no future war may ever again find us unprepared." Admiral Nimitz received a tumultuous greeting from members of Congress when he arrived at the Capitol for the address. On the rostrum are Speaker Sam Rayburn (R) and Senator Kenneth McKellar (L), President Pro Tempore of the Senate. From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman with Medal of Honor Recipient Sgt. William G. Harrell
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with Sgt. William G. Harrell of Rio Grande City, TX, during the Medal of Honor ceremony on the South Lawn of the White House. Harrell received the decoration for gallantry in killing at least five Japanese while defending his command post despite critical injuries to both hands and grenade injuries to his leg and side. The action took place on Iwo Jima. From: Beth Gore

title: The House Chamber as Admiral Chester Nimitz addressed a joint session
Scopenote: The House Chamber as Admiral Chester Nimitz addressed a joint session of the Senate and House.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Admiral Nimitz, seated on the back of his car, driving down Pennsylvania Avenue
Scopenote: Admiral Nimitz, seated on the back of his car, acknowledging the cheers of thousands who lined historic Pennsylvania Avenue to welcome the hero.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Carolyn Brown Kisses Medal of Honor Recipient Pfc. Jacklyn H. Lucas
Scopenote: Pfc. Jacklyn H. Lucas, 17, of Belhaven, NC, is congratulated by his girlfriend Carolyn Brown on the South Lawn of the White House after he received the Congressional Medal of Honor from President Harry S. Truman. Pfc. Lucas joined the Marines at the age of 14 and was wounded when he covered two grenades with his body on Iwo Jima. From: Beth Gore

title: President Truman awarding Admiral Chester Nimitz the Gold Star
Scopenote: Admiral Chester Nimitz at the White House where President Harry S. Truman (left) decorated the Naval hero with the Gold Star in lieu of a third Distinguished Service Medal. Mrs. Nimitz is shown in center.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Admiral Chester Nimitz being awarded the Philippine Medal of Valor
Scopenote: Photo of President Sergio Osmena of the Philippines, left, awarding the Medal for Valor, highest Philippine decoration, to Fleet Admiral Chester W. Nimitz, center, as Admiral Ernest J. King, right, looks on.  From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman Shaking Hands with Eagle Scout in Caruthersville, Missouri
Scopenote: Photo of President Harry S. Truman shaking hands with Bobby Joplin, 14, after awarding him the Eagle Scout Badge at breakfast ceremonies in the Majestic Hotel, Caruthersville, Missouri, where the President went to attend an American Legion Fair on October 7th.  From: Beth Gore.

title: General Harry Vaughan Holding Book
Scopenote: Portrait of General Harry Vaughan with book.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Rep. Andrew J. May and Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson
Scopenote: Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson urged the House Military Affairs Committee to speed action on a bill to establish a nine-man commission to control domestic research in the development of atomic energy. Atomic energy, Patterson declared, is too big for any one government agency to handle, and the War Department wants to be relieved of its responsibility. Photo shows left to right, Rep. Andrew J. May (D-KY) Chairman of the House Military Affairs Committee, and Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photograph of John D. Small, Civilian Production Administrator
Scopenote: Photograph of John D. Small, Civilian Production Administrator.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Shown with President Truman is William J. O'Dwyer, Democratic candidate for Mayor of New York
Scopenote: Shown with President Harry S. Truman (left) in the Oval Office is William J. O'Dwyer, Democratic candidate for Mayor of New York.   From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman Awards the Medal of Honor to 1st Lt. Edward A. Silk
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman awards the Medal of Honor to 1st Lt. Edward A. Silk, Combat Infantry Officer from Johnstown, PA on the South Lawn of the White House. Silk received the award for bravery when he singlehandedly eliminated an enemy stronghold in a farmhouse in Germany. From: Beth Gore

title: President Truman Presents Congressional Medals of Honor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman presents the Congressional Medal of Honor to one of 15 members of Army Ground Forces in ceremonies on the South Lawn of the White House. The recipients are seated bottom left, guests are seated right, and a crowd of photographers is on the left. From: Beth Gore.

title: Alice Magliochetti with Congressional Medal of Honor Recipient Sgt. Freeman V. Horner
Scopenote: Sgt. Freeman V. Horner of Shamokin, PA, after receiving the Congressional Medal of Honor in a ceremony on the South Lawn of the White House. His girlfriend, Alice Magliochetti of Kulpmont, PA, is shown combing his hair after the ceremony. In the center is Rose Anoia Horner of Kulpmont, PA. From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of President Juan Antonio Rios of Chile placing a wreath on the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier
Scopenote: Photo of President Juan Antonio Rios of Chile placing a wreath on the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier. He is in this country for conferences.  From: Beth Gore.

title: A Portrait of Harold Burton
Scopenote: Latest portrait of the new Associate Justice of the Supreme Court, Harold Burton, former Senator of Ohio.

title: Photo of Major General Patrick J. Hurley with President Truman and Secretary of State James F. Byrnes
Scopenote: Photo of Major General Patrick J. Hurley, U. S. Ambassador to China (right), conferring with President Harry S. Truman and Secretary of State James F. Byrnes. The trio are shown here in the President's office.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Wincenty Rzymowski of the Polish Provisional Government of National Unity signing the United Nations Charter
Scopenote: The Polish Provisional Government of National Unity became the 51st nation to sign the United Nations Charter.  Minister for Foreign Affairs Wincenty Rzymowski, right, is shown signing the charter as Secretary of State James F. Byrnes, left, looks on.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of General Carlos P. Romulo of the Philippines with Paul V. McNutt, High Commissioner of the Philippines, and Rep. C. Jasper Bell (Missouri)
Scopenote: General Carlos P. Romulo, resident Commissioner of the Commonwealth of the Philippines, appeared before the House Ways and Means Committee on future trade relations between the U. S. and the Philippine Islands. Left to right, Paul V. McNutt, High Commissioner of the Philippines; Congressman C. Jasper Bell, Missouri; and General Romulo.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Attorney General Tom Clark (Left) and Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach
Scopenote: Attorney General Tom Clark (Left), shown at the White House congratulating Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach, after the coal strike had been called off and orders issued by John L. Lewis for the miners to return to work.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of President Truman greeting Brazilian military officers while Ambassador Carlos Martins looks on
Scopenote: Photo of Major Gen. Joao Batista Mascarenhas, Commanding General of the Brazilian Expeditionary Force in Italy, accompanied by a group of officers of the Brazilian Army, in this country for a two week visit, called on President Truman at the White House. Left to right are President Truman shaking hands with General Mascarenhas as Ambassador Carlos Martins (L) looks on. Back row, left to right, are Brig. Gen. Zenobio Da Costa and Air Brigadier Antonio Appel Netto. From: Beth Gore

title: Portrait of John G. Adams in military uniform
Scopenote: John G. Adams of Sioux Falls, South Dakota, who as a Major in the Infantry has recently been discharged after three years of overseas service in six major campaigns, has been appointed director of a newly created Division of Young Republican Activities. He will assume his duties at Washington on November 1. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Benjamin V. Cohen
Scopenote: Informal photo of Ben Cohen, Legal Counselor of the State Department.  From: Beth Gore.

title: General Alexander A. Vandegrift Before Senate Committee
Scopenote: General Alexander A. Vandegrift, the fighting Marine Commandant, appearing before a Senate Committee today, strongly opposed the merger of the Army and the Navy into a single department. From: Beth Gore.

title: James F. Byrnes signing United Nations protocol
Scopenote: Secretary of State James F. Byrnes signs protocol proclaiming the Charter of the United Nations on World Security a law of the nations. The original United Nations Charter, signed by fifty-one nations, was drawn up at the conference in San Francisco last April.  From: Beth Gore

title: Spruille Braden's official swearing in as Assistant Secretary of State
Scopenote: Spruille Braden being sworn in as Assistant Secretary of State in charge of American Republic Affairs.  Left to right:  Supreme Court Justice Stanley Reed, Under Secretary of State Dean Acheson, Spruille Braden, and Secretary of State James Byrnes.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of State James F. Byrnes with Assistant Secretary of State Spruille Braden
Scopenote: Secretary of State James F. Byrnes (left) in a discussion with his new Assistant Secretary of State, Spruille Braden, following Braden's swearing in.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Mrs. Anna Rosenberg being presented the Medal of Freedom by Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson
Scopenote: Mrs. Anna Rosenberg, New York City, today became the first American citizen to receive the recently authorized Medal of Freedom.  The medal was presented to Mrs. Rosenberg by Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson.  The award was given on the recommendation of General of the Army Dwight D. Eisenhower in recognition of Mrs. Rosenberg's work overseas.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Fred Vinson, Secretary of the Treasury, During Broadcast
Scopenote: Secretary of the Treasury Fred M. Vinson in a Sunday night nationwide broadcast, opened the Victory Loan Drive.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of State James F. Byrnes speaking with his assistant Spruille Braden
Scopenote: Photo shows Secretary of State James F. Byrnes (left) with his new Assistant Secretary of State Spruille Braden studying maps, following Braden's being sworn in.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Mrs. Harry Vaughan
Scopenote: Portrait of Mrs. Margaret P. Vaughan, wife of General Harry Vaughan, military aide to President Harry S. Truman.  From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman radio address
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman again took to the air waves tonight, discussing the administration's wage-price policy.  It was described as one of the most important speeches of his career in the domestic field.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Photo of Oveta Culp Hobby, former Colonel and Director of the Women's Army Corps
Scopenote: Photo of Oveta Culp Hobby, former Colonel and Director of the Women's Army Corps, at the White House.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of John L. Lewis Entering the White House
Scopenote: John L. Lewis, President of the United Mine Workers, entering the White House for a conference with President Truman.  It was Mr. Lewis's first visit to the White House in four years.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Edward U. Condon Takes the Oath of Office as Director of the National Bureau of Standards
Scopenote: Dr. Edward U. Condon (right) takes the oath of office as Director of the National Bureau of Standards, Department of Commerce, succeeding Dr. Lyman J. Briggs who retired after a half century of government service. Secretary of Commerce Henry A. Wallace (left) performs the oath.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Edward U. Condon, Director of the National Bureau of Standards
Scopenote: Latest informal photo of Edward U. Condon, new Director of the National Bureau of Standards, Department of Commerce.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of William Green (L) President of the A.F.L., and John L. Lewis, President of the United Mine Workers
Scopenote: Long labor rivals, John L. Lewis (right), the United Mine Workers President, and William Green, President of the A.F.L., are shown at the opening session of the Labor-Management conference. From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman and Secretary of Agriculture Clinton P. Anderson
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and a member of his cabinet, Secretary of Agriculture Clinton P. Anderson, matched five dollar bills this morning at the White House to see who would pay for the first sheet of the 39th Annual Christmas Seals of the National Tuberculosis Association.  The Secretary was at one time engaged in tuberculosis control work and served as executive of the New Mexico Tuberculosis Association in 1919.  President Truman lost the match.  From:   Beth Gore

title: Photo of John L. Lewis at a Labor-Management Conference
Scopenote: John L. Lewis (standing), President of the United Mine Workers, gets his point across at a Labor-Management Conference.    From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach after testifying before the House Executive Expenditures Committee
Scopenote: Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach after testifying on full employment before the House Executive Expenditures Committee. He is shown here with Rep. Carter Manasco of Alabama.  From: Beth Gore

title: New Under Secretary of War Kenneth C. Royall taking the oath of office
Scopenote: The new Under Secretary of War Kenneth C. Royall took the oath of office in ceremonies at the Pentagon.  The oath was given by Associate Supreme Court Justice Felix Frankfurter as Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson looked on.  From: Beth Gore

title: Secretary of State James Byrnes and General Harry Vaughan welcoming Prime Minister Clement Attlee
Scopenote: Secretary of State James F. Byrnes, General Harry Vaughan, President Truman's military aide, and Prime Minister Clement Attlee (at far left) shortly after Mr. Attlee's arrival at the airport.  from: Beth Gore

title: Former Attorney General Francis Biddle
Scopenote: Former Attorney General Francis Biddle, representing the United States on the International Military Tribunal that will try 20 former Nazi leaders at Nuremberg, Germany, works at his desk in preparation for the war crimes trial.  From: Beth Gore.

title: British Prime Minister Clement Attlee Addressing a Joint Session of Congress
Scopenote: General view of British Prime Minister Clement Attlee addressing Congress at a joint session this noon when he told members that civilization can survive the Atomic Bomb only if the nations accept the Christian principle of man's brotherhood.  From:   Beth Gore.

title: Admiral Chester Nimitz as he appeared before the Senate Military Affairs Committee
Scopenote: Admiral Nimitz is voicing his determined opposition to either a merger of the Army and Navy or the creation of an independent Air Force. He appeared before the Senate Military Affairs Committee.   From: Beth Gore

title: Admiral Chester Nimitz as he appeared before Congress
Scopenote: Admiral Chester Nimitz told Congress that he favored closer cooperation between the Army, the Navy and the State Department than existed at Pearl Harbor. However, he opposed an Army-Navy merger or the establishment of a separate Air Force. Reversing his stand of a year ago, Nimitz told the Senate Military Affairs Committee it was now his studied opinion that a merger of the Army and Navy "means at best no more advantages than we have now, at worst that the Navy, and the Command of the Seas so vital to our country, will suffer".  From: Beth Gore

title: Maurice Tobin Before House Committee on Agriculture
Scopenote: Governor Maurice J. Tobin, Massachusetts, shown testifying before the House Committee on Agriculture.  Tobin seeks to have the Parker River, Massachusetts National Wildlife Refuge abolished and seeks to restore 400 families to their farmlands.  From: Beth Gore

title: Eugene Meyer, publisher of the Washington Post, appearing before Congress
Scopenote: Shown fourth from the left is Eugene Meyer, publisher of the Washington Post, asking Congress to approve further funds for UNRRA (United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Agency) without any restrictions which "would tend to delay or possibly complete obstruct" the organization's work.  At far right is House Foreign Affairs Committee Chairman Rep. Sol Bloom of New York.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Brazilian presidential candidate General Eurico Gasper Dutra
Scopenote: Photo of candidate General Eurico Gasper Dutra, Partido Social Democratico Nominee for President of Brazil, in an election held December 2, 1945,   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Admiral William D. Leahy (R) talking to Admiral James O. Richardson
