Scopenote: Admiral William D. Leahy, Chief of Staff to the Commander in Chief of the United States Army and Navy, (right) shown at the Pearl Harbor hearing today talking to Admiral James O. Richardson, who was Commander in Chief of the United States fleet in 1940.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of the Earl of Halifax, British Ambassador to the U.S., and various U. S. military leaders
Scopenote: Photo of the Earl of Halifax, British Ambassador to the United States, making an official presentation to U. S. military leaders at the British Embassy on behalf of King George VI, the Insignia of Honorary Knight Grand Cross of the Military Division of the Most Honorable Order of the Bath. Left to Right, General H. H. Arnold, Chief of the Army Air Forces; Admiral Ernest J. King, Chief of Naval Operations; Earl of Halifax; General George C. Marshall, Chief of Staff of the U. S. Army and Admiral William D. Leahy, Chief of Staff to the Commander in Chief of the Army and Navy.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Admiral Ernest J. King (Left), and Admiral Chester Nimitz
Scopenote: Admiral Ernest J. King, Chief of Naval Operations, offers his congratulations to Admiral Chester Nimitz, who will take over King's post.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of President Truman and the Dean of Canterbury in the Oval Office
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman had a distinguished English visitor today, the Dean of Canterbury. They are shown together in the President's office.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Senator Alben W. Barkley (R) greeting former Secretary of State Cordell Hull
Scopenote: Committee Chairman Senator Alben W. Barkley of the Pearl Harbor Investigating Committee greets former Secretary of State Cordell Hull, who was today's witness.  From: Beth Gore

title: Former Under-Secretary of State Sumner Welles
Scopenote: Former Under-Secretary of State Sumner Welles as he appeared today before the Pearl Harbor Committee on Capitol Hill.

title: Former Secretary of State Cordell Hull being sworn before the Senate Pearl Harbor Investigating Committee
Scopenote: Former Secretary of State Cordell Hull told the Pearl Harbor Investigating Committee that the United States had not addressed any pre-Pearl Harbor ultimatum to Japan, asserting that it was Japan's proposal to this country which was an unacceptable ultimatum. He is shown here being sworn in prior to his testimony.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of former Undersecretary of State Joseph C. Grew being sworn in at the Pearl Harbor investigation
Scopenote: Former Undersecretary of State Joseph C. Grew as he was sworn in for testimony at the Pearl Harbor investigation.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Former Secretary of State Cordell Hull appearing before the Pearl Harbor Investigating Committee
Scopenote: It takes a lot of paper work to take the stand in the Pearl Harbor probe. Here former Secretary of State Cordell Hull unloads a flock of papers in preparation for this hearing.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of former Secretary of State Cordell Hull and Mrs. Hull
Scopenote: Former Secretary of State Cordell Hull is shown with his wife.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Admiral Chester W. Nimitz (R) and Sen. Thomas C. Hart (Connecticut)
Scopenote: Admiral Chester W. Nimitz came to Capitol Hill today to see Senator Thomas C. Hart, of Connecticut. Former Admiral Hart commanded the Pacific fleet. "I just came in to see my old boss and friend," Nimitz said.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Paul V. McNutt being greeted by Philippine President Sergio Osmena
Scopenote: Paul V. McNutt (left) is greeted on porch of High Commissioner's residence at Manila as he arrives to take over duties of High Commissioner, by President Sergio Osmena. Mr. Osmena had arrived the day before to resume his position as President of the Philippines.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Tom Clark and Joseph D. Keenan
Scopenote: Joseph B. Keenan, Chief of Counsel on Major Japanese War Crimes prosecution (left), talks with Attorney General Tom Clark (right).  From: Beth Gore.

title: Dr. Vannevar Bush speaking to the Senate Atomic Committee
Scopenote: Dr. Vannevar Bush today warned Congress that it would "disastrous" to seek to outlaw the atomic bomb before a strong international control agency is in operation. He appeared before the Senate Atomic Committee.  From: Beth Gore

title: Madame Henri Bonnet and TWA President Jack Frye Christen Constellation Airplane
Scopenote: Madame Henri Bonnet, wife of the French Ambassador to the United States, is shown here with Jack Frye, President of TWA.  She is christening the Constellation airplane "The Paris Sky Chief" prior to the takeoff of a preview passenger flight to Paris, marking the debut of the 300 mile an hour Lockheed Constellation as a luxury liner of the skyways for TWA.  Steam was used by Madame Bonnet to christen the plane.  From:  Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Senator Kenneth McKellar (TN) and four Quiz Kids
Scopenote: Senator Kenneth McKellar, Tennessee, President of the Senate, raises the hands of the victors, the youthful Quiz Kids in a bond show contest with four Senators at the Mayflower Hotel. Left to right are Robert Burke, 14; Harve Fischman, 15; the Senator; Joel Kupperman, 9; and Richard Williams, 15.  From: Beth Gore

title: AFL President William F. Green before the Senate
Scopenote: American Federation of Labor President William F. Green endorsing the Wagner-Ellender-Taft Housing Bill.  He also urged that the home purchase interest rate be reduced to 3 1/2% and that the maturity be extended from 25 to 32 years.  From: Beth Gore

title: Dr. Chaim Weizmann with Eliahu Epstein and Joseph Linton
Scopenote: President Truman met Dr. Chaim Weizmann, President, Hebrew University in Jerusalem today to discuss the Jewish/Palestine problem. Dr. Weizmann, center, is shown here leaving the White House. Left is Eliahu Epstein, the Jewish Agency's representative in Washington; and right is Joseph Linton, the Jewish Agency's representative in London. Both are political secretaries of the Council in their respective cities. From: Beth Gore.

title: Bess Truman opened booth sale of Christmas seals
Scopenote: Mrs. Harry S. Truman today opened the booth sale of Christmas Seals in the District by purchasing from Mrs. Paul D. Sleeper, volunteer booth worker, in the lobby of the Mayflower Hotel, the first 1945 Christmas Seals sold from booths.  Also shown in the photo is Dr. Walter K. Myers, Vice-President of the District of Columbia Board of Directors.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Ambassador to China Patrick J. Hurley Appearing Before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee
Scopenote: A crowded committee room greeted former Ambassador to China Patrick J. Hurley in his appearance before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee. Photo shows Hurley on the stand. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Senator Tom Connally Greeting Former Ambassador to China Patrick J. Hurley
Scopenote: Senator Tom Connally, (D-Texas), Chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, greets former Ambassador to China Patrick J. Hurley (right) prior to Hurley's appearance before the Committee.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Former Ambassador to China, Patrick J. Hurley Appearing Before Congress
Scopenote: Former Ambassador to China, Patrick J. Hurley, told Congress that he would have remained as Ambassador if Secretary James F. Byrnes had publicly clarified American foreign policy as he did yesterday in a letter to Rep. Jack Z. Anderson.  From: Beth Gore.

title: William Green, President of the AFL, shown leaving the White House
Scopenote: William Green, President of the American Federation of Labor, is shown leaving the White House after a conference with President Truman.  From: Beth Gore

title: Patrick J. Hurley with Senator Styles Bridges Before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee
Scopenote: Photo of former Ambassador to China Patrick J. Hurley in his second day before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee. Here he is shown with Senator Styles Bridges (left), New Hampshire, a committee member.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Patrick J. Hurley, the Former Ambassador to China
Scopenote: Photo of Patrick J. Hurley, the former Ambassador to China, taking the stand before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of UMW President John L. Lewis with Rep. Robert Ramspeck
Scopenote: United Mine Workers President John L. Lewis after appearing before the House Labor Committee.  Shown at left is Rep. Robert Ramspeck, Georgia.  Mr. Lewis had denounced President Truman's bill to set up fact-finding boards in major labor disputes as "an evil, foul-smelling mess", which he didn't think could be "poured down the throats of the American people".  He said that this bill would be the first drastic thrust of the knife of absolutism into the heart of a free America and an attempt to place labor in legislative irons."  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of President Truman and Ralph K. Davies
Scopenote: President Truman today awarded the new civilian Medal of Merit to Ralph K. Davies, Petroleum Administrator for War, in Ceremonies at the oval office.  This is similar to 89-113.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Polish Ambassador Dr. Oskar Lange talking with Acting Secretary of State Dean Acheson
Scopenote: Photo of Dr. Oskar Lange (left), Polish Ambassador to the United States, shown at the State Department with Acting Secretary of State Dean Acheson.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Senator Elbert Thomas, profile, in chair
Scopenote: Latest informal photo of Senator Elbert Thomas, Democrat, Utah. Senator Thomas is chairman of the Senate Military Affairs Committee who will bring Army and Navy leaders together in a conference on merger problems shortly. From: Beth Gore.

title: Medal of Honor Recipient Capt. Robert H. Dunlap Kisses Mary Louise Frantz
Scopenote: After the Medal of Honor ceremony on the South Lawn of the White House, Captain Robert H. Dunlap, USMCR, 25, kisses his new wife, Mary Louise Frantz. Dunlap received the Congressional Medal of Honor for heroism during the seizure of Iwo Jima. At the time of the photo, he and his wife of one week were on their honeymoon. From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of General Motors Counsel Appearing Before President Truman's Fact-Finding Panel
Scopenote: General Motors Corporation, through it's Counsel, Walter G. Merritt, pictured here, told President Harry S. Truman's fact-finding panel that it will withdraw from the proceedings if the panel considers prices and profits in making a wage recommendation for settlement of the strike against the company.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Walter Reuther Before Fact Finding Panel on General Motors
Scopenote: Walter Reuther, Vice President of the United Auto Workers and Head of General Motors UAW Department, as he appeared before a fact-finding panel.  From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman leaves Washington for Missouri
Scopenote: President Truman waves to photographers, despite a pouring rain, as he leaves for a hometown Christmas. The President flew to Missouri despite bad flying weather.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Portrait of Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach
Scopenote: Portrait of Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach.  From: Beth Gore

title: Portrait of Rep. Helen Gahagan Douglas (D. CA)
Scopenote: Glamorous portrait of Rep. Helen Gahagan Douglas (D. CA).  From: Beth Gore.

title: General Omar Bradley and Fred M. Vinson
Scopenote: Secretary of the Treasury Fred M. Vinson with General Omar Bradley, head of the Veterans Administration. The topic is veteran's tax problems. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Dean Virginia Gildersleeve addressing a Russian relief rally at Madison Square Garden
Scopenote: Dean Virginia Gildersleeve, only U.S. woman delegate to the United Nations Organization Conference in San Francisco, addresses a Russian relief rally at Madison Square Garden which launched the agency's 1946 campaign for $25,000,000 worth of medical supplies, hospital equipment, food, clothing and other relief items.  Speaking before 19,000 people, Dean Gildersleeve urged an exchange of students and professors between the U.S.A. and the U.S.S.R. as an aid to promoting better understanding between the two countries.  From: Beth Gore
Institutional Creator: American Society for Russian Relief, Inc.

title: James K. Vardaman, Federal Reserve Board Nominee
Scopenote: Commodore James K. Vardaman Jr., President Harry S. Truman's nominee to be a member of the Federal Reserve Board, denied that he was in any way connected with the failure of the Vardaman Shoe Company of St. Louis, Missouri.  The President's Naval Aide endeavored to show the Senate Committee that he was not in operating control of the company at the time it was placed in receivership in 1942 or several months previously.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Seth W. Richardson, Chief Counsel of Pearl Harbor Investigating Committee
Scopenote: The Pearl Harbor Investigating Committee selected Seth W. Richardson, former Assistant Attorney General in the Hoover Administration, as its  chief counsel.  From: Beth Gore

title: W. Willard Wirtz at Desk
Scopenote: W. Willard Wirtz, new chairman of the new National Wage Stabilization Board, shown at his desk this morning. From: Beth Gore.

title: Wilson W. Wyatt, Federal Housing Expeditor
Scopenote: Wilson W. Wyatt, the new Federal House Expediter and former Mayor of Louisville, Kentucky, unpacks his brief case in preparation to taking over his tough Washington job. From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of State James F. Byrnes greets Italian Premier Alcide De Gasperi
Scopenote: Secretary of State James F. Byrnes, left, greets Premier Alcide De Gasperi of Italy at the State Department.  From:  Beth Gore.

title: Chief Justice Fred M. Vinson being aided with his robes by Robert H. Marshall
Scopenote: Chief Justice Fred M. Vinson being aided by Robert H. Marshall, the African American gentleman who robes all the Justices of the Supreme Court, at the opening of the Court today.  From:  Beth Gore

title: White House Press Secretary Charles Ross reading letters
Scopenote: President Truman's Press Secretary, Charles Ross, is shown reading letters from all over the country regarding the President's latest nation-wide radio address.  A survey shows that 85 percent of the letters favored the President's findings in the broadcast.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of U. S. Ambassador to Sweden Hershel V. Johnson
Scopenote: Photo of U. S. Ambassador to Sweden Hershel V. Johnson.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Foreign Minister Paul-Henri Spaak of Belgium
Scopenote: Foreign Minister Paul-Henri Spaak of Belgium was elected President of the United Nations Assembly on January 10th, as U.N.O. delegates met for the first time in London's Central Hall.  From: Beth Gore.

title: John Blandford, Wilson Wyatt, and John W. Snyder
Scopenote: This trio holds the strings in postwar housing and reconversion, left to right: John Blandford, Administrator, National Housing Agency; Wilson Wyatt, Housing Expediter; John W. Snyder, Director, Office of War Mobilization and Reconversion.  From:  Beth Gore

title: Wilson W. Wyatt, Housing Expeditor
Scopenote: President Truman's new Housing Expeditor, Wilson W. Wyatt, shown at the new Silver Springs, Maryland housing project, where he made an on the spot inspection of the Federal Public Housing Exhibit.  From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman giving Byron Price the Medal for Merit
Scopenote: Byron Price, head of the Office of Censorship, receiving the Medal for Merit award from President Truman in ceremonies at the White House.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of OES Director William H. Davis
Scopenote: Office of Economic Stabilization Director William H. Davis, also former head of the War Labor Board, telling Congress that "settlement of labor disputes by government is destructive of all the creative values of collective bargaining."  Compulsion, Davis said, should be used only in war time or in peace time cases involving public utilities.  From: Beth Gore.

title: CIO President Philip Murray at a press conference regarding the pending steel strike
Scopenote: CIO President Philip Murray as he told a press conference that a nation-wide steel strike "must take place" because U. S. Steel Corporation had rejected President Harry S. Truman's wage settlement.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Press Secretary Charles Ross at a press conference
Scopenote: White House Press Secretary Charles Ross shown telling the Press that President Harry S. Truman, aside from his appeal for reconsideration, has no further plans to avert the steel strike.  Mr. Ross specifically said that Government seizure of the steel industry so far had never been considered.  The President urged the cooperation "on the grounds of the public interest as well as good business" to reconsider and accept his settlement.  From: Beth Gore.

title: George E. Allen photograph
Scopenote: Most recent photograph of George E. Allen, one of President Truman's closest associates, who has been named director of RFC.   From: Beth Gore

title: Robert P. Patterson and General Carl Spaatz
Scopenote: Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson returned to Washington a few minutes before midnight tonight from his world tour. On hand to greet him was General Carl Spaatz, who has been named to replace retiring General H. H. Arnold as Chief of the Army Air Forces.

title: Charles E. Wilson, CEO of General Motors, testifies before Senate Labor Committee
Scopenote: President Charles E. Wilson of General Motors today condemned President Truman's proposed fact-finding legislation and called instead for a "principle-finding" board. Testifying before the Senate Labor Committee, Wilson said that any legislation intended to settle labor-management disputes should include a statement of principle under which the machinery would operate. From: Beth Gore.

title: Gerald L. K. Smith, Head of the American First Party, Before the House Un-American Activities Committee
Scopenote: Photo of Gerald L. K. Smith, head of the American First Party, asking the House Un-American Activities Committee to investigate Walter Winchell, Eddie Cantor, Frank Sinatra, Ingrid Bergman and Edward G. Robinson. "I am just an old-fashioned, Bible-believing, Christ-loving American," he said.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Norman M. Littell, former Assistant Attorney General
Scopenote: Norman M. Littell, former Assistant Attorney General who handled land condemnation proceedings, appeared before the Senate Naval Affairs Committee on the Edwin Pauley nomination.  From: Beth Gore.

title: OPA Administrator Chester Bowles speaking with reporters
Scopenote: Office of Price Administration Administrator Chester Bowles returned from his southern winter vacation today for a White House conference with President Truman and Reconversion Director John Snyder. Mr. Bowles, shown here talking with reporters, declined to comment on what had taken place. He would not admit that steel had been discussed, did not know when his report on steel prices would be handed to President Truman, said that his continuing as OPA Administrator had not been a subject of conversation, and replied "no comment" to all other questions asked by reporters. From: Beth Gore.

title: Charles E. Wilson after conference with President Truman
Scopenote: Charles E. Wilson, President of General Motors, whose 100,000 workers have been out on strike more than two weeks for a $2-a-day wage increase, shown leaving the White House after a conference this morning with President Truman.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Half Figure Photo of John L. Lewis
Scopenote: John L. Lewis, President of the United Mine Workers, posed for pictures after his operation.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Senator Scott W. Lucas of Illinois
Scopenote: This candid photo of Senator Scott W. Lucas was taken during a session of the Congressional Pearl Harbor Committee.  From: Beth Gore

title: Senator Brien McMahon, Democrat, of Connecticut
Scopenote: Latest informal photograph of Senator Brien McMahon, Democrat, of Connecticut. Senator McMahon is Chairman of the Senate Atomic Energy Committee.

title: Wilson W. Wyatt
Scopenote: Latest informal photo of Wilson W. Wyatt, former Mayor of Louisville, Kentucky, who is the new National Housing Administrator.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Chester Bowles and Paul Porter at a joint press conference
Scopenote: Chester Bowles, ex-Office of Price Administration chief and new Stabilization Director, shown at a chart as Paul Porter, new OPA head sits by his side, at their joint press conference tonight. From: Beth Gore.

title: Lieut. Gen. Walter Bedell Smith
Scopenote: Lieut. General Walter Bedell Smith after being named successor to Averell Harriman as Ambassador to Russia. Lieut. General Smith served as Chief of Staff for General Dwight D. Eisenhower in Europe.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Paul Porter shaking hands with Chester Bowles
Scopenote: Paul Porter (left), Office of Price Administration chief, and Chester Bowles, former OPA head and new Office of Economic Stabilization Chief, wish each other luck at their joint press conference.  Bowles urged the people of the nation to "back the President to the hilt in his courageous fight to protect the nation from the grave economic dangers we face."  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photograph of Chester Bowles
Scopenote: Chester Bowles, newly designated head of the Office of Economic Stabilization, warned Congress that the nation's economic system would be smashed "beyond hope of repair unless it extends price controls to keep the lid on the present inflationary dynamite." He urged the House Banking Committee to approve speedily a pending bill to continue the controls a year after the present June 30 expiration date. From: Beth Gore.

title: Chester Bowles before the House Banking Committee
Scopenote: Chester Bowles, newly designated head of the Office of Economic Stabilization, speaks before the House Banking Committee today.  He warned Congress that the nation's economic system would be smashed "beyond hope of repair unless it extends price controls to keep the lid on the present "inflationary dynamite."    This photo is similar to 99-91.  From:   Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of Navy James Forrestal
Scopenote: Secretary of Navy James Forrestal confirmed that he once suggested Gov. C. W. Darden, Virginia, for appointment as Under Secretary of Navy, as he appeared before the Senate Naval Affairs Committee.   From: Beth Gore

title: W. Willard Wirtz, Wage Stabilization Board
Scopenote: Latest portrait of W. Willard Wirtz, new Chairman of the National Wage Stabilization Board.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Interior Secretary Oscar Chapman at the White House
Scopenote: Acting Secretary of Interior Oscar Chapman shown at the White House where he was in conference with the President.

title: Photo of Admiral Chester Nimitz and Admiral Forrest P. Sherman at a press conference where they announced that Captain Charles B. McVay III had been found guilty in the sinking of the cruiser Indianapolis
Scopenote: A photo of Admiral Chester Nimitz (right), Chief of Naval Operations, at a press conference where he announced the Navy had found Captain Charles B. McVay III, skipper of the cruiser Indianapolis, guilty of failing to direct his ship to follow a zig-zag course prior to the time she was destroyed in the Philippines Sea on July 30, 1945.  Shown with Nimitz is Vice Admiral Forrest P. Sherman, Deputy Chief of Naval Operations.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Rep. Helen D. Mankin (D), Georgia
Scopenote: Shown here against a backdrop of the Capitol Dome, is Mrs. Helen D. Mankin (D), Georgia. She represents nearly a half million people in the Fifth Congressional District of Georgia. From: Beth Gore

title: Rep. Helen D. Mankin (D - Georgia)
Scopenote: Rep. Helen D. Mankin, (D), Georgia, after taking her oath of office.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Representative Helen Mankin (D) Georgia, taking her oath of office
Scopenote: Photo of Representative Helen Mankin (D) Georgia (center), taking her oath of office.  She replaced Rep. Ramspeck who resigned to take an airline post. She is shown here with Speaker Sam Rayburn (Right) and Rep. Carl Vinson, Georgia, Chairman of the House Naval Affairs Committee.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Sen. David I. Walsh (D-MA), talking with Edwin W. Pauley
Scopenote: Senator David I. Walsh, Massachusetts, Chairman of the Senate Naval Affairs Committee, talks with Ambassador Edwin W. Pauley, who has been nominated for Under Secretary of the Navy.   From: Beth Gore.

title: General Walter Bedell Smith
Scopenote: Portrait photograph of General Walter Bedell Smith, after being appointed U.S. Ambassador to Russia.  From: Beth Gore

title: Left to right:  Fred M. Vinson, John Snyder, and O. Max Gardner
Scopenote: Secretary of Treasury Fred M. Vinson, left, congratulates O. Max Gardner, right, new Under Secretary of the Treasury as John Snyder, center, Reconversion Director, looks on.  From: Beth Gore

title: Fred M. Vinson Before Senate Banking Committee
Scopenote: In an appearance before the Senate Banking and Currency Committee, Secretary of the Treasury Fred M. Vinson today said the wartime deterioration in Britain's international economic position was even more severe than destruction suffered from enemy air attacks.  "To survive," he said, "England must restore and expand her export trade, either by joining the United Nations program for unrestricted world trade, or extending her economic bloc of currency and trade controls."  Vinson is shown here at a chart at the committee hearing.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Julius A. Krug
Scopenote: Photo of Julius A. Krug, who had just been approved by the Senate to become Secretary of the Interior.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Marriner S. Eccles, Chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, appearing before the Senate Banking Committee
Scopenote: Marriner S. Eccles, Chairman of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, indicated that tax reductions would be a "tragic error." He told the Senate Banking Committee while testifying on the British loan that such action would increase the problem of inflation and decrease chances of balancing the Federal  budget.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Commerce Secretary Henry A. Wallace with Edward U. Condon, Director of Bureau of Standards
Scopenote: The Committee on Atomic Information opened an exhibit at the Department of Commerce late this afternoon. Shown here at the exhibit are Secretary of Commerce Henry A. Wallace (right) and Edward U. Condon, Director of the Bureau of Standards.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of W. Averell Harriman arriving at the White House
Scopenote: Photo of W. Averell Harriman, former U. S. Ambassador to Russia, is shown arriving at the White House for a conference with President Truman. Earlier, he had told a House Committee that Russia's people don't want war with the United States. From: Beth Gore

title: Photograph of Leon Blum and Henri Bonnet
Scopenote: Leon Blum, ex-Premier of France and Ambassador Extraordinary, arrived in Washington by air tonight.  Mr. Blum will take part in negotiations to obtain a loan for France.  Mr. Blum, left, is shown here with Ambassador to the United States from France Henri Bonnet.  From:   Beth Gore

title: Photo of Hershel V. Johnson, U. S. Ambassador to Sweden
Scopenote: Photo of Hershel V. Johnson, U. S. Ambassador to Sweden.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Brig. Gen. Kenneth Royall
Scopenote: Portrait photograph of Brig. Gen. Kenneth Royall, who succeeded Robert Patterson as Undersecretary of War.

title: Photo of General Lewis B. Hershey presenting the Selective Service Medal to Tom C. Clark
Scopenote: General Lewis B. Hershey, Director of Selective Service, today presented the Selective Service Medal for outstanding services, to Attorney General Tom C. Clark (right).

title: Photograph of Leon Blum and Henri Bonnet
Scopenote: Photograph of Leon Blum, ex-Premier of France and Ambassador to the United States, Henri Bonnet of France.  From:   Beth Gore.

title: Commodore James K. Vardaman
Scopenote: A Senate Banking and Currency Sub-Committee today approved the nomination of Commodore James K. Vardaman, President Truman Naval Aide, to be a Governor of the Federal Reserve system.  The Commodore is shown at his desk at the White House today.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Portrait of Dr. Leonard Schultz
Scopenote: Portrait of Dr. Leonard Schultz, Washington, D. C. (of the Smithsonian Institution), who is among the Washington men appointed to study the effect of the atom bomb tests held at Bikini Atoll.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of OPA Administrator Paul Porter testifying before the House Banking and Currency Committee
Scopenote: Office of Price Administration Administrator Paul Porter testified before the House Banking and Currency Committee that if price lines can be held another 12 months the danger of crippling inflation will be past.  Porter urged Congress not to force OPA "to default in the last round" by weakening the price control structure.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Rep. B. Carroll Reece (R-TN)
Scopenote: Rep. B. Carroll Reece (R-TN), prior to his consideration as National Republican Chairman.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Under Secretary of the Treasury O. Max Gardner
Scopenote: Photo of Under Secretary of the Treasury O. Max Gardner.  From: Beth Gore

title: Commodore James K. Vardaman and Captain Clark M. Clifford
Scopenote: Commodore James K. Vardaman, Jr., left, was sworn in today as a member of the Federal Reserve Board, leaving his post as Naval Aide to President Truman; and Captain Clark M. Clifford, St. Louis attorney, right, is to succeed Vardaman as the President's Naval Aide.  The pair is shown here congratulating each other.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Lt. Gen. James H. Doolittle appearing at a press conference
Scopenote: Lt. Gen. James H. Doolittle, Chairman of the Army's Gripe Board, appearing at a press conference after finishing taking testimony from 40 witnesses, including 36 Army men ranging from Private to Five Star General.  From: Beth Gore

title: A photo of Sir Alexander Cadogan of the United Kingdom
Scopenote: Sir Alexander Cadogan of the United Kingdom photographed during the 30th session of the United Nations Security Council at Hunter College.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Commodore James K. Vardaman, Jr. (L) shaking hands with Captain Clark M. Clifford
Scopenote: Commodore James K. Vardaman, Jr., left, was sworn in today as a member of the Federal Reserve Board, leaving his post as Naval Aide to President Truman, and Captain Clark M. Clifford, St. Louis attorney, right, is to succeed Vardaman as the President's Naval Aide. The pair are shown here congratulating each other. From: Beth Gore

title: Brig. Gen. Carlos P. Romulo appearing before the Senate Finance Committee
Scopenote: Brig. Gen. Carlos P. Romulo, Resident Commissioner of the Philippines to the United States, left a sick bed at Walter Reed Hospital to present the views of the Philippine Government on H.R. 5856, Philippine Trade Act of 1946, to the Senate Finance Committee. General Romulo has been a patient at Walter Reed since last Saturday where he was ordered by Dr. Gonzalo Austria, his physician, for a complete rest. He is hospitalized with recurrent malaria.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Mrs. Harry Truman at Children's Hospital
Scopenote: Mrs. Harry S. Truman paid her first visit to Children's Hospital since becoming First Lady today. Here she is shown with little Tommy Jimmerfield (correct spelling), three-year-old polio victim of Morningside, Mo., and Nurse Barbara G. Welch of Media, Pa. From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of George Messersmith, nominated to be the Ambassador to Argentina
Scopenote: Photo of George Messersmith, nominated to be the  Ambassador to Argentina.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Portrait of the Honorable Monnett Davis, Consul General to Shanghai with the rank of Minister
Scopenote: Portrait of the Honorable Monnett Davis, Consul General to Shanghai with the rank of Minister. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of ceremonies at the Jefferson Memorial on Jefferson's 203rd birthday
Scopenote: The man who wrote the Declaration of Independence, Thomas Jefferson, was honored on the 203rd anniversary of his birth in ceremonies at the Jefferson Memorial.  Photo shows the massing of colors around a statue of Jefferson.  The actual birthday of the country's third President was April 2nd, but it is observed on the 13th due to a revamping of calendars in the 1700's.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Edward Foley Takes the Oath of Office as Assistant Secretary of the Treasury
Scopenote: Photo of Edward Foley taking the oath of office as Assistant Secretary of the Treasury in ceremonies at the Treasury Department. Associate Justice of the Supreme Court Stanley F. Reed gave the oath.  From: Beth Gore

title: Fred Vinson (left) and Edward Foley
Scopenote: Secretary of the Treasury Fred Vinson congratulates the new assistant Secretary of the Treasury, Edward Foley, following swearing in ceremonies at the Treasury Department.   From: Beth Gore

title: President Truman shown speaking to the governing board of the Pan American Union
Scopenote: President Truman shown speaking to the governing board of the Pan American Union. The President told the gathering that the United Nations will and must succeed because "complete devastation" is the only alternative to international cooperation in this atomic age.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Major General John H. Hilldring, being sworn in as Assistant Secretary of State by Stanley Woodward, while Secretary of State James F. Byrnes watches
Scopenote: Major General John H. Hilldring of Phoenix, Arizona, who has been appointed Assistant Secretary of State today assumed the oath of office at the State Department. Left to right, Stanley Woodward, Chief of the Division of Protocol, who administered the oath; Secretary of State James F. Byrnes and  General Hilldring.  From: Beth Gore.

title: A portrait of Leon Blum
Scopenote: This portrait study of Leon Blum, former Premier of France, was made during his recent visit to Washington.  From:   Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Tom C. Clark and J. Howard McGrath leaving the home of Chief Justice Harlan F. Stone
Scopenote: Attorney General Tom C. Clark, right, and Solicitor General J. Howard McGrath shown leaving the home of the late Chief Justice Harlan F. Stone, where they paid their respects. The Chief Justice had just died of a cerebral hemorrhage. From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach seated on a couch
Scopenote: Informal photograph of Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach seated on a couch.  From: Beth Gore

title: George V. Allen sworn in as United States Ambassador to Iran
Scopenote: George V. Allen today took the oath as United States Ambassador to Iran in ceremonies at the State Department.  Left to right, Marvin Will of the Foreign Service Department of State, Mrs. Katharine Allen, Ambassador Allen and Acting Secretary of State Dean Acheson.   From: Beth Gore

title: Harry Dexter White Standing at Desk
Scopenote: Latest informal photo of Harry Dexter White, Assistant Secretary of the Treasury.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of President Truman presenting one of the pens used in signing the Philippine Trade Bill and the Rehabilitation Bill to General Carlos P. Romulo
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman presenting one of the pens used in signing the Philippine Trade Bill and the Rehabilitation Bill to General Carlos P. Romulo, Resident Commissioner of the Philippines. Directly behind Romulo is Secretary of Interior J. A. Krug and in the center is Senator Millard E. Tydings of Maryland.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Portrait of Secretary of War Robert Patterson
Scopenote: Portrait of Secretary of War Robert Patterson.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Senator James E. Murray of Montana
Scopenote: Photo of Senator James E. Murray of Montana.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of Agriculture Clinton P. Anderson (Left) and UNRRA Chief Fiorello LaGuardia
Scopenote: Secretary of Agriculture Clinton P. Anderson chats with UNRRA (United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Agency) Chief Fiorello LaGuardia at the Agriculture Department.  Both are involved in the Food for Europe Campaign.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Acting Secretary of State Dean Acheson is shown greeting Rt. Hon. Joseph Benedict Chifley, Prime Minister of Australia
Scopenote: Acting Secretary of State Dean Acheson (left) is shown greeting Rt. Hon. Joseph Benedict Chifley, Prime Minister of Australia, as he called at the State Department today.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of President Truman addressing the Highway Safety Conference
Scopenote: Photo of President Truman asking state and local authorities to pick up drivers licenses held by "traffic incorrigibles". Mr. Truman, appearing in person on his 62nd birthday before a Highway Safety Conference, asked nationwide assistance in reducing the traffic death toll.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Sol Bloom and Leon Blum speaking together
Scopenote: Rep. Sol Bloom, chairman of the House Foreign Affairs Committee, and Leon Blum, former Premier of France in this country with the temporary rank of Ambassador, caught by a photographer in the candid pose when the ex-Premier visited the committee room atop Capitol Hill this morning.  From:   Beth Gore.

title: A photo of Australian Prime Minister Joseph B. Chifley at the White House with President Truman
Scopenote: Australian Prime Minister Joseph B. Chifley (right) called on President Harry S. Truman at the White House.  He called for a general European Peace Conference as soon as possible.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of President Truman talking with President Elect Manuel Roxas of the Philippines while Paul V. McNutt looks on
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) chats in his office with President Elect Manuel Roxas of the Philippines, center, as High Commissioner of the Philippines Paul V. McNutt looks on. (Same as 66-2551)     From: Beth Gore.

title: William D. Pawley being administered the oath of office as United States Ambassador to Brazil by Associate Justice of the Supreme court William O. Douglas
Scopenote: William D. Pawley (left) taking the oath of office as United States Ambassador to Brazil. Justice of the Supreme Court William O. Douglas, right, administers the oath.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of John L. Lewis, President of the United Mine Workers, addressing reporters
Scopenote: John L. Lewis, President of the United Mine Workers, shown talking to reporters following his White House conference with President Truman.  From:  Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Alvanley Johnston and A. F. Whitney addressing reporters outside the White House
Scopenote: Alvanley Johnston, left, head of the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers, and A. F. Whitney, head of the Brotherhood of Trainmen, talk to reporters following their visit to the White House when President Truman ordered government seizure of the nations railroads.

title: Former President Herbert Hoover reporting to the Food and Agriculture Organization meeting
Scopenote: Former President Herbert Hoover reporting on his around the world food mission to the Food and Agriculture Organization meeting at the Chamber of Commerce Auditorium, Washington, D. C.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Harry Dexter White Portrait
Scopenote: Latest portrait of Harry D. White, U.S. representative to the International Monetary Fund.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of the Interior Julius A. Krug during a press conference
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Julius A. Krug in his office during a press conference about the coal strike.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Alvanley Johnston (front), President of the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers, and A. F. Whitney, President of the Brotherhood of Railway Trainmen
Scopenote: Photo of Alvanley Johnston (front), President of the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers, and A. F. Whitney, President of the Brotherhood of Railway Trainmen, leave a cab in front of the White House as they arrived for a final conference on President Truman's proposals to avert a nation-wide rail strike.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of John L. Sullivan, Tom C. Clark and Robert Patterson Leaving the White House
Scopenote: Acting Secretary of the Navy John L. Sullivan, Attorney General Tom C. Clark and Secretary of War Robert Patterson shown leaving the White House following the President's calling of an extraordinary conference of high government leaders to "canvass the whole strike situation." From: Beth Gore.

title: Double Photo of Alvanley Johnston, President of the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers and A. F. Whitney, President of the Brotherhood of Railway Trainmen
Scopenote: No transportation problems worried the leaders of the two striking railroad unions, Alvanley Johnston, President of the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers and A. F. Whitney, President of the Brotherhood of Railway Trainmen, because they did their traveling afoot to conferences in efforts to settle their wage dispute. Johnston,(L)and Whitney in picture on left. On right are Whitney (L) and Johnston.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Presidential Assistant John R. Steelman talking to newsmen
Scopenote: Presidential Assistant John R. Steelman talking to newsmen as he leaves a meeting at the Statler Hotel held with leaders of the striking railroad unions in an effort to settle the wage dispute.  From: Beth Gore

title: Presidential Assistant John R. Steelman at a news conference
Scopenote: Presidential Assistant John R. Steelman giving newsmen an account of his meeting with striking railroad leaders in an effort to settle a wage dispute. They are at the Statler Hotel.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of UMW President John L. Lewis Entering his Car at the White House
Scopenote: United Mine Workers President John L. Lewis shown entering his car following a conference with President Truman at the White House.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Bess Truman with relatives at White House
Scopenote: David Wallace, 11, and Marian Wallace, 9, son and daughter of David F. Wallace, Sr., of Denver, CO, shown with their aunt, Mrs. Harry S. Truman, on the White House lawn today.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Mrs. Truman with Cuba's ambassador and wife
Scopenote: Mrs. Harry S. Truman (center) today received Cuba's highest award, being honored because of the love, friendship, and fraternity she has shown to Pan-American countries. Left to right: Ambassador Guillermo Belt, Bess Truman, and Senora De Belt. From: Beth Gore.

title: Ambassador of Great Britain to the United States, Lord Inverchapel Calls on Secretary of State James F. Byrnes at the State Department
Scopenote: Ambassador of Great Britain to the United States, Lord Inverchapel (left), calls on Secretary of State James F. Byrnes (center) at the State Department. The man on the far right is British diplomat Sir John Balfour. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of UMW President John L. Lewis shaking hands with Senator Claude Pepper of Florida
Scopenote: Photo of John L. Lewis (right), two days after the soft coal strike ended, when he went to the Senate to pay a few calls.  Here he shakes hands with Senator Claude Pepper of Florida.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of England's Ambassador to the U. S., Lord Inverchapel
Scopenote: England's new ambassador, Lord Inverchapel, shown leaving the White House following his initial visit to President Truman.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Admiral Chester W. Nimitz addressing the 1946 graduates of the U. S. Naval Academy
Scopenote: Fleet Admiral Chester W. Nimitz, Chief of Naval Operations, speaking to graduates of the U. S. Naval Academy's 1946 Class at Annapolis.   From: Beth Gore

title: Senator Warren R. Austin (right) with President Truman
Scopenote: Senator Warren R. Austin, Vermont, New U.S. United Nations Security Council Representative, shown with President Truman at the White House.  From: Beth Gore

title: Bernard Baruch meeting with Senators Brien McMahon and Arthur Vandenberg
Scopenote: Bernard M. Baruch today revealed his plan to avoid a world chaos in the atomic age to Senators meeting in secret session, and received their assurance that Congressional support for the plan would be forth coming.  He is shown here, center, with Senator Brien McMahon, Connecticut, Chairman of the Atomic Committee of the Senate (at right)and Senator Arthur Vandenberg, Michigan (at left).  From:   Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Prime Minister Ferenc Nagy of Hungary and Rep. Sol Bloom
Scopenote: Photo of Prime Minister Ferenc Nagy of Hungary and Rep. Sol Bloom, Chairman of the House Foreign Affairs Committee, reviewing a map in Mr. Bloom's office.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of President Truman with Eugene Meyer, President of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development
Scopenote: Photo of President Harry S. Truman (left) holding a conference with Eugene Meyer, President of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development. They are in the Oval Office.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Wilson W. Wyatt with Phillip H. Coombs
Scopenote: National Housing Expeditor Wilson W. Wyatt, seated, today signed the first premium payment plan designed to achieve expanded production of scarce building materials. The plan, placed into effect as of June 1, 1946, covers the structural clay (brick) industry and was worked out in cooperation with the representatives of that industry. Use of premium payments was authorized by the Veterans Emergency Housing Act of 1946. Standing is Phillip H. Coombs, National Housing Act Director of Materials Supply Branch and Chairman of the Interagency Steering Committee on premium payments. From: Beth Gore.

title: OES Director Chester Bowles at a press conference
Scopenote: A candid photo of Office of Economic Stabilization Director Chester Bowles taken at his press conference speaking in favor of the Office of Price Administration. This photo is similar to photos 99-98, 99-99, and 99-100.  From:   Beth Gore.

title: Paul A. Walker taking oath of office as FCC Commissioner
Scopenote: Federal Communication Commission Commissioner Paul A Walker, right, is shown taking oath of office for a new six year term this morning.  The oath was given by Justice Bennett C. Clark, left, of the District Court of Appeals.  From: Beth Gore.

title: OES Director Chester Bowles speaking at a press conference
Scopenote: A candid photo of Office of Economic Stabilization Director Chester Bowles taken at his press conference where he spoke in favor of the Office of Price Administration. This photo is similar to photos 99-98, 99-99, and 99-100.  From:   Beth Gore.

title: OES Director Chester Bowles speaking at a press conference
Scopenote: A candid photo of Office of Economic Stabilization Director Chester Bowles, taken at his press conference, where he spoke in favor of Office of Price Administration. This photo is similar to photos 99-98, 99-99, and 99-100.  From:   Beth Gore.

title: OES Director Chester Bowles speaking at a press conference
Scopenote: A candid photo of Office of Economic Stabilization Director Chester Bowles, taken at his press conference. where he spoke in favor of Office of Price Administration. This photo is similar to photos 99-98, 99-99, and 99-100.  From:   Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Dr. Dennis A. Fitzgerald, Secretary-General of the International Emergency Food Council
Scopenote: Dr. Dennis A. Fitzgerald, who has been named Secretary-General of the International Emergency Food Council. Dr. Fitzgerald is a career man in agriculture and is Department Director of Allocations and Requirements.  From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman on radio addressing nation
Scopenote: President Truman took to the air tonight, explaining his veto of the OPA Bill, to the American people. The President said that the Extension Bill was a choice between "inflation with a statute and inflation without one." He said that if the bill becomes law, the people of the country would think they had a workable price control law but would soon come to a "bitter realization" of the truth. From: Beth Gore.

title: Chester Bowles packing up his OES office
Scopenote: Office of Economic Stabilization Director Chester Bowles packs up his important papers to leave his office.  Mr. Bowles quit in a huff over the Senate's passing the Office of Price Administration bill.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Lt. Col. Mary A. Hallaren, Lowell, MA,  Deputy Director of the Women's Army Corps
Scopenote: Photo of Lt. Col. Mary A. Hallaren, Lowell, MA,  Deputy Director of the Women's Army Corps.   From: Beth Gore

title: Comptroller General Lindsay C. Warren before the Mead Committee
Scopenote: Comptroller General Lindsay C. Warren, appearing before the Mead Committee today, said that "everybody and his brother," apparently encouraged by laxity of Federal War Profit Renegotiation laws, "were out to get the Government during the lush war years." Warren told the committee that untold billions  were "given away" by the Government during renegotiations of war contracts    From: Beth Gore.

title: OPA Administrator Paul A. Porter speaking at a news conference
Scopenote: OPA Administrator Paul A. Porter told a news conference that the OPA would do its best to push any soaring rent and price ceilings back to the June 30, 1946, level as soon as Congress restores controls.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of press conference of OPA Chief Paul Porter
Scopenote: Photo of the press conference of Office of Price Administration Chief Paul Porter, shown at the table in the background at OPA headquarters.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photograph of Chester Bowles Leaving the White House
Scopenote: Leaving the White House following his final visit with President Truman prior to ending his services as Director of the Office of Economic Stabilization, Chester Bowles waves to reporters and photographers. From: Beth Gore.

title: President Harry S. Truman Signs Philippine Immigration Bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is signing a bill setting annual immigration quotas of 100 each for Filipinos and East Indians. The new law also authorizes naturalization of Filipinos and East Indians already in this country provided they meet citizenship requirements. The President is seated, while standing, left to right, Representative John Lesinski; Antonio A. Gonzalez, President of the Filipino Inter-Community of Western States; J. C. Dionisio, Assistant to the Resident Commissioner in San Francisco; Delegate J. R. Farrington of Hawaii; Rep. Emanuel Celler; M. O. A. Baig; J. J. Singh, President of India League of America; Dr. Anup Singh, Secretary National Commission for India's Freedom; Leonides S. Virata, Executive Officer of the Resident Commissioner of the Philippines.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson testifying before the Senate War Contract Investigating Committee
Scopenote: Photo of Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson testifying before the Senate War Contract Investigating Committee. Representative Andrew J. May (D-KY) on three occasions interceded for the Garsson industrial munitions "paper empire". Patterson has ordered the funds of the "paper empire" frozen to "protect" the Government.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photograph of B. Carroll Reece, Chairman of the Republican National Committee
Scopenote: Portrait photograph of B. Carroll Reece, Chairman of the Republican National Committee.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photograph of Hon. Juraj Slavik, Ambassador to the United States from Czechoslovakia
Scopenote: Photograph of Hon. Juraj Slavik, recently named Ambassador to the United States from Czechoslovakia. He succeeds Vladimir Hurban.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Dr. Edwin G. Nourse, Vice President of the Brookings Institute
Scopenote: Dr. Edwin G. Nourse, Vice President of the Brookings Institute, was nominated by President Harry S. Truman to be Chairman of the new Council of Economic Advisors.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Robert Butler Takes the Oath of Office as Ambassador to Australia
Scopenote: Robert Butler is shown being sworn into office as the first United States Ambassador to Australia. Previously those representing this country held the rank of Minister. The photo shows, left to right, Bennett Champ Clark, Federal Judge; Ambassador Butler; and Acting Secretary of State Dean Acheson.  From: Beth Gore

title: George H. Mead (left), talking with OPA Chief Paul Porter
Scopenote: George H. Mead (left), former industry member of the War Labor Board and later member of the Decontrol Board under the Office of Price Administration Act, is shown talking with OPA Chief Paul Porter at the White House.  From: Beth Gore

title: B. Carroll Reece, Chairman of the Republican National Committee
Scopenote: Portrait photograph of B. Carroll Reece, Chairman of the Republican National Committee.  From: Beth Gore.

title: James E. Webb portrait
Scopenote: Latest informal photo of James E. Webb, new Director of the Budget.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of General Brehon Somervell in civilian clothing
Scopenote: Photo of General Brehon Somervell in civilian clothing.

title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court Robert H. Jackson
Scopenote: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court Robert H. Jackson.  From: Beth Gore

title: President Truman With his new Council of Economic Advisors
Scopenote: Members of the Council of Economic Advisors took the oath of Office in the President's office today. Left to right; Leon H. Keyserling; Dr. Edwin G. Nourse, Chairman; John Davidson Clark; President Harry S. Truman; and Judge Bennett Champ Clark who performed the ceremonies.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Reconversion Director John Steelman on a yacht
Scopenote: Reconversion Director John Steelman at the wheel of a yacht at a yachting party in Washington. The yacht was the "Colleen," owned by Mr. and Mrs. Bruce Wallace of Washington.  From: Beth Gore

title: Dean Acheson conferring with Herschel Johnson
Scopenote: Herschel Johnson, left, U.S. Deputy on the United Nations Security Council, conferred today with Acting Secretary of State Dean Acheson, right, at the State Department.  It was assumed that Johnson and Acheson were discussing the proper procedure to protest to the Security Council in case Marshal Tito of Yugoslavia rejects the American 48-hour ultimatum.  From:   Beth Gore

title: Dean Acheson, Vice President Alben Barkley, Mrs. Vandenberg, and Senator Arthur Vandenberg
Scopenote: Senator Arthur H. Vandenberg, Michigan, accompanied by Senator Alben Barkley, Kentucky, and Mrs. Vandenberg, left for the Paris Peace Conference Saturday.  Acting Secretary of State Dean Acheson saw them off.  Left to right: Dean Acheson, Senator Alben Barkley, Mrs. Vandenberg, and Senator Arthur Vandenberg.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Paul Hoffman, Marshall Plan Director, at the Blair House
Scopenote: Paul Hoffman, Marshall Plan Director, is shown entering the Blair House to make his report to President Truman.   From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Supreme Court Justice Robert H. Jackson returning from the German war crimes courts
Scopenote: Back from the German war crimes courts, Associate Justice Robert H. Jackson of the Supreme Court returns to Washington by air.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Portrait of Admiral Emory S. Land
Scopenote: Portrait of Admiral Emory S. Land, former head of the Maritime Commission, who is now with the Air Transport Association of America.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Jesus T. Pinero (right), Governor-Designate of Puerto Rico, and J. A. Krug, Secretary of the Interior, as they board a plane
Scopenote: Jesus T. Pinero (right), Governor-Designate of Puerto Rico, and J. A. Krug, Secretary of the Interior, wave goodbye as they board a plane for San Juan at National Airport, Washington, D. C. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of King George II of Greece
Scopenote: King George II of Greece who was voted back on the throne by the citizens of Greece, smiles at the election results which stood 649,705 in his favor and 254,787 against. He is shown in the Greek Embassy in Upper Brook Street.  From: Beth Gore.

title: John R. Steelman signing the government wage policy
Scopenote: Wage Stabilization Director John R. Steelman is shown signing the government wage policy to pave the way for payment to striking American Federation of Labor seamen of wage increases twice disapproved by the Wage Stabilization Board.  He said he amended the existing wage regulations to provide that government agencies may pay wages and salaries "comparable to the wages and salaries paid for the same or comparable services by other operators".  From: Beth Gore

title: Acting Secretary of State Will Clayton leaving the White House
Scopenote: Latest informal picture of acting Secretary of State Will Clayton, shown leaving the White House following a conference with President Truman.  From: Beth Gore

title: Secretary of Commerce Henry A. Wallace
Scopenote: Harris and Ewing cameramen caught Secretary of Commerce Henry A. Wallace, in these photo studies of his moods, at the White House late this afternoon following his two and a half hour conference with President Harry S. Truman. Mr. Wallace promised the President not to make any public statements or speeches until after the Paris Conferences end.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Resigning Secretary of Commerce Henry A Wallace in Office
Scopenote: The outgoing mailbox in the foreground of Henry A. Wallace's desk formed a fitting setting for this picture of the "retiring" Secretary of Commerce, who is shown reading his letter to President Truman.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Henry A. Wallace on park bench
Scopenote: Henry A. Wallace airs himself on a park bench while reading a newspaper after submitting his resignation as Secretary of Commerce at the request of President Truman.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Ex-Secretary of Commerce Henry A. Wallace in Office
Scopenote: Henry A. Wallace isn't taking the loss of a Cabinet post too seriously, it would seem here. Photo shows the ex-Secretary of Commerce relaxing in his office shortly after the exchange of letters with President Truman this morning.   From: Beth Gore

title: James F. Byrnes speaking with W. Averell Harriman
Scopenote: Secretary of State James F. Byrnes (right) welcomes newly-appointed U. S. Secretary of Commerce W. Averell Harriman to Paris on September 26. Harriman went to Paris from London where he previously acted as U. S. Ambassador to Great Britain.  From: Beth Gore

title: First Medal Strike of Secretary of Treasury Fred Vinson
Scopenote: Former Secretary of the Treasury Fred M. Vinson today has received the first medal struck in his honor by the department he headed before becoming Chief Justice of the Supreme Court.  Medals have been made of all Treasury Secretaries since Alexander Hamilton.  One of John W. Snyder, present Secretary, is due soon.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder talking to Under-Secretary of State Will Clayton
Scopenote: Photo taken at a party at the Colombia Embassy showing Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder (right)chatting with Under-Secretary of State Will Clayton (left).  From: Beth Gore

title: Secretary of Commerce nominee W. Averill Harriman, as he called at the White House
Scopenote: Informal photo of Secretary of Commerce nominee W. Averill Harriman, as he called at the White House.

title: Photo of Secretary of Commerce and Mrs. W. Averill Harriman
Scopenote: Photo of Secretary of Commerce and Mrs. W. Averill Harriman, following the swearing in ceremonies at the Department of Commerce this morning.  From: Beth Gore

title: Walter Bedell Smith at his desk in the State Department
Scopenote: General Walter Bedell Smith, U.S. Ambassador to Russia, who is paying an unexpected visit to Washington, shown at his desk at the State Department this morning.

title: Robert A. Taft at desk
Scopenote: Air-brushed casual portrait of Robert A. Taft at a desk.   From: Beth Gore

title: Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn
Scopenote: Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn is shown here predicting the Democrats would keep control of both the House and Senate in the November 1946 elections.  He said the size of the Democratic majorities would depend on the size of the vote.  From: Beth Gore

title: James F. Byrnes reporting on the Paris Peace Conference
Scopenote: Secretary of State James F. Byrnes reporting to the American people on the results of the Paris Peace Conference.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of American Legion National Commander Paul H. Griffith giving a press conference
Scopenote: National Commander Paul H. Griffith, shown here, telling a press conference that the American Legion would "start from scratch" and cooperate with General Omar N. Bradley, Veterans Administrator, in carrying out VA programs. He indicated the Legion would "let bygones be bygones" and discontinue the running battle carried on against Bradley by former Commander John Steele.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of American Legion National Commander Paul H. Griffith shaking hands with head of the Veterans Administration, General Omar Bradley
Scopenote: The American Legion - Veterans Administration feud came to an end when the National Legion Commander Paul H. Griffith (right) paid a "good-will visit" to General Omar Bradley, head of the Veterans Administration. The pair are shown here shaking hands with Griffith saying "the Legion will start from scratch."  From: Beth Gore

title: Robert F. Bacher Portrait
Scopenote: Portrait photo of physicist Robert F. Bacher, named by President Harry S. Truman on October 28th to serve on the new Atomic Energy Commission.  From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman with Soviet Foreign Commissar V. Molotov at the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with Soviet Foreign Commissar V. M. Molotov at the White House. This was the first meeting between the Chief Executive and a top Soviet official since the Potsdam Conference. Molotov was in Washington to attend a Soviet Embassy party.  From: Beth Gore

title: Humphrey Hume Wrong, Canadian Ambassador
Scopenote: Latest informal photo of the new ambassador of Canada to the United States, Humphrey Hume Wrong, shown at the White House where he called today.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Louis G. Dreyfus, Jr., U. S. Minister to Sweden
Scopenote: Photo of U. S. Minister to Sweden Louis G. Dreyfus, Jr., shown at his desk at the State Department.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Louis G. Dreyfus being sworn into office as U. S. Minister to Sweden
Scopenote: Louis G. Dreyfus, Jr., right, new U. S. Minister to Sweden, shown taking the oath of office from Marvin Will, left, of the Foreign Service Personnel Office of the State Department.  From: Beth Gore.

title: United Mine Workers President John L. Lewis shown leaving a coal contract negotiation at the Interior Department
Scopenote: Armistice Day did not mean a thing towards peace in the coal contract negotiations. United Mine Worker's leader John L. Lewis joined conferences at the Interior Department. Photo shows Mr. Lewis leaving the morning session.  From: Beth Gore

title: Rep. Joseph W. Martin, Jr. (R-MA)
Scopenote: Rep. Joseph W. Martin, Jr. (R-MA) with his hand on the Republican symbol (elephant statuette).  Rep. Martin is scheduled to become the Speaker of the House when Congress resumes in January, 1947.  From: Beth Gore

title: A photograph of John Nicholas Brown and Mrs. John Brown
Scopenote: Shown are Assistant Secretary of Navy for Air and Mrs. John Nicholas Brown.  Brown succeeds John L. Sullivan who has been made Under Secretary of Navy.  From: Beth Gore.

title: United Mine Workers President John L. Lewis is shown leaving the Miners' headquarters
Scopenote: United Mine Workers President John L. Lewis is shown leaving the Miners' headquarters, silent as to whether he would recall his midnight contract "termination" or defy a federal court order and risk jail.  From: Beth Gore

title: Louis F. Budenz Speaking to the House Committee Investigating Un-American Activities
Scopenote: Louis F. Budenz, currently an assistant professor of economics at Fordham University in New York City and former editor of the Communist Daily Worker newspaper, testifies before the House Un-American Activities Committee in Washington, DC. He told the committee that the Soviet government is engaged in a "war of nerves" against the U.S. and asserted "it could go to military conflict." From: Beth Gore

title: Good head and shoulders photo of President Truman at airport after returning to Washington
Scopenote: After a week in Florida where he rested for what may be a tough fight with John L. Lewis in regard to the coal strike, President Truman returned to Washington by air this afternoon.  From: Beth Gore.

title: John L. Lewis as he appeared at court
Scopenote: John L. Lewis as he appeared at court, grim and sullen and ready to fight the court charge.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Assistant Secretary of the Interior C. Girard Davidson
Scopenote: Assistant Secretary of the Interior C. Girard Davidson, as he disclosed that the Government is considering operating the Big and Little Inch petroleum pipelines to transmit gas to coal-shortage areas. Davidson informed the House Surplus Property Committee, however, that Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug has reached no decision as yet. From: Beth Gore.

title: UMW President John L. Lewis outside the Federal District court
Scopenote: Photo of photographers trailing United Mine Workers President John L. Lewis (left) outside the Federal District court.   From: Beth Gore.

title: John L. Lewis shown leaving court following the opening session of the contempt charges
Scopenote: John L. Lewis shown leaving court following the opening session of the contempt charges.  From: Beth Gore

title: Secretary of Interior Julius A. Krug testifying before a House committee
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Julius A. Krug testifying before a House committee considering the use of big and little inch pipe lines as pipelines for gas. He told the group that 50,000,000 cubic feet of gas would provide fuel power comparable to 2,000 tons of coal. Krug said he had considered using the lines for gas during the coal strike. From: Beth Gore

title: American Legion National Commander Paul Griffith shaking hands with President Truman
Scopenote: National Commander of the American Legion Paul Griffith (left) called at the White House today to pay his respects to President Truman.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Stern-faced John L. Lewis, United Mine Workers chief, shown at court this morning
Scopenote: Stern-faced John L. Lewis, United Mine Workers chief, shown at court this morning.

title: United Mine Workers President John L. Lewis as he leaves court after hearing the verdict in his contempt case
Scopenote: United Mine Workers President John L. Lewis as he leaves court after hearing the verdict of a personal fine of $10,000 and a $3,500,000 fine for the United Mine Workers.  From: Beth Gore

title: Wilson W. Wyatt, resigned, Housing Expeditor
Scopenote: Wilson W. Wyatt, who resigned as Housing Expediter, shown packing up at his office today following a press conference. Mr. Wyatt said that the housing emergency now is greater than ever and that demand for homes is just now reaching its peak. Mr. Wyatt resigned after President Truman had called for relaxation "as rapidly as possible" of Wyatt's controls on construction and home building.  From: Beth Gore.

title: William C. Foster (right) taking the oath of office as new Under Secretary of Commerce
Scopenote: William C. Foster (right) taking the oath of office as new Under Secretary of Commerce. The oath was administered by Secretary of Commerce W. Averell Harriman.  From: Beth Gore

title: United Mine Workers President John L. Lewis as he read to reporters his letter to members of his Union
Scopenote: United Mine Workers President John L. Lewis as he read to reporters his letter to members of the union ordering them to return to work. See also 99-703.  From: Beth Gore

title: John L. Lewis as he read to reporters his letter to members of the United Mine Workers ordering them to return to work
Scopenote: John L. Lewis as he read to reporters his letter to members of the United Mine Workers ordering them to return to work. Mr. Lewis told the newsmen he took this action on his own authority to give the United States Supreme Court time to deliberate on appeals from contempt convictions "free from public pressure superinduced by the hysteria and frenzy of an economic crisis."  From: Beth Gore

title: United Mine Workers President John L. Lewis as he faced reporters after reading his letter to the members of his Union
Scopenote: United Mine Workers chief John L. Lewis as he faced reporters in his headquarters after reading the letter ordering the members of his union back to work. He directed that the miners work until March 31, 1947 under the terms of the contract with the Government--the contract that Lewis had tried to terminate.  From: Beth Gore

title: British Foreign Minister Ernest Bevin
Scopenote: Informal photo of British Foreign Minister Ernest Bevin.  From: Beth Gore.

title: British Foreign Minister Ernest Bevin speaking to British Embassy workers
Scopenote: During his brief stay in Washington, British Foreign Minister Ernest Bevin speaks to an informal gathering of British Embassy workers.  He is shown on the steps of the Embassy with British Ambassador Lord Inverchapel, speaking to the group.  From:   Beth Gore

title: Maj. Gen. Philip B. Fleming
Scopenote: President Truman appointed General Philip B. Fleming to head a new agency which will be known as the Office of Temporary Controls. The order consolidates the Office of War Mobilization and Reconversion, the Office of Price Administration, the Civilian Production Administration, and the Office of Economic Stabilization into the new agency.  From: Beth Gore

title: Portrait of Maj. Gen. Philip B. Fleming
Scopenote: Informal photo of Maj. Gen. Philip B. Fleming, who was named to head the new Office of Temporary Controls.  From: Beth Gore

title: Greek Prime Minister Constantine Tsaldaris with Secretary of State James Byrnes
Scopenote: Greek Prime Minister Constantin Tsaldaris (right), shown here with Secretary of State James F. Byrnes, following a call on President Truman at the White House this noon.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Senator Alben Barkley in Mustache
Scopenote: Senator Alben Barkley looks a bit different these days and if you don't think so, just take a look at the upper lip!  The way the Senator from Kentucky is showing it off, he appears mighty proud of the moustache.  From:   Beth Gore.

title: President Truman at military review, saluting the flag
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) stands with two unidentified men during a military review. The President has his hat over his heart as does one of the other men during the review. The Washington Monument is clearly seen in the background. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Senator Claude Pepper of Florida eating lunch
Scopenote: Photo of Senator Claude Pepper of Florida who had just introduced a bill in the Senate asking for a full lunch hour for the Senators. Said the Senator, as it now stands "we can eat only with the fear that some of the Senators are passing some bill behind our backs."  From: Beth Gore

title: Portrait of Clark M. Clifford
Scopenote: Airbrushed formal portrait of Clark M. Clifford, Naval Aide to the President, seated at his desk.  From: Beth Gore

title: Chief Justice of the Supreme Court Fred M. Vinson and Mrs. Vinson in Evening Clothes
Scopenote: Chief Justice of the Supreme Court and Mrs. Fred M. Vinson shown leaving their Wardman Park Hotel apartment for the White House, where they attended the dinner given Supreme Court members and their wives tonight by President and Mrs. Truman. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Governor Thomas E. Dewey signing a bill
Scopenote: Governor Thomas E. Dewey signs the first bill of the 1947 Legislative season, appropriating an additional $25,000,000 for Veterans Housing in New York State.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Robert P. Patterson Leaving the White House
Scopenote: Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson disclosed  that the War and Justice Departments were in conference on what the federal government should do--if anything--on the Georgia governor troubles. Photo shows Patterson leaving the White House following a conference with President Truman.  From: Beth Gore

title: Portrait of Mrs. O. Max Gardner, wife of the ambassador to Great Britain
Scopenote: Portrait of Mrs. O. Max Gardner, wife of the ambassador to Great Britain.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of former President Herbert Hoover shown leaving the White House
Scopenote: Former President Herbert Hoover, shown here leaving the White House, announced today he had agreed at President Truman's request to go to Germany and make a study of food conditions with a view toward relieving "some of the burden on the American taxpayers." From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of James Roosevelt leaving the White House after conferring with President Truman
Scopenote: James Roosevelt, eldest son of the late President, when meeting with President Harry S. Truman, assured him that the Democratic Party of California was solidly behind him.  Roosevelt, chairman of the State Democratic Committee of California, is shown leaving the White House after conferring with President Truman.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Lt. Gen. Ira Eaker testifying before the Senate Inter-State and Foreign Commerce Sub-Committee
Scopenote: Lt. General Ira Eaker, deputy commander of the Army Air Forces, telling the Senate Inter-State and Foreign Commerce Sub-Committee investigating air crashes that approximately 70 percent of military aviation accidents are due to pilot error.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Veterans Administrator, General Omar Bradley, speaking at a press conference
Scopenote: Veterans Administrator, General Omar Bradley, announces at a press conference a three month campaign to reinstate veteran's low-cost government life insurance policies. From: Beth Gore

title: Viscount Alexander, Governor General of Canada, greeted by Secretary of State George C. Marshall
Scopenote: Viscount Alexander, the Governor General of Canada,  and Viscountess Alexander, with Secretary of State George C. Marshall, right, as they arrived at Union Station this afternoon.  From:   Beth Gore.

title: Harold E. Stassen addressing the Senate Labor Committee
Scopenote: Harold E. Stassen offering to Congress a broad program to end "abuses" by labor.  But he opposed Republican-sponsored legislation to end industry-wide bargaining and the closed shop.  In testimony before the Senate Labor Committee, Stassen outlined 10 specific labor reforms which Congress should not do.  Two of the steps he rejected--to outlaw industry-wide bargaining and the closed shop--are advocated by Senator Joseph H. Ball, (R-MN), who was first appointed to the Senate by Stassen.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Dr. Karl T. Compton, President of MIT, testifying before the Atomic Energy Commission
Scopenote: Dr. Karl T. Compton, President of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, strongly endorsed the appointment of Carroll Wilson as General Manager of the Atomic Energy Commission. He told the Senate Atomic Committee, which must pass on the nominations of the Commissioners and General Manager, that he did not know of any better man than Wilson for the job. Compton also said he approved of the policies of the Commission developed thus far.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson presenting the Medal for Merit to Supreme Court Justice Robert H. Jackson
Scopenote: Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson presenting the Medal for Merit to Supreme Court Justice Robert H. Jackson, for his services as Chief of Counsel for the United States for the prosecution of Axis Criminality at the Nuremberg Trials.  From: Beth Gore

title: Dean Acheson defends Herbert S. Marks before the Senate
Scopenote: Under Secretary of State Dean Acheson today offered "to stake my life and my reputation" in opposition to charges of Communism brought against Herbert S. Marks, General Counsel of the Atomic Energy Commission.  Acheson, in an appearance before the Senate Atomic Committee, defended Mark's appointment to the post.   He recounted his two years of close relations with Marks, who served as his assistant in the State Department.  From: Beth Gore

title: Mr. Gael Sullivan, Executive Director of Democratic National Committee
Scopenote: Gael Sullivan, who recently resigned as Second Assistant Postmaster General to accept an appointment as Executive Director of the Democratic National Committee, is shown as he assumed his new post today. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Secretary of State George C. Marshall (right) talking to Rep. Charles A. Eaton, New Jersey
Scopenote: The House Foreign Affairs Committee called Secretary of State George C. Marshall to the Capitol to talk over foreign policy. The General is shown here with Committee Chairman Rep. Charles A. Eaton, New Jersey.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of CIO President Philip Murray as he testified before the Senate Labor Committee
Scopenote: Photo of CIO President Philip Murray as he testified before the Senate Labor Committee.  Mr. Murray indicated that Congress would shove the nation towards economic "catastrophe" if it attempted to weaken unions instead of business monopolies.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Walter P. Reuther as he appeared before the Senate Labor Committee
Scopenote: Walter P. Reuther, President of the United Automobile Workers (CIO), as he appeared before the Senate Labor Committee.  He told the Senators that punitive labor legislation cannot avert industrial strife which would be inevitable unless the economic lot of workers improved.  During his appearance, Reuther had many sharp exchanges with member of the committee, Senator Joseph H. Ball (Minnesota).  From: Beth Gore

title: A portrait of Rep. J. Caleb Boggs of Delaware
Scopenote: New photo of Representative J. Caleb Boggs of Delaware.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of former President Herbert Hoover (right) appearing before the House Foreign Affairs Committee
Scopenote: Photo of former President Herbert Hoover urging Congressional approval of President Truman's request for an additional 350 million dollars for European relief. Mr. Hoover appeared before an open session of the House Foreign Affairs Committee. Left to right, Rep. Sol Bloom, N.Y., Rep. Charles A. Eaton, N. J., Chairman of the Committee and Mr. Hoover.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Portrait of Rep. Charles H. Russell of Nevada
Scopenote: Portrait of Rep. Charles H. Russell of Nevada.  From: Beth Gore

title: Latest portrait of Polish Ambassador to the United States Jozef Winiewicz
Scopenote: Latest portrait of Polish Ambassador to the United States Jozef Winiewicz.    From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Senator Tom Connally (D), Texas
Scopenote: Photo of Senator Tom Connally (D), Texas.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Sen. Robert Taft of Ohio greeting UMW President John L. Lewis
Scopenote: Senator Robert Taft of Ohio welcomes United Mine Workers President John L. Lewis to the Senate Labor Committee where Lewis testified that the effect of "recent intrusions" by the government, in its judicial, legislative and executive branches has been to "arrest collective bargaining the coal industry."  From: Beth Gore.

title: Portrait of Benjamin V. Cohen
Scopenote: Portrait of Benjamin V. Cohen, State Department Legal Counselor. From: Beth Gore.

title: A portrait of General Mark W. Clark
