Scopenote: A portrait of General Mark W. Clark.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Governor Ingram M. Stainback, Governor of Hawaii, appearing before the House Public Lands committee
Scopenote: Photo of Governor Ingram M. Stainback, Governor of Hawaii, appearing before the House Public Lands Committee on the granting of statehood to Hawaii.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Rep. Helen Gahagan Douglas (D.CA)
Scopenote: Rep. Helen Gahagan Douglas (D. CA) took the troubles of every American housewife to the floor of Congress today---the high cost of living. Here she is shown carrying a basket of groceries to the floor of the House where she said the rising cost of living is anything but a mirage.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Senator Robert Taft and A. F. Whitney at Senate Hearing
Scopenote: Senator Robert A. Taft of Ohio (left) welcomes A. F. Whitney, President of the Brotherhood of Railway Trainmen, to the Senate Labor Hearing this morning.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Senator Kenneth S. Wherry, Nebraska, on Horse
Scopenote: Senator Kenneth S. Wherry, GOP Whip of the Senate, shown taking advantage of spring weather in Washington by riding his horse. From: Beth Gore.

title: Margret Truman leaving Washington National Airport
Scopenote: Margaret Truman, daughter of the President, shown leaving Washington National Airport today for her concert debut in Detroit tomorrow night.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Paul Porter reporting to Acting Secretary of State Dean Acheson
Scopenote: Paul Porter (right), chief of the U. S. Economic Mission to Greece, is shown reporting to Acting Secretary of State Dean Acheson at the State Department.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Dean Acheson and Charles Eaton looking at globe
Scopenote: Congress today opened hearings on President Truman's program to aid Greece and Turkey.  Acting Secretary of State Dean Acheson, left, and Rep. Charles A. Eaton, New Jersey, right, Chairman of the House Foreign Affairs Committee, are shown looking at the location of distressed foreign countries on a huge globe in the committee room.   From: Beth Gore

title: A portrait of James Boyd
Scopenote: James Boyd of Colorado, who has been nominated to head the Bureau of Mines.    From: Beth Gore.

title: Portrait of Rep. Monroe M. Redden of North Carolina
Scopenote: Portrait of Rep. Monroe M. Redden of North Carolina.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Paul Porter talking to Rep. Charles A. Eaton (R-NJ)
Scopenote: Paul Porter, recently returned from an inspection tour of Greece for President Truman, shown reporting his findings to Rep. Charles A. Eaton, (R-NJ), Chairman of the House Foreign Affairs Committee. From: Beth Gore

title: Governor William R. Tuck
Scopenote: Latest informal photo of Virginia's Governor William M. Tuck.   From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman and Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson reviewing the Army Day Parade in Washington
Scopenote: President Truman and Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson reviewing the Army Day Parade in Washington.   From: Beth Gore

title: Dr. Edwin G. Nourse With Harriman and Anderson
Scopenote: Dr. Edwin G. Nourse, center, Chairman of President Truman's Council of Economic Advisors, after reporting to the Cabinet on the problem of continuing price rises and general high cost of living. Shown with Dr. Nourse are, left, Secretary of Commerce W. Averell Harriman, and Secretary of Agriculture Clinton P. Anderson, right.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Henry F. Grady being sworn in as the first United States Ambassador to India
Scopenote: Photo of Henry F. Grady being sworn in as the first United States Ambassador to India. Left to right, Stanley F. Woodward, Chief of Protocol of the State Department; Acting Secretary of State Dean Acheson, and Ambassador Grady.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Senator Tom Connally (D), Texas and Senator Edwin C. Johnson (D), Colorado
Scopenote: The Senate by a vote of 67 to 23 passed the Greek-Turkey Aid Bill before passing the $400,000,000 program to the House for final action. Before  passage, the Senate had accepted an amendment from Senator Edwin C. Johnson (D), Colorado, right, declaring that the U.S. would not undertake to underwrite the U.S. Oil Company agreements with other Middle East nations. Shown with Johnson is Texas Senator Tom Connally.  From: Beth Gore

title: A photo of James F. Byrnes
Scopenote: Photo of former Secretary of State James F. Byrnes as he joined the law firm of Hogan and Hartson as counsel.    From: Beth Gore.

title: General A. A. Vandegrift Before Senate Committee
Scopenote: General A. A. Vandegrift, head of the U.S. Marines, told a surprised Senate committee today that proposed unification of the Armed Services would reduce the Marine Corps to "military impotence" and strip it of "everything but name."  Vandegrift was the first high active officer in Armed Service to oppose provisions of President Truman's unification program.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of W.L. MacKenzie King, the Canadian Prime Minister, shown leaving the White House
Scopenote: W.L. MacKenzie King, the Canadian Prime Minister, shown leaving the White House. The Prime Minister said President Truman would soon pay a visit to Canada.  The Prime Minister had been visiting at Virginia Beach and stopped for three days in Washington en route to Canada.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of the presentation of the Postal Department's first "Air Letter" to Secretary of Commerce W. Averill Harriman
Scopenote: The Post Office Department's first "Air Letter,"  peacetime successor to V-Mail, was presented to Secretary of Commerce W. Averill Harriman (right). The presentation was made by Washington Postmaster Vincent O. Burke in the office of Post Master General Robert Hannegan. Left to right are Mr. Burke, Emory S. Land, President of the Air Transport Association, and Secretary Harriman.  From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman Greeting President Miguel Aleman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman extends greetings to Mexican President Miguel Aleman on the portico of the White House as the two Presidents arrived there this afternoon following the parade throughout the city.  From: Beth Gore.

title: United Mine Workers President John L. Lewis talking with A.F.L. President William Green
Scopenote: Photo of United Mine Workers President John L. Lewis talking with American Federation of Labor President William Green at the CIO-AFL unity meeting at the Statler Hotel in Washington, D.C. This meeting represents 13,000,000 worker members. From: Beth Gore

title: General Jonathan Wainwright received Philippine medal for valor
Scopenote: General Jonathan Wainwright, hero of Bataan, today received the Philippine Medal for Valor in a ceremony at the Philippine Embassy. Ambassador Joaquin Elizalde presented the Medal on behalf of President Manuel Roxas of the Philippine Republic. Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson looks on, right.  From:  Beth Gore.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Under Secretary of State Dean Acheson welcoming Philippine Vice President Elpidio Quirino
Scopenote: Photo of Elpidio Quirino, Vice President of the Philippine Republic, arriving in Washington for an official visit. Left to right, Under Secretary of State Dean Acheson, Vice President Quirino and Philippine Ambassador to the U. S. Joaquin M. Elizalde.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Admiral William F. Halsey, retired, before Senate Committee
Scopenote: Admiral William F. Halsey, retired, said today that outside of a strategic bombing force, he "can see no excuse for" an autonomous air service. Halsey made the statement in testimony before the Senate Armed Forces Committee on the Administration's proposal for unifying the military services.   From: Beth Gore

title: Attorney General Tom C. Clark talking to reporters outside the White House
Scopenote: Attorney General Tom C. Clark talking to reporters outside the White House after a cabinet meeting.  From: Beth Gore

title: Senator Milton R. Young
Scopenote: Latest informal photo of Senator Milton R. Young of North Dakota.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Dean Acheson posing for photographers
Scopenote: President Truman today accepted the resignation of Under Secretary of State Dean Acheson, effective the end of June.  Mr. Acheson is shown here as he posed for photographs today.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of General Carl Spaatz (right) and General Dwight D. Eisenhower
Scopenote: General Carl Spaatz and General Dwight D. Eisenhower, Army Chief of Staff, testified before the House Executive Expenditures Committee on Armed Services Unification. Spaatz described the legislation as a positive step toward prevention of war, while Eisenhower, appearing for the third time, reiterated that there was no intention of abolishing the Marine Corps.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo showing Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson presenting the Medal for Merit to Philip Murray, President of the CIO
Scopenote: Photo showing Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson presenting the Medal for Merit to Philip Murray, President of the CIO, for Mr. Murray's services "in connection with the mobilization and leadership of American workers throughout the industrial emergency existing during the Second World War".  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Supreme Court Justice Robert H. Jackson receiving an Honorary Degree of Doctor of Laws from the University of Warsaw
Scopenote: Supreme Court Justice Robert H. Jackson, right, received the Honorary Degree of Doctor of Laws from the University of Warsaw from the Polish Ambassador to the United States, Jozef Winiewicz, on the left. The degree to Justice Jackson was in recognition of his work in the trials of the Nazi War Criminals at Nuremberg.  From: Beth Gore.

title: American Federation of Labor President William F. Green on a park bench
Scopenote: American Federation of Labor President William F. Green on a park bench in front of AFL headquarters.  From: Beth Gore

title: Robert A. Lovett portrait
Scopenote: Robert A. Lovett, former Assistant Secretary of War, after being nominated to succeed Under Secretary of State Dean Acheson.  From: Beth Gore

title: Dean Acheson portrait
Scopenote: Latest portrait of Under Secretary of State Dean Acheson.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of AFL President William Green being presented the Medal of Merit by Robert Patterson
Scopenote: American Federation of Labor President William Green was presented the Medal of Merit for his contribution to labor's war effort in ceremonies at the War Department. The presentation was made by Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson.  From: Beth Gore

title: Senator Arthur Vandenberg with Dr. Paul F. Douglas at American University
Scopenote: Senator Arthur H. Vandenberg, Republican of Michigan, right, was awarded an honorary degree of Doctor of Laws by Dr. Paul F. Douglass, American University President, left, during commencement exercises last night.  The Senator was honored for his efforts in helping maintain a united foreign policy.  From: Beth Gore.

title: House Speaker Joseph W. Martin, Jr. (R-MA), signing a tax reduction bill
Scopenote: House Speaker Joseph W. Martin, Jr., (R), MA, signs the four-billion-dollar-tax reduction bill which was adopted by the Senate with a 48-28 final passage vote. After being signed by Speaker Martin and Senate President Vandenberg, the bill was scheduled to go to the White House for signing.    From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Stanton Griffis, Ambassador Designate to Poland
Scopenote: Honorable Stanton Griffis, Ambassador Designate of the United States to Poland, as he called at the White House.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Mrs. C. Wayland Brooks unveils a statue of Senator William Borah
Scopenote: Photo shows Mrs. C. Wayland Brooks, wife of the Senator from Illinois, unveiling the 19-foot statue of the late Senator William E. Borah of Idaho at the U.S. Capitol this afternoon.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of nominee for U. S. Rep. on the United Nations Economic Commission, Monnet B. Davis
Scopenote: Monnett B. Davis has been nominated by President Truman to be United States Representative on the United Nations Economic Commission for Asia and the Far East.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Secretary of Labor Frances Perkins
Scopenote: A small clipped photo of Secretary of Labor Frances Perkins.  From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman Presented the International Harmon Trophy to Major Alexander P. De Seversky
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman in White House ceremonies presented the International Harmon Trophy to Major Alexander P. De Seversky, aviator, aeronautical engineer, author and authority on air strategy and tactics. The Lique Internationale Des Aviateurs awarded the trophy for "outstanding leadership, patriotism, unselfish devotion to the security and aeronautical progress of the United States." Left to right: Mrs. De Seversky, Major De Seversky, Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson and President Truman.

title: Spruille Braden leaving the White House
Scopenote: Recently resigned Assistant Secretary of State Spruille Braden, shown leaving the White House following a conference with President Truman.   From: Beth Gore.

title: General Omar Bradley
Scopenote: General Omar Bradley, head of the Veteran's Administration, at the White House for a conference with President Truman.  General Bradley is mentioned for the Chief of Staff post of the U. S. Army when General Dwight D. Eisenhower resigns.  From: Beth Gore

title: Senator George Wilson
Scopenote: Latest informal photo of Senator George A. Wilson of Iowa. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of James C. Petrillo, head of the Musicians Labor Union, shown testifying before the House Labor Subcommittee
Scopenote: James C. Petrillo, head of the Musicians Labor Union, is shown in testimony before the House Labor Subcommittee.  From: Beth Gore.

title: John L. Lewis, President of the United Mine Workers
Scopenote: John L. Lewis, President of the United Mine Workers, has a grim look as he signed a wage contract with the Northern and Midwestern soft coal operators, which represented approximately 75% of the soft coal industry.  From: Beth Gore

title: President Truman and the Rt. Rev. Msgr. Edward J. Flanagan, founder of Boys Town in Nebraska
Scopenote: The Rt. Rev. Msgr. Edward J. Flanagan, founder of Boys Town in Nebraska, reported to the President on his recent mission to Japan where he assisted the Japanese government in plans for improved child welfare programs. He said he gave the President messages of good will from General Douglas MacArthur and from the Japanese Emperor and Empress. Father Flanagan is shown here with President Truman at his desk.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of George M. Humphrey, Chairman of the Pittsburg Consolidation Coal Co
Scopenote: Photo of George M. Humphrey, Chairman of the Pittsburg Consolidation Coal Company, one of the Nation's largest coal operators.  He indicated the recent miners wage increase conforms to the 15% hourly wage raise pattern.  Humphrey told Congress that there is "nothing wildly inflationary or grossly unreasonable" in the $1.20 a day wage boost granted John L. Lewis' United Mine Workers.  From:  Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Mrs. Kenneth C. Royall
Scopenote: Photo of Mrs. Kenneth C. Royall, wife of the Under Secretary of War, who was nominated by President Truman to be Secretary of War, replacing Secretary Patterson.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Walter P. Reuther as he appeared before the Senate Small Business Subcommittee on Steel
Scopenote: Walter P. Reuther, President of the United Auto Workers (CIO), charged at a hearing before the Senate Small Business Subcommittee on Steel, that the steel industry wanted "planned scarcity" and that that would cause a major depression.  He stated the industry had no faith in the future.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Stanton Griffis, American Ambassador to Poland
Scopenote: A photograph of Stanton Griffis, who was recently named American Ambassador to Poland.  From: Beth Gore.

title: The swearing in of David K.E. Bruce as Assistant Secretary of Commerce
Scopenote: David K.E. Bruce, left, is shown being sworn in today as Assistant Secretary of Commerce by Secretary of Commerce W. Averill Harriman.    From: Beth Gore

title: Robert A. Lovett, Undersecretary of State, testifying before the Senate War Investigating Subcommittee
Scopenote: Robert A. Lovett, Undersecretary of State, but Assistant Secretary of War for Air in 1942, told the Senate War Investigating Subcommittee that the War and Navy Departments agreed to furnish necessary engines for the Kaiser-Hughes flying boats because they were requested to do so by War Production Board Chief Donald Nelson.  This was the same reason given by Jesse Jones, former Reconstruction Finance Corporation head when he had testified.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Cyrus S. Ching
Scopenote: A photo of Cyrus S. Ching, 71 year old labor relations expert of the U. S. Rubber Company, after his appointment by President Harry S. Truman to be the Director of the new Independent Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service created by the Taft-Hartley Labor Law.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Senator Homer Ferguson of Michigan, signing a subpoena
Scopenote: Photo of Senator Homer Ferguson of Michigan, Chairman of the Senate War Investigating Sub-Committee investigating Howard Hughes, signing a subpoena for the recall of Hughes' publicity man, Johnny Meyer, to the stand.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Dillon S. Myer, Federal Public Housing Authority Commissioner, before House Subcommittee
Scopenote: Dillon S. Myer, Federal Public Housing Authority Commissioner, shown before the House subcommittee investigating Co-ops.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photograph of Assistant Secretary of State Charles Eskridge Saltzman
Scopenote: Photograph of Assistant Secretary of State Charles Eskridge Saltzman at desk.   From: Beth Gore.

title: A photo of Cyrus S. Ching
Scopenote: An informal photo of Cyrus S. Ching, new director of the new Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Portrait of Harold E. Stassen
Scopenote: Portrait of Harold E. Stassen, former governor of Minnesota.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Henry J. Kaiser appearing before the RFC
Scopenote: Photo of Henry J. Kaiser requesting the Reconstruction Finance Corporation write off $34,510,000 of the debt he owed the government for the Fontana, California steel plant.  In return, he promised to raise $80,000,000 by private financing to double the steel-making capacity of the Fontana plant.  He believed this would have had a material effect on relieving the existing steel shortage.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Harold E. Stassen at a press conference
Scopenote: Harold E. Stassen, former Governor of Minnesota, at a press conference at the Statler Hotel where he predicted "a wide open race" for the 1948 Republican Presidential nomination and said he would enter the Wisconsin GOP primary in April.  Stassen, the only avowed GOP Presidential candidate, told a news conference he believed that as of that time no Republican had the nomination in hand.  From: Beth Gore

title: Raymond M. Foley, National Housing Administrator
Scopenote: Raymond M. Foley, National Housing Administrator, shown appearing before the Joint House-Senate Committee which opened an investigation on the housing situation. From Beth Gore

title: Speaker of the House Joseph W. Martin at a press conference
Scopenote: Speaker of the House Joseph W. Martin at a press conference saying that "nothing has been brought to my attention" which would make it necessary to call a special session of Congress.  From: Beth Gore

title: President Truman returns to Washington from South American Trip
Scopenote: President Truman returned to Washington today completing a 10,845 mile trip to South America. He is shown here leaving the Presidential Yacht Williamsburg which carried him to Norfolk, VA. At the White House awaiting Mr. Truman was a three weeks accumulation of work which had piled up during his first real vacation since he took office in April, 1945.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of State George C. Marshall and Under Secretary of State Robert A. Lovett on their way to the White House
Scopenote: Secretary of State George C. Marshall and Under Secretary of State Robert A. Lovett hurried to the White House today to report on the international situation, probably in view of requesting a special session of Congress.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of President Truman appealing for support for the Community Chest Drive
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman tonight made his annual appeal by radio in support of the Community Chest Drive.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Former Secretary of State Cordell Hull working on his memoirs
Scopenote: Former Secretary of State Cordell Hull is pictured at Naval Medical Center, Bethesda, Maryland, at work writing his memoirs. Hull, who will celebrate his 76th birthday on October 2, resigned as Secretary of State in November 1944 when his health collapsed and since has been intermittently under medical care.  From: Beth Gore

title: Full-length view of Mr. Gael Sullivan, Executive Director of Democratic National Committee
Scopenote: Gael Sullivan; Executive Director of the Democratic National Committee, as he called at the White House today.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Charles Luckman, Chairman of the President's Citizen's Food Committee
Scopenote: Charles Luckman, Chairman of the President's Citizen's Food Committee, displays the new food saving poster at his first press conference at the White House.  From: Beth Gore

title: Charles Luckman, Chairman of the Citizen's Food Committee
Scopenote: In line with President Truman's appeal to the public to save 100 million bushels of grain in the next nine months, the committee appointed by the President called on Americans to adopt a five-point food conservation program. Charles Luckman, Chairman of the Citizen's Food Committee, is shown with many of the posters to be used in the conservation campaign.  From: Beth Gore

title: Press conference of Senator McGrath
Scopenote: After Postmaster General Robert Hannegan announced he was stepping down as Chairman of the Democratic National Committee, it was then announced that Senator J. Howard McGrath (D), Rhode Island, had been designated as his successor. The Senator, shown here at a press conference, said he planned to keep on being a Senator.   From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Senator J. Howard McGrath, (D), R.I., Chairman of the Democratic National Committee
Scopenote: Photo of Senator J. Howard McGrath, (D), Rhode Island, Chairman of the Democratic National Committee.  From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman and Charles Luckman reported to the nation on television about the food situation
Scopenote: President Truman reported to the nation tonight on the food situation, as did Charles Luckman, right, head of the Citizen's Food Committee. It marked the first time that television has entered the White House to televise a broadcast, as photographed here.  From: Beth Gore

title: Admiral Chester Nimitz as an honorary Chief of the Ottawa Indian Foundation
Scopenote: The corn was green at the Mayflower Hotel after Admiral Chester W. Nimitz was made an honorary Chief by the Ottawa Indian Foundation of Harbor Springs, Michigan. Photo shows the Admiral doing the Indian war chant and smoking a pipe of peace.  From: Beth Gore

title: Portrait at desk of Tighe E. Woods, Housing Expediter
Scopenote: Tighe E. Woods today was appointed housing expediter to replace Frank R. Creedon, who resigned. Mr. Woods has served as Mr. Creedon's deputy.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Sec. of Commerce W. Averill Harriman and two Senators
Scopenote: The Senate Foreign Relations Committee held  hearings on the aid to Europe food program with Secretary of Commerce W. Averill Harriman on the stand. Secretary Harriman is pictured here, center, with Senator Arthur H. Vandenberg, Michigan, left and Senator Tom Connally, Texas, right.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Chairman Marriner S. Eccles of the Federal Reserve Board Appearing Before the Senate Banking Committee
Scopenote: Chairman Marriner S. Eccles of the Federal Reserve Board appeared before the Senate Banking Committee to defend the Board's request for power to restrict bank credit by requiring banks to increase their reserves. His defense was aimed primarily at the criticism of bankers, who want the board to resort to traditional ways of  restricting credit by increasing bank discount rates and refusing to buy bank-held bonds being sold to provide new reserves for deposits.  From: Beth Gore.

title: John L. Lewis before Senate Subcommittee
Scopenote: John L. Lewis, President of the United Mine Workers, shown before the Senate Subcommittee of the Inter-State Foreign Commerce Committee.   From:  Beth Gore

title: John L. Lewis, United Mine Workers President, is shown talking with Senator Owen Brewster of Maine
Scopenote: John L. Lewis, United Mine Workers President, is shown talking with Senator Owen Brewster of Maine at the Senate Subcommittee hearing of the Inter-State Foreign Commerce Committee.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photos of Edwin W. Pauley as he appeared before a Congressional committee
Scopenote: Candid photos of Edwin W. Pauley, millionaire California oilman and special assistant to Army Secretary Kenneth C. Royall, taken at a Congressional committee where Pauley was called to answer charges that he is a "gambler" in the commodity market.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Drucie Snyder and her friend, Margaret Truman on radio program
Scopenote: Drucie Snyder, daughter of Secretary of the Treasury and Mrs. John W. Snyder, and her friend Margaret Truman, daughter of the President. Miss Snyder is shown interviewing Miss Truman about her recent concert tour on Miss Snyder's daily radio program.   From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Wayne Coy, Chairman of the Federal Communications Commission
Scopenote: Photo of Wayne Coy, Chairman of the Federal Communications Commission.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Fred M. Vinson Portrait as Chief Justice of the Supreme Court
Scopenote: Chief Justice of the Supreme Court, Fred M. Vinson, has approved this portrait by a Harris and Ewing artist.  The picture was made last week (no date on photo).   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Philip Murray, President of the Executive Committee of the CIO
Scopenote: Photo of Philip Murray, President of the Executive Committee of the CIO, at a meeting.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Dr. Chaim Weizmann, head and shoulders informal portrait
Scopenote: Photo portrait of Dr. Chaim Weizmann in overcoat, laughing. He was the first President of Israel.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Fred M. Vinson
Scopenote: Small photograph of Chief Justice of the Supreme Court, Fred Vinson, apparently at a hearing.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Lt. Col. Francis W. Williams in cockpit
Scopenote: Lt. Col. Francis W. Williams, an Air Force pilot with 10,500 hours flying time in the past 16 years, is President Trumans new pilot (in photo).  He replaces Col. Henry T. (Hank) Myers, veteran airplane pilot who has flown Presidents and Cabinet Members all over the world and who is retiring to take a job as a civil airline pilot.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Lt. Col. Francis W. Williams, President Truman's pilot
Scopenote: Lt. Col. Francis W. Williams, who has been named new personal pilot for President Truman and members of the Cabinet.   From: Beth Gore.

title: House Speaker Joseph W. Martin, Jr. (L), (R-MA) and Senate Pro-Tempore Senator Arthur H. Vandenberg (R-MI)
Scopenote: Shown are the heads of both houses of Congress in conference. On the left is Speaker Joseph Martin, Jr., MA and right is Senator Arthur H. Vandenberg, MI, President Pro-Tempore of the Senate. From: Beth Gore

title: Secretary of Commerce W. Averill Harriman before a Senate Committee
Scopenote: Secretary of Commerce W. Averill Harriman is shown warning a Senate committee that an economic collapse is inevitable unless inflation is checked, and "any further relaxation of rent controls would represent an inflationary step."  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Rep. Fred A. Hartley, Jr. Talking to James C. Petrillo
Scopenote: Chairman Fred A. Hartley, Jr., Congressman from New Jersey, told James C. Petrillo today that he was "clearly in violation" of the Lea Act despite the recent acquittal of the Musicians Union Leader in Federal court in Chicago. The two are shown together before the start of the hearing.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of General Lucius D. Clay, right, with Senator Styles Bridges of New Hampshire
Scopenote: General Lucius D. Clay, American Military commander in Germany, appeared before the Senate Appropriations Committee in a session conducted behind closed doors. He is shown here with committee chairman, Senator Styles Bridges of New Hampshire.  From: Beth Gore

title: Paul Porter (right), talking to former Gov. Herbert H. Lehman of New York
Scopenote: Paul Porter (right), former Federal Communications Commission Chairman and Office of Price Administration Chief, reviewing papers with former Governor of New York Herbert Lehman, prior to testifying on the Marshall Plan before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee.  From: Beth Gore

title: Tighe E. Woods, Housing expediter, testifying before the Senate Banking Subcommittee
Scopenote: Housing Expediter Tighe E. Woods said today he thought very little material is being saved for housing by restrictions in the present housing act on non-essential business construction. Woods told a Senate Banking Subcommittee on rent that "I would feel bad" if the clause were eliminated from the Act.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Thomas B. McCabe, nominee for head of the Federal Reserve Board, leaving the White House
Scopenote: Thomas B. McCabe, Philadelphia industrialist who was nominated to head the Federal Reserve Board, is shown leaving the White House after a conference with President Truman. From: Beth Gore.

title: Former Senator Robert La Follette, Jr
Scopenote: Former Senator Robert M. La Follette, Jr., shown before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee.   From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Walter P. Reuther, UAW-CIO President, testifying before Congress against cutting the Marshall Plan
Scopenote: Walter P. Reuther, UAW-CIO President, testifying before Congress against cutting the Marshall Plan funds on the assumption that "an apple a day will keep totalitarianism away."  Reuther urged the Senate Foreign Relations Committee to take a "long second look" at the proposed $6,800,000,000 down payment to see whether it should not be increased, instead of reduced as many prominent persons recommended.  From: Beth Gore

title: Speaker of the House Joseph W. Martin and Senator Arthur Vandenberg
Scopenote: Two Republicans laughing - Speaker of the House Joseph W. Martin and Senator Arthur H. Vandenberg, wearing tuxedoes.   From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Monnett B. Davis, former U. S. Minister to Denmark and Consulate-General at Shanghai
Scopenote: Monnett B. Davis, former U. S. Minister to Denmark and Consulate-General at Shanghai, is being considered as new Ambassador to Panama to fill the vacancy left by the resignation of Brig. Gen. Frank T. Hines.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Sen. Olin D. Johnston (South Carolina) and his family
Scopenote: Senator Olin D. Johnston was one of the many boycotters of the Truman Jefferson-Jackson Dinner speech.  The Senator, Mrs. Johnson and their two children, Sallie-Leigh, 10; Elizabeth, 8, dined at home last night.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Rep. Sol Bloom and Rep. Charles Eaton With Henry A. Wallace
Scopenote: Henry A. Wallace (right) is greeted by Rep. Sol Bloom, New York, left, and Chairman Charles A. Eaton, New Jersey, as the hearing before House Foreign Affairs got underway this morning.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Czech Ambassador Juraj Slavik Leaving the Embassy in Washington
Scopenote: While a moving van is backed up to the door to take away the personal belongings of his family, Czech Ambassador Juraj Slavik leaves the Embassy in Washington for other quarters after resigning his diplomatic post in protest over the Communist coup in his homeland.  From: Beth Gore.

title: George V. Allen, Assistant Secretary of State, signing his official papers
Scopenote: Assistant Secretary of State George V. Allen signs his papers following his swearing in today as Mrs. Allen and their two children, Jack, 9; and George, 12, look on.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Czech Ambassador Juraj Slavik After he Resigned his Diplomatic Post
Scopenote: Photo of Czech Ambassador Juraj Slavik after he resigned his diplomatic post in protest over the Communist coup in his homeland. Slavik, shown here at a press conference, said he was convinced that President Edouard Benes "acted under terrible pressure and duress" during the Communist coup.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Czech Ambassador Juraj Slavik Shown Leaving the Embassy in Washington
Scopenote: Czech Ambassador Juraj Slavik shown leaving the Embassy in Washington after he resigned his diplomatic post in protest over the Communist Coup in his homeland.  From: Beth Gore.

title: George V. Allen sworn in as Assistant Secretary of State
Scopenote: George V.  Allen (center) today took the oath of office as Assistant Secretary of State.  The oath was administered by Marvin Will, Chief of the Foreign Service Personnel, while acting Secretary of State Robert Lovett (at left) looks on.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Tom C. Clark addressing the Senate
Scopenote: A new informal portrait of Attorney General Tom C. Clark during a meeting with the Senate.  From: Beth Gore

title: Lt. General Albert C. Wedemeyer with Rep. Charles Eaton (N.J.)
Scopenote: Lt. Gen. Albert C. Wedemeyer (left) told the House Foreign Affairs Committee today that the American Economic Assistance to China must be protected with military aid against the "vast movement" of Communism. He is pictured here with Committee Chairman Rep. Charles Eaton of New Jersey.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Dr. Edward U. Condon Speaking to Reporters
Scopenote: Dr. Edward U. Condon, head of the Bureau of Standards, meeting with members of the press following hearings of the House Un-American Activities Committee. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Dr. Edward U. Condon at a House Un-American Activities Committee Meeting
Scopenote: Dr. Edward U. Condon, head of the Bureau of Standards, sits in the audience at the House Un-American Activities Committee this morning as the hearing got underway on Dr. Condon's reported disloyalty charges. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Thomas B. McCabe (L) and Senator Charles W. Tobey (NH)
Scopenote: Thomas B. McCabe told the Senate Banking Committee that although "there doubtless have been mistakes" he thought his war surplus property disposal agency did the best possible job. The Philadelphia banker answered criticisms of his administration as foreign liquidation commissioner in a 24-page statement as the committee resumed hearings on his nomination as chairman of the Federal Reserve Board. He is pictured here with Senator Charles W. Tobey, (R), NH, who accused McCabe and a Senate investigator last week with making "very poor bargains" as liquidation commissioner.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Conciliation Chief Cyrus S. Ching Testifying Before the Joint Congressional Committee on Atomic Energy
Scopenote: Conciliation Chief Cyrus S. Ching testifying before the Joint Congressional Committee on Atomic Energy. He indicated that atomic energy workers should be rewarded if they are denied the right to strike. "Although strikes in these plants cannot be tolerated," Ching said, "we want to get the best possible people and have them proud to be there." From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of John L. Lewis, President of the United Mine Workers, shaking hands with Cyrus S. Ching
Scopenote: Photo of John L. Lewis, President of the United Mine Workers, shaking hands with Cyrus S. Ching, Federal Mediation Director, prior to a luncheon where they discussed the pending miner's strike. Government officials had expressed fear that the soft coal strike might weaken the United States' position in the "cold war" against Russia. They are at the Carlton Hotel in Washington, D. C.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Dr. Karl T. Compton, President of MIT, testifying before the Senate Armed Services Committee
Scopenote: Dr. Karl T. Compton, President of Massachusetts Institute of Technology and head of President Truman's Commission on Universal Training, warned Senators today that "time is running out" and urged that Congress approve universal military training this year. He testified before the Senate Armed Services Committee.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Senator Arthur H Vandenberg with Secretary of State George C. Marshall
Scopenote: In an appearance postponed last week because of President Truman's Joint-Session-of-Congress speech, Secretary of State George C. Marshall went before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee today to explain the U.S. foreign policy plan in an executive session.  He is pictured here with Senator Arthur H. Vandenberg, Michigan, Chairman of the Committee.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Omar Bradley speaking before the Senate Armed Services Committee
Scopenote: Chief of Staff General Omar Bradley pictured here as he appeared before the Senate Armed Services Committee. The General is shown at charts as he testified before the committee.   From: Beth Gore

title: Federal Judge Sherman Minton, Chairman of the three-man Presidential Board set up to review the coal strike
Scopenote: Federal Judge Sherman Minton, Chairman of the three-man Presidential Board set up to review the coal strike, shown reading a letter from John L. Lewis, United Mine Workers President, in which he refused to appear before the fact-finding board.  From: Beth Gore

title: John L. Lewis, President of the United Mine Workers, as he appeared before the President's fact-finding board
Scopenote: John L. Lewis, President of the United Mine Workers, as he appeared before the President's fact-finding board which was investigating the 16-day old coal strike.  Mr. Lewis appeared before the board after bowing to a Federal court order and the threat of another contempt citation.  From: Beth Gore

title: Henry A. Wallace testifying before Congress
Scopenote: Henry A. Wallace told Congress today that President Truman's preparedness program would set off an armaments race leading inevitably to "unnecessary war." Mr. Wallace appeared before the Senate Armed Services Committee.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Dr. Leonard A. Scheele, U.S. Surgeon General, and his predecessor, Dr. Thomas Parran
Scopenote: Photo of Doctor Leonard A. Scheele after being sworn in as Surgeon General, U. S. Public Health Service, to succeed Doctor Thomas Parran. Dr. Parran, left, is shown congratulating Dr. Scheele following the swearing in.  From: Beth Gore.

title: A photo of Prince Charles of Belgium being greeted by President Truman at the White House
Scopenote: Prince Charles of Belgium was warmly greeted by President Harry S. Truman as he arrived at the White House. Later in the evening the Chief Executive entertained the Prince at a stag dinner. Left to right: Prince Charles, President Truman and the Prime Minister of Belgium, Paul Henri Spaak.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Paul G. Hoffman, while President of the Studebaker Corporation
Scopenote: Photo of Paul G. Hoffman, President of the Studebaker Corporation, before being named Director of the Marshall Plan. Mr. Hoffman had just returned to Washington from a survey of Far East economic and export problems.  From: Beth Gore

title: Paul G. Hoffman (left) and Senate President Arthur Vandenberg
Scopenote: Paul G. Hoffman, left, President of the Studebaker Corporation, who yesterday was named by President Truman to be Director of the Marshall Plan, is shown here with Senate President Vandenberg shortly after Hoffman's nomination was confirmed by the Senate.  From: Beth Gore

title: Swearing in of Paul G. Hoffman as Director of the Marshall Plan
Scopenote: Shortly after taking the oath as Director of the Marshall Plan, Paul G. Hoffman was congratulated by President Truman. In the center is Chief Justice of the Supreme Court Fred M. Vinson, who administered the oath in a brief White House ceremony.  From: Beth Gore

title: Paul G. Hoffman being sworn in as head of the Marshall Plan
Scopenote: Photo of Paul G. Hoffman being sworn in as head of the Foreign Assistance Program (Marshall Plan). Chief Justice Fred M. Vinson is shown administering the oath while President Truman can be seen looking on from behind his desk.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Prime Minister Paul-Henri Spaak of Belgium
Scopenote: Photo of Prime Minister Paul-Henri Spaak of Belgium.  He has been in Washington with Prince Regent Charles.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Marriner S. Eccles & Senator Robert Taft
Scopenote: Marriner S. Eccles, right, retiring Chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, shown here with Senator Robert A. Taft of Ohio, today told the House-Senate Economic Committee that the country is still threatened with inflationary dangers which may lead "to economic chaos and the possible collapse of our system."  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Dennis A. Fitzgerald of the Department of Agriculture
Scopenote: Dennis A. Fitzgerald of the Department of Agriculture, was appointed head of the Food Division of the Marshall Plan by Paul G. Hoffman.  From: Beth Gore

title: Portrait of Dennis A. Fitzgerald, head of the food division of the Marshall Plan
Scopenote: Formal portrait of Dennis A. Fitzgerald of the Department of Agriculture, whose appointment as head of the Food Division of the Marshall Plan was announced by Paul G. Hoffman today.  From:  Beth Gore.

title: Paul G. Hoffman, head of the Marshall Plan, holding his first press conference
Scopenote: Photo showing Paul G. Hoffman, head of the Marshall Plan, holding his first press conference. He announced the appointment of Dennis A. Fitzgerald of the Department of Agriculture to head the important food division of his organization. This was the first top appointment to the staff which will help Hoffman run the $5,300,000,000 European Recovery Program.  From: Beth Gore

title: Thomas B. McCabe Sworn In as Chairman of the Federal Reserve System
Scopenote: Thomas B. McCabe (left) is being sworn in by Chief Justice Fred L. Vinson (right) as Chairman of the Federal Reserve System. Mrs. McCabe is in the center.  From: Beth Gore.

title: John L. Lewis leaving District Court after being found guilty of criminal and civil contempt of court
Scopenote: John L. Lewis, head of the United Mine Workers, leaving District Court after he was found guilty of criminal and civil contempt of court for failing to end the recent coal strike. Lewis was directed to appear before Judge Goldsborough for sentencing.  From: Beth Gore

title: W. Averill Harriman, newly appointed Ambassador-at-large to the Marshall Plan countries
Scopenote: W. Averill Harriman, after being named by President Truman to be Ambassador-at-Large to the Marshall Plan countries, clears his desk at the Department of Commerce preparatory to taking over the new post.  From:  Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall at he appeared before the Senate Appropriations Committee
Scopenote: While endorsing plans to build up the Air Force to 66 groups, Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall told the Senate Appropriations Committee that an enemy nation does not need a large fleet to seize bases in Alaska or the Azores from which to attack the United States by air.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Dr. Harry A. Curtis, Vice-Chairman of the Tennessee Valley Authority
Scopenote: Photo of Dr. Harry A. Curtis, successor to Dr. Harcourt Morgan, Vice-Chairman of the Tennessee Valley Authority. He is a chemical engineer.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Charles Sawyer at desk, shown after succeeding W. Averell Harriman as Secretary of Commerce
Scopenote: Portrait of Charles Sawyer at a desk, shown after succeeding W. Averell Harriman as Secretary of Commerce.  From: Beth Gore

title: Allen Sproul with Senator Robert Taft
Scopenote: Allan Sproul, right, President of the New York Federal Reserve Bank, today charged before the House-Senate Economic Committee that the Federal Reserve Board was proposing "clumsy methods" for dealing with monetary inflation. Sproul is shown here with Senator Robert A. Taft, Co-chairman of the committee.  From: Beth Gore.

title: John L. Lewis shown walking out on the soft coal wage conference
Scopenote: John L. Lewis, President of the United Mine Workers, shown leaving the Shoreham Hotel after walking out on the soft coal wage conference.  Lewis quit the conference when the coal operators voted, over his objections to seat Joseph E. Moody, President of the Southern Coal Producers Association.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Yakov A. Malik, Russian Deputy Foreign Minister and USSR Representative to the United Nations
Scopenote: Photo of Yakov A. Malik, Russian Deputy Foreign Minister who replaced Andrei Gromyko as USSR Representative to the United Nations.  The photo was taken in his cabin aboard the SS Queen Mary.  From: Beth Gore.

title: John L. Lewis, President of the United Mine Workers, at press conference
Scopenote: John L. Lewis, President of the United Mine Workers, shown at a press conference (seated at table, right) where he said that three industrialists "have the power to determine whether he will have peace or war in the coal industry".  The three he named are: Benjamin Fairless, President of the U.S. Steel Corporation; George Humphrey, President of M.A. Hanna Company, and J. B. Frances, President of Island Creek Coal Company.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Robert Butler taking the oath of office as Ambassador to Cuba
Scopenote: Justice Frank Murphy, right, of the U. S. Supreme Court, administers the oath of office to Robert Butler, newly appointed U. S. Ambassador to Cuba.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Dr. Vera Weizmann, Dr. Chaim Weizmann, and Stanley Woodward
Scopenote: Dr. Chaim Weizmann, President of Israel, arrived late today for a conference tomorrow with President Harry S. Truman. He and his wife and party will spend the night at Blair House. Left to right: Dr. Vera Weizmann, Dr. Chaim Weizmann, and Stanley Woodward, Chief of State Department Protocol Division, who greeted them at Union Station in Washington, D. C. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Dr. Chaim Weizmann at Press Conference
Scopenote: New informal(profile) photo of Dr. Chaim Weizmann, President of the Provincial Government of Israel, taken at his press conference today at the Blair House.

title: Photo of Sir Oliver Franks, British Ambassador to the U. S., and his family
Scopenote: Sir Oliver Franks, British Ambassador to the United States, pictured as he arrived at Union Station in Washington D. C. with Lady Franks and their children, Carolyn 9, and Alison 3.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Henry A. Wallace testifying before the Senate
Scopenote: Testifying today before the Senate Judiciary Committee, Henry A. Wallace denounced the Communist Control Bill as a "declaration of War" on American rights and an action to make "martyrs" out of Communists. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of William J. Hopkins being sworn in as Executive Clerk
Scopenote: William J. Hopkins (left) being sworn in as Executive Clerk by Justice Richmond B. Keech (right) of the District Court of the United States for the District of Columbia. The ceremony took place in President Harry S. Truman's office with the Chief Executive looking on. Mr. Hopkins succeeds Maurice Latta, who died several weeks ago.  From: Beth Gore

title: Charles R. Denny appearing before Senate investigators regarding "Voice of America" scripts
Scopenote: Charles R. Denny, Vice-President, General Counsel for NBC and former Chairman of the FCC, told Senate investigators that "Voice of America" scripts were not as bad as they were painted by some critics.  He stated translations of the Spanish language were not accurate.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Charles F. Brannan is sworn in as Secretary of Agriculture
Scopenote: Charles F. Brannan (right) is sworn in as Secretary of Agriculture by Supreme Court Justice Wiley Rutledge.   Mr. Brannan succeeds Clinton P. Anderson who resigned last month to run for Senator from New Mexico.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Paul G. Hoffman, testifying before the Senate Appropriations Committee
Scopenote: Photo of Paul G. Hoffman, Director of the Marshall Plan, testifying before the Senate Appropriations Committee that unless the House cut in aid funds is restored, Europe will not get the tools and machinery needed for recovery.  From: Beth Gore

title: Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall at a press conference outlining the Army's plans for draftees
Scopenote: Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall at a press conference outlining the Army's plans for draftees.  In addition to draftees, Mr. Royall said the Army hoped to get from 250,000 to 300,000 volunteers through regular enlistments.  Both draftees and volunteers will get eight week's basic training.  At the end of the period inductees may remain in the United States or go overseas.  From: Beth Gore

title: Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug as he appeared before the House Executive Expenditures Subcommittee
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Julius A. Krug as he accused two California Congressmen of trying to "emasculate" the Family Farm Provision of the Reclamation Law. The charges against Senator Sheridan Downey and Representative Alfred J. Elliott were made before a House Executive Expenditures Subcommittee. The group has been investigating charges that federal funds were used illegally for propaganda purposes in connection with Central Valley. Secretary Krug said that neither Downey nor Elliott had proved any misuse of funds in connection with the Central Valley Project.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photograph of Mrs. Charles F. Brannan
Scopenote: Photograph of Mrs. Charles F. Brannan, wife of the Secretary of Agriculture.

title: Secretary of Treasury John W. Snyder after he put his signature on a check for $7,500,000,000
Scopenote: Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder after he put his signature on a check for $7,500,000,000, the largest ever drawn on the United States Treasury.  Actually, the money stayed in the Government, passing from the Unemployment Trust Fund to the Bureau of Accounts for investment in the new Treasury short-term certificates.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of President Truman greeting President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela
Scopenote: Photo of President Harry S. Truman extending a warm welcome to President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela today when he arrived in Washington for an 11-day official visit. Cabinet members and other high-ranking government officials were also on hand at the Military Air Transport Services terminal for the reception according President Gallegos as he stepped from President Truman's private plane (the Independence) which brought him to the Capital. From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman and White House Press Secretary Charles G. Ross are watching television in the Oval Office
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and his press secretary, Charles G. Ross, viewing the activities at the Democratic National Convention via television in the Chief Executive's office. From: Beth Gore.

title: A photo of Stanton Griffis, U. s. Ambassador to Egypt
Scopenote: A picture of Stanton Griffis, after being sworn in as U. S. Ambassador to Egypt. He was formerly American envoy to Poland.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Senator Alben W. Barkley, Head and Shoulders Photo
Scopenote: Senator Alben W. Barkley of Kentucky looks like the Democratic National Convention's unanimous choice for Vice-President.  At 70, he has spent half his life in Congress and is a loyal Democrat and party workhorse.  The gray-haired Kentuckian is a widower with three children.  This is a new portrait of Mr. Barkley.  From:   Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Henry F. Grady being sworn in as American Ambassador to Greece
Scopenote: Stanley Woodward, left, Chief of Protocol of the State Department, administers the oath of office to Henry F. Grady, newly appointed American Ambassador to Greece.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Gen Lucius D. Clay and top U. S. officials
Scopenote: Top U. S. officials held a lengthy conference with the President on the Berlin situation. Left to right: Undersecretary of Army William H. Draper, Jr.; General Lucius D. Clay; Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall; and Secretary of the Navy John L. Sullivan.  From: Beth Gore

title: General Lucius D. Clay, Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall, and Undersecretary of the Army William H. Draper
Scopenote: General Lucius D. Clay (center), U. S. Military Commander in Germany, pictured as he arrived at the White House for a conference with the President and other top officials on America's next move in the Berlin crisis. On left is Secretary of Army Kenneth Royall, and right, William H. Draper, Undersecretary of Army. From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of General Lucius D. Clay and his political advisor, Robert Murphy
Scopenote: General Lucius D. Clay, leaving for Berlin, indicates his pleasure with the success of his mission in Washington. Shown with him is his political advisor Robert Murphy.  From Beth Gore

title: Gen. Lucius D. Clay presenting a document to Congressman Charles Eaton, R-New York, Chairman of the House Foreign Affairs Committee
Scopenote: A photo of General Lucius D. Clay (right) presenting the House Foreign Affairs Committee the general conditions in Berlin and the action of the American troops and personnel. Here he is shown with Chairman Charles Eaton, R-New York, left. From: Beth Gore.

title: Elizabeth Bentley Takes Oath Before Testifying
Scopenote: Miss Elizabeth T. Bentley, described as a "one-time communist espionage agent," is  sworn in before taking the stand before a Senate investigating committee where she told how she had gathered military information from U.S. Government sources, including the Army Air Forces, for a Russian travel agency.   From:   Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder appearing before the House Banking and Currency Committee
Scopenote: Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder appearing before the House Banking and Currency Committee, saying that the Republican program for halting inflation will not do the job.  Mr. Snyder said the measures recommended by the GOP were necessary, but were only part of an overall program that should be approved if the inflationary spiral was to be halted.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Duncan Lee as he Appeared Before the House Un-American Activities Committee
Scopenote: Photo of Duncan Lee, China-born Rhodes Scholar and former Lt. Colonel in the O.S.S., appearing before the House Un-American Activities Committee. He is answering charges made by Elizabeth Bentley, admitting he knew Ms. Bentley but denied that he knew of her connection with the Communist Party. Unlike several of his predecessors on the witness stand, Lee answered the questions put to him but categorically denied all charges against him. From: Beth Gore.

title: Elizabeth Bentley Testifies Before the House Committee on Unamerican Activities
Scopenote: Elizabeth T. Bentley takes the stand before the House Committee on Unamerican Activities.  She is shown here as she prepared to refute the testimony of Duncan Lee (seated right in back) whom she had accused of supplying secret data to the Russian government during the war years.  From:  Beth Gore.

title: Governor Maurice Tobin with Mrs. Tobin Leaving White House
Scopenote: Former Governor Maurice J. Tobin of Massachusetts today conferred with President Truman regarding his appointment as Secretary of Labor. Governor Tobin is shown leaving the White House with Mrs. Tobin after the conference. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Lauchlin Currie Appearing before the House Un-American Activities Committee
Scopenote: Lauchlin Currie, former aide to late President Franklin D. Roosevelt, testifying before the House Un-American Activities Committee, denounced as lies the charges that he fed U. S. secrets to a wartime Soviet espionage network. He said the charges of his accuser, Miss Elizabeth Bentley, were based upon "hearsay three times removed." From: Beth Gore.

title: Maurice Tobin, Secretary of Labor, at desk
Scopenote: A new informal pose of Maurice Tobin who recently was appointed Secretary of Labor by President Truman.    From: Beth Gore.

title: Maurice Tobin news conference
Scopenote: The new Secretary of Labor Maurice Tobin is pictured as he held his first press conference today.   From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Philip Murray with an unidentified man
Scopenote: After a meeting with top aids, Philip Murray (right), President of the Executive Board of the CIO, called for a meeting of the Board to discuss endorsing a presidential candidate.  The Board was expected to endorse President Harry S. Truman. Other man is unidentified.  From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman and Oklahoma Governor Roy J. Turner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Oklahoma Governor Roy J. Turner today discussed plans for a campaign swing through Oklahoma late this month. Turner, who is chairman of the National Truman-Barkley Club, said the President will spend at least two days visiting a number of towns in the politically important border state. From: Beth Gore.

title: Pencil sketch of President Truman
Scopenote: An pencil sketch of President Harry S. Truman.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Former Secretary of State Cordell Hull on his 77th birthday
Scopenote: Former Secretary of State Cordell Hull celebrated his 77th birthday at the Naval Medical Center at Bethesda. A birthday cake was baked in the hospital's kitchen and flowers, letters and telegrams poured into the hospital all day. The veteran statesman is shown here as he posed informally for photographers in his room at the hospital  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Mrs. Grace Stewart, Administrative Assistant to Attorney General Tom C. Clark
Scopenote: Photo of Mrs. Grace Stewart, Administrative Assistant to Attorney General Tom C. Clark.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Gen. Lucius D. Clay and top U. S. officials as he leaves the White House
Scopenote: General Lucius D. Clay shown after presenting a personal report on conditions in Berlin to President Harry S. Truman. Shown with General Clay as he left the White House are left to right; Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall; General Clay; Robert D. Murphy, Political Advisor to General Clay; and William H. Draper, Undersecretary of the Army. From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Gen. Lucius D. Clay at a press conference
Scopenote: General Lucius D. Clay, American Commander in Germany, telling a press conference at the Pentagon that the Russians have developed a German Communist police force of 200,000 to 300,000 in the Soviet zone of Germany.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Paul G. Hoffman, Director of the Marshall Plan
Scopenote: Photo of Paul G. Hoffman, Director of the Marshall Plan, telling a news conference that the French coal strike is "Moscow directed" and possibly Russia's last determined effort to halt European recovery. He had just returned from a European trip on behalf of the European Cooperation Administration.  From: Beth Gore

title: President Truman at the Door of the Blair House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman returns to Washington  and he and his family move into the historic Blair House while the White House is being renovated.  He is shown in this picture waving to the crowd before entering his temporary home.  From:   Beth Gore.

title: W. Averill Harriman, the Roving Ambassador for the European Recovery Plan, at the White House
Scopenote: W. Averill Harriman, the Roving Ambassador for the European Recovery Plan, after meeting with President Truman at the White House. He told the President that the "moral influence" of the U. S.  abroad had increased greatly as a result of the American elections.  From:  Beth Gore.

title: A portrait of S.M. Bruce of Australia
Scopenote: A photograph of Viscount Stanley Melbourne Bruce of Melbourne, Australia, Director General of the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Sumner Welles, Testifying Before Congress
Scopenote: Former Under-Secretary of State Sumner Welles is shown as he testified before the House Un-American Activities Committee here in Washington today.  After looking at several of the microfilms, he said that publication of some of the documents would be "prejudicial to the nation's interest."  From: Beth Gore.

title: Mme. Chiang Kai-shek leaving the Blair House
Scopenote: Mme. Chiang Kai-shek (left) leaving the Blair House on the arm of Katherine (Mrs. George C.) Marshall, wife of the Secretary of State. Mme. Chiang spent an hour with President Truman at tea but refused to tell newsmen what they discussed.  From: Beth Gore

title: House Speaker Joseph W. Martin, Jr. (R-MA) greeting the incoming Speaker, Sam Rayburn (D-TX)
Scopenote: House Speaker Joseph W. Martin, Jr. (R-MA), greeting Rep. Sam Rayburn (D-TX), who would take over the Speaker's chair when the 81st Congress convened on January 3, 1948.  From: Beth Gore

title: Portrait of Trygve Lie, Secretary-General of the United Nations
Scopenote: Portrait of Trygve Lie, was elected Secretary-General of the United Nations on February 1, 1946. He was born in Calo, Norway on July 16, 1896, and holds a degree from the Oslo University Law School. He has served as Minister of Justice and of Commerce for his Government, as well as Minister of Foreign Affairs, and represented Norway at the First Session of the United Nations General Assembly.   From: Beth Gore

title: Senator Brien McMahon
Scopenote: Senator Brien McMahon (D), Connecticut, seated in a chair.

title: Dean Acheson and James Webb informal conference
Scopenote: President Truman's choices for his new Secretary and Under Secretary of State, Dean Acheson, at left, and James E. Webb, were photographed in this informal conference in the park across from the White House shortly after their appointments were announced.  Dean Acheson has been in and out of the government since Franklin Roosevelt's first term and Webb is now Director of the Budget.  From:   Beth Gore

title: Dean Acheson shaking hands with Herbert Hoover
Scopenote: Dean Acheson, left, who today was nominated by President Truman to be Secretary of State to succeed George C. Marshall, is congratulated by former President Herbert Hoover.  Acheson, a member of the Hoover Commission, was attending one of its meetings when his appointment was announced.   From: Beth Gore

title: Inaugural medal honoring President Truman
Scopenote: Front view of the special inaugural medal honoring President Truman. Mrs. Nellie Taylor Ross, Director of the Bureau of the Mint and Chairman of the Medal Committee of the 1949 Inaugural Committee, says the medal will be of bronze and will be 2 inches in diameter. From: Beth Gore.

title: Senator Elbert Thomas on telephone at desk
Scopenote: Latest informal photo of Democratic Senator Elbert D. Thomas of Utah.  He is on the telephone, at his desk.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of British Ambassador Sir Oliver Franks
Scopenote: Photo of British Ambassador Sir Oliver Franks after he called on President Truman to present the views of the British government on the Palestine crisis.   From: Beth Gore

title: Henri Bonnet touring the Freedom Train
Scopenote: Ambassador Henri Bonnet of France today took a tour of the Freedom Train, which returned to Washington this week after completing its trip of the United States. Ambassador Bonnet is shown aboard the train looking over the Paris Treaty of 1783, which was the first recognition by Britain of the United States as a free and independent nation.  From:   Beth Gore

title: James E. Webb and Tom Connally
Scopenote: The Senate Foreign Relations Committee today unanimously approved the nomination of James E. Webb to be Undersecretary of State. Webb, now Budget Director, will succeed retiring Undersecretary Robert Lovett. Shown with Webb at todays hearing is Chairman Tom Connally, (D) of Texas, left, who said he will ask Senate confirmation on Thursday.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Maurice Tobin with John Lesinski
Scopenote: Secretary of Labor Maurice Tobin today told the House Labor Committee that industry should aim for a goal of a minimum wage of $1.00 an hour for all. He is shown here with Rep. John Lesinski, left, Democrat, Michigan, Chairman of the Committee. From: Beth Gore

title: Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall (Center), Army Chief of Staff General Omar Bradley (Left), and Lt. Gen Albert C. Wedemeyer
Scopenote: Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall (Center)is leaving National Airport for an inspection tour of army installations in Japan, Korea, and other Pacific stations.  He is shown here, standing by an airplane, with Army Chief of Staff Gen. Omar Bradley (Left) and Lt. General Albert C. Wedemeyer, Deputy Chief of Staff for Plans and Combat Operations.  From: Beth Gore

title: New state department team:  Secretary of state Dean Acheson with Under Secretary James E. Webb
Scopenote: The State Department new top level diplomatic team took over active direction of the nation's foreign policy when James E. Webb, former budget director, was sworn in as Under Secretary of State.  Mr. Webb is shown with the new Secretary of State Dean Acheson shortly after the ceremony at the State Department.  From: Beth Gore.     From Beth Gore

title: Secretary of Interior Julius A. Krug as he appeared before the Senate Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
Scopenote: Secretary of Interior Julius A. Krug as he urged immediate Congressional action on a "long look" program to conserve dwindling natural resources. In an appearance before the Senate Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs, Krug noted the steady depleting of the nation's timber, mineral and oil resources.  From: Beth Gore

title: Maurice Tobin before Senate Labor Committee
Scopenote: In an appearance before the Senate Labor Committee today, Secretary of Labor Maurice J. Tobin urged Congress to return to "the philosophy of the Wagner Act" by repealing the objectionable Taft-Hartley Law and enacting President Truman's labor program. From: Beth Gore.

title: Housing Administrator Raymond M. Foley (left) and Senator John J. Sparkman
Scopenote: In an appearance before the Senate Banking Sub-Committee, Housing Administrator Raymond M. Foley urged Congress to pass a sweeping long range public housing and slum clearance program because "there is no alternative." Foley (left) is shown with Senator John J. Sparkman, Chairman of the Subcommittee. From: Beth Gore

title: A Portrait of J. Rives Childs
Scopenote: Portrait of J. Rives Childs, who was nominated by President Truman for promotion from Minister to Ambassador to the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of the Foreign Minister of Norway, Halvard M. Lange, arriving in Washington, D.C.
Scopenote: Photo of the Foreign Minister of Norway, Halvard M. Lange, arriving in Washington for conferences on the North Atlantic Defense Pact. He is shown talking to reporters as he arrived at National Airport. L to R: Ambassador Wilhelm Munthe de Morgenstierne, Halvard M. Lange, and reporters. From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Three Top Norwegians Conferring with Dean Acheson
Scopenote: Photo of three top Norwegians at the State Department to confer with Secretary Acheson on the North Atlantic Pact. Shown after their conference are left to right, seated: Secretary of State Dean Acheson, Norwegian Foreign Minister Halvard Lange; standing: Oscar Thorp, head of the Norwegian Labor Party, and Ambassador Wilhelm Munthe de Morgenstierne. From: Beth Gore.

title: Tighe E. Woods before House Banking Committee
Scopenote: Housing Expediter Tighe E. Woods asked for a two-year extension of rent control because of a continued critical shortage of rental housing. Woods, shown before the House Banking Committee, said that removal of rent ceilings now on the estimated 4,350,000 under control would be a serious blow to our economy.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Former President Herbert Hoover (L) and George H. Mead
Scopenote: Former President Herbert Hoover and George H. Mead, a member of the Commission to Reorganize the Executive Branch of the Government, leaving the White House after discussing the work of the Commission with President Truman.  From: Beth Gore.

title: ECA Administrator Paul Hoffman in an appearance before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee
Scopenote: European Cooperation Administrator Paul G. Hoffman in an appearance before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee regarding a proposed cut to the Marshall Plan spending.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Leon H. Keyserling, Vice Chairman of President Truman's Council of Economic Advisers
Scopenote: Photo of Leon H. Keyserling, Vice Chairman of President Truman's Council of Economic Advisers, telling the Congressional Joint Economic Committee that the continued declined in commodity prices emphasizes that the nation is in the midst of a mixed economy--some segments being inflationary, others deflationary. He said the sharp break was not surprising but very disturbing.    From: Beth Gore

title: Secretary of Agriculture Charles F. Brannan appears before the Senate Agriculture Committee
Scopenote: Appearing before the Senate Agriculture Committee, Secretary of Agriculture Charles F. Brannan tentatively rejected a proposal that he be given membership on all commodity exchanges.  The Committee is holding hearings on government commodity purchases for foreign use.  From: Beth Gore

title: W. Averell Harriman, top ECA Administrator, with Senator Tom Connally
Scopenote: W. Averell Harriman, top Economic Cooperation Administration administrator will travel abroad after telling the Senate Foreign Relations Committee that the alternative to $5,580,000,000 in new European Recovery Plan spending would be "life in an armed camp" both here and abroad.  He is shown here with Senator Tom Connally, Chairman of the Committee.  Mr. Harriman also described the Marshall Plan as a great investment in peace.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Norwegian Foreign Minister Halvard Lange and Two Associates
Scopenote: Norwegian Foreign Minister Halvard Lange called on President Harry S. Truman before attending a final State Department Conference on Norway's possible entry into the North Atlantic Security Pact (North Atlantic Treaty Organization). He was accompanied by Ambassador Wilhelm Munthe de Morgenstierne, left, and Oscar Torp, right, one of his advisers. From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman Greets Canadian Prime Minister Louis St. Laurent at the Blair House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) greets Canadian Prime Minister Louis St. Laurent at the Blair House where he was a luncheon guest of the Chief Executive.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of Labor Maurice Tobin
Scopenote: Secretary of Labor Maurice Tobin told the Joint Congressional Economic Committee today that the rise in unemployment appears to have slackened. But he cautioned that the situation should be closely watched. From: Beth Gore

title: Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall at a press conference
Scopenote: Army Secretary Kenneth Royall at a press conference in the Pentagon admitted he was the "high American official" who last week held a secret press conference in Tokyo which created an international furor, but he denied saying that U.S. Troops might be pulled out of Japan in case of war.  From:  Beth Gore

title: Secretary of Treasury John W. Snyder appearing before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee
Scopenote: Secretary of Treasury John W. Snyder telling the Senate Foreign Relations Committee that imposing rigid charges for each year of the Marshall Plan would make the transition to private investment difficult.  The Committee is considering extension of the European Recovery Plan.  From: Beth Gore

title: Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson testifying before House
Scopenote: Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson testifying before the House Committee on the question of adjustment of postal rates.  From: Beth Gore

title: Federal Housing Administrator, Tighe E. Woods, before Senate Banking Committee
Scopenote: Tighe E. Woods, Federal Housing Administrator, shown as he testified on rent controls before the Senate Banking and Currency Committee today. Shortly after his testimony crowds of landlords swarmed in the rotunda of the Capitol and then stormed the offices of individual Senators. From Beth Gore. From: Beth Gore

title: Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson
Scopenote: Louis Johnson, Secretary of Defense, as he arrived at the door of his office in the Pentagon building.   From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Senator Harry P. Cain (R. Wash.) and material assembled for his presentation against confirmation of Mon C. Wallgren
Scopenote: Senator Harry P. Cain (R. Wash.), assembled material which will enable him to talk for ten hours, if need be, against confirmation of Washington's former governor, Mon C. Wallgren, as Chairman of the National Resources Board. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Senator Harry P. Cain
Scopenote: After speaking at length against the nomination of Mon C. Wallgren, Senator Harry P. Cain (R. Wash), rests his tired feet. See also photo 99-175.  From: Beth Gore

title: Full-Length Photo of Senator Harry P. Cain (R. Wash)
Scopenote: After speaking at length against the nomination of Mon C. Wallgren, Senator Harry P. Cain (R. Wash.), is shown leaving.  See also photo 99-174.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Dean Acheson and Phillip Jessup in conference
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson today conferred informally with Philip C. Jessup, who was sworn in yesterday as Ambassador-At-Large.  Jessup (left) has been Deputy U.S. Representative in the Security Council of the United Nations since May, 1948.  From: Beth Gore

title: Secretary of the Army Kenneth C. Royall as he appeared before the House Armed Services Subcommittee
Scopenote: Secretary of the Army Kenneth C. Royall as he appeared before the House Armed Services Subcommittee to ask that provision be made for the construction of Army bases. From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Senator Tom Connally (D), Texas, reading the text of the NATO Pact
Scopenote: Senate Foreign Relations Committee Chairman Sen. Tom Connally (D), shown here reading the text of the North Atlantic Pact (NATO), after which he issued a formal statement saying his Committee would give the Pact "immediate consideration after its signature."  From Beth Gore

title: Accused Spy Judith Coplon
Scopenote: Judith Coplon is shown in this photo.  Miss Coplon had pleaded innocent to a charge of espionage. The 27 year old former Justice Department analyst was arraigned before Federal Judge Richmond Keech who fixed bail at $100,000 and set April 25, 1949 as the date for her trial. Others in the background are unidentified.  From: Beth Gore

title: Secretary of Agriculture Brannan signs an international agreement to stabilize wheat trade
Scopenote: Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan signs for the United States an international agreement to stabilize wheat trade.  The pact was signed by more that half of the nations in attendance and the other nations are scheduled to sign within the next three weeks  From: Beth Gore

title: Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan signs an international agreement to stabilize wheat trade
Scopenote: Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan signs, for the United States, an international agreement to stabilize wheat trade.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Louis Johnson being sworn in as Secretary of Defense by Chief Justice Fred Vinson.  Left is James Forrestal
Scopenote: In a colorful ceremony witnessed by more than 11,000 government and military officials and others, Louis Johnson today took the oath of office as Secretary of Defense. Pictured here (left to right) are Former Secretary of Defense James Forrestal, Mr. Johnson and Chief Justice Fred Vinson who administered the Oath of Office.  From: Beth Gore

title: British Foreign Minister Ernest Bevin Greets French Foreign Minister Robert Schuman
Scopenote: British Foreign Minister Ernest Bevin (left) is shown greeting French Foreign Minister Robert Schuman on their arrival at the State Department for a joint conference with Secretary Dean Acheson.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Cornelius Vanderbilt Whitney testifying before the Senate
Scopenote: Cornelius Vanderbilt Whitney as he testified today before the Senate Interstate and Foreign Commerce Committee in connection with his nomination to the post of Under Secretary of Commerce.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Maurice Tobin, Secretary of Labor, testifies before House Ways and Means Committee
Scopenote: Secretary of Labor Tobin today told the House Ways and Means committee that "to be effective, old age benefits must be adjusted to levels more consistent with current wage levels and the cost of living."  He is shown here as he urged Congress to expand the law to cover farm and domestic labor.

title: Photo of Robert Schuman, French Foreign Minister, at a press conference at the French Chancellery
Scopenote: In a press conference at the French Chancellery after the signing of the Western European Agreement, Robert Schuman, French Foreign Minister told reporters that "the door is still open to Russian cooperation in a four-power agreement concerning all Germany." He emphasized, however, that any further moves toward a four-power accord are "up to Russia."  Man in right background is unidentified.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan addressing House Agriculture Committee
Scopenote: Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan tells members of the House Agriculture Committee that the cost of his new farm program cannot be stated because it depends on too many "imponderables".  He denied the assertion of some Republican members that the program is a scheme to regiment farmers and share-the-wealth.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of former Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson as he testified before the Senate Armed Services Committee
Scopenote: Photo of former Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson as he testified before the Senate Armed Services Committee in favor of administration to strengthen the powers of the Secretary of Defense and unification of the Armed Forces.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson addressing reporters
Scopenote: Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson after his return from a week-end conference with General Dwight D. Eisenhower and the Joint Chiefs at Key West, Florida, telling reporters they had accomplished more at the meeting than during any other similar period in the last three years. He said the Joint Chiefs are "truly a team" although each is a "star" in his military field. Johnson expressed a strong desire that Congress approve President Truman's proposal to give the Defense Secretary more power and to unify the three services.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Stephen T. Early at his nomination hearing for Undersecretary of Defense
Scopenote: The Senate today unanimously approved the nomination of Stephen T. Early to be Undersecretary of Defense. Mr. Early is shown here as he testified before the Armed Service Committee, prior to the action of the Committee in approving his nomination.  From: Beth Gore

title: Portrait of Ambassador Robert D. Murphy
