Scopenote: Ambassador Robert D. Murphy, Acting Director, Office of German and Austrian Affairs, Department of State.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Portrait of Kenneth Royall
Scopenote: Portrait of Kenneth Royall after his resignation from the post of Secretary of the Army was announced by President Truman.  From: Beth Gore

title: President Harry S. Truman shaking hands with Erwin D. Canham, President of the American Society of Newspaper Editors
Scopenote: Representing the members of the American Society of Newspaper Editors, Erwin D. Canham (right), managing editor of the Christian Science Monitor and President of the Society is shown greeting  President Harry S. Truman.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan addresses Congress on the New Farm Program
Scopenote: Secretary of Agriculture Charles F. Brannan tells Congress how his proposed farm program could result in lower prices for consumers on milk, meat, eggs, and potatoes, and still hold farm income up.   He is shown here as he testifies before the House Agricultural Committee.  From: Beth Gore

title: Dean Acheson testifying before Senate Committee
Scopenote: Secretary of State Acheson today opened testimony on the 12-Nation Anti-Aggression Pact before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee with a plea for early ratification of the Pact.  The Treaty cannot go into effect until it is ratified by the original seven negotiating nations.  Ratification in the United States requires a two-thirds vote of the Senate. Secretary Acheson is shown as he testified today.  From: Beth Gore

title: W. Averill Harriman appearing before the Foreign Relations Committee of the Senate
Scopenote: W. Averill Harriman, appearing before the Foreign Relations Committee of the Senate, said that Western Europe must be given American arms to bolster her own confidence and increase our security.   From: Beth Gore

title: General Omar Bradley speaking to the Senate Foreign Relations Committee
Scopenote: General Omar Bradley, speaking as a member of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, appealing to the Senate Foreign Relations Committee for early ratification of the North Atlantic Treaty. From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of David A. Morse, Director General of the International Labor Office, conferring with President Truman in the Oval Office
Scopenote: Photo of David A. Morse (right), Director General of the International Labor Office, conferring with President Truman about putting into action his program for developing the backward areas of the world. Later he met with Trygve Lie and Directors of organizations participating in the U.S. to agree on an international program to provide technical assistance for undeveloped areas. From: Beth Gore.

title: President Dutra of Brazil cuts a surprise 64th birthday cake as President Truman watches
Scopenote: President Eurico Gaspar Dutra of Brazil cuts a surprise 64th birthday cake as President Harry S. Truman (left) lends a helping hand. The ceremony took place at the District Building in Washington, D. C., where Mr. Dutra was presented with the keys to the city. The Brazilian President was here for a state visit.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of President Eurico Gasper Dutra of Brazil speaking before a joint session of Congress
Scopenote: In an address before a joint session of Congress, President Eurico Gasper Dutra of Brazil said that his nation was working hand in hand with the United States in an effort "to ensure world peace." Beside President Dutra can be seen President Truman. In rear of rostrum are Senate President Pro Tempore Kenneth McKellar and Speaker Sam Rayburn. From: Beth Gore.

title: Portrait of Georgia Neese Clark
Scopenote: Portrait of Georgia Neese Clark, nominated by President Harry S. Truman to be Treasurer of the United States. The Richland, Kansas native posed for photographers at a press conference. The lower panel of the photograph shows her signature on a piece of paper.  From: Beth Gore

title: Accused Spy Judith Coplon
Scopenote: Judith Coplon, on trial on charges of treason takes a quick look at her watch just before entering court for a continuation of her trial.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan testifying before a Senate Agricultural Committee
Scopenote: Agricultural Secretary Charles F. Brannan opens his campaign for Congressional approval of the "Brannan Plan" by asking for authority to make direct payments to hog producers. He is pictured here as he testifies before a Senate Agricultural Committee. From: Beth Gore

title: Dean Acheson conversing with Senator Tom Connally
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson today reported to the Senate Foreign Relations Committee on the Big Four Meeting in Paris.  In a two hour meeting with members of the Committee, the Secretary warned that the end of the cold war is not yet in sight.  He further urged the early ratification of the North Atlantic Pact.  Mr. Acheson is shown here (left) with Senator Tom Connally, chairman of the Committee.  From: Beth Gore

title: President Truman in conference with John J. McCloy
Scopenote: President Truman holding a lengthy conference with John J. McCloy, U. S. High Commissioner to Germany. Mr. McCloy was formerly President of the International Bank for Reconstruction Development.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Puerto Rico's first elected Governor Munoz Marin, being greeted by Pres. Truman
Scopenote: Photo of Puerto Rico's first elected Governor, Luis Munoz Marin (right), being greeted by President Harry S. Truman at the White House. On the left is Secretary of the Interior J.A. Krug.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Senator Arthur H. Vandenberg standing, reading papers
Scopenote: Senator Arthur H. Vandenberg, Republican of Michigan, pictured just before he took the floor today to urge approval of the Atlantic Pact because it would be the best means to "stop another war before it starts." Senator Vandenberg is the ranking GOP member of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee. From: Beth Gore.

title: Dean Acheson at home on his farm
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson finds weekend relaxation by helping with the chores on his Harewood Farm near Sandy Springs, Maryland.  From: Beth Gore

title: Secretary of the Interior Julius A. Krug testifying before the House Public Works Committee
Scopenote: Supporting legislation to create a Columbia Valley Authority, Secretary of the Interior Julius A. Krug testified before a House Public Works Committee that the people of the Northwest are unanimous in wanting speedy development of the Columbia River Basin. He said it could best be done under a single authority rather than under the combined efforts of the Reclamation Bureau, Army Engineers, and Bonneville Power Administration.  From: Beth Gore

title: AFL President William Green addressing the Senate Banking Committee
Scopenote: In his appearance before the Senate Banking Committee, AFL President William Green endorsed legislation to provide direct loans to government housing cooperatives because "millions" of American families are too well off for public housing but too poor to buy privately-built homes. From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Defense Secretary Louis Johnson before the House Foreign Affairs Committee
Scopenote: Photo of Defense Secretary Louis Johnson telling  the House Foreign Affairs Committee that unless arms aid is sent immediately to Western Europe the United States may be forced to ultimately  liberate nations conquered by an aggressor. Johnson said he personally felt that the arms program should be continued for four or five years.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Roving ECA Ambassador W. Averill Harriman appearing before the House Foreign Affairs Committee
Scopenote: Roving ECA Ambassador W. Averill Harriman appearing before the House Foreign Affairs Committee asking that Congress approve President Truman's $1,450,000,000 Arms Air Program "to protect the growing generation from war."  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of ECA Roving Ambassador W. Averell Harriman, right, and Henry F. Grady, American Ambassador to Greece
Scopenote: Photo of ECA Roving Ambassador W. Averell Harriman, right, and Henry F. Grady, American Ambassador to Greece, taken at the Arms and Program Hearing before the House Foreign Affairs Committee.     From: Beth Gore

title: Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson (left), and Senator Ton Connally (D) of Texas
Scopenote: Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson and Senator Tom Connally (D) Texas, Chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, discuss the re-draft of the Arms Aid Bill which Connally will introduce in the Senate.  From: Beth Gore

title: Dean Acheson at a press conference on China
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson holds a copy of the U. S. "White Paper" on China as he discusses the document with newsmen at a press conference today.  Similar to photo 96-1042.  From: Beth Gore

title: Comptroller General Lindsay C. Warren
Scopenote: Comptroller General Lindsay C. Warren holds a copy of the report he made to Congress in which he charged that fraud and waste in wartime contracting had cost American taxpayers millions of dollars. Warren said that his audits of about $1,165,000,000 in contract settlements to date showed irregularities amounting to more than $11,500,000.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Dean Acheson testifying before a Joint Senate Committee
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson today told a Joint Senate Committee on Foreign Relations and Arms Aid that the U.S. is "open to attack" as never before because Western Europe's defenses are a "soft shell", inviting Soviet aggression.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of President Truman and President Elpidio Quirino of the Philippines
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and President Elpidio Quirino of the Philippines as they left Washington National Airport shortly after the Philippine Chief Executive arrived in Washington for a State visit. President Quirino was a guest of President Truman at the Blair House.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of President Truman greeting President Expidio Quirino of the Philippines
Scopenote: Photo of President Harry S. Truman extending a warm welcome to President Expidio Quirino of the Philippines when he arrived at Washington National Airport for an official Washington visit. On the left is Joaquin M. Elizalde, Philippine Ambassador to the United States.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of President Elpidio Quirino of the Philippines addressing the House of Representatives
Scopenote: In an address before the House of Representatives, President Elpidio Quirino of the Philippines urged U. S. support for a union of Pacific nations.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of State Dean Acheson and U. S. High Commissioner for Germany John J. McCloy
Scopenote: At a press conference, Secretary of State Dean Acheson indicated that the United States would consider any attack on Hong Kong by Chinese Communists as a matter for action by the United Nations Council. John J. McCloy, right, U. S. High Commissioner for Germany, told the reporters that it is incredible that Western Germany political leaders are stressing nationalism in the German political campaign, instead of dealing with substantial issues.  From: Beth Gore

title: George M. Elsey
Scopenote: George McKee Elsey, who was appointed to a $10,000 a year job as Administrative Assistant to President Truman. From Oakmont, Pennsylvania, he formerly was assistant to Clark M. Clifford, the President's Special Counsel.

title: General Harry Vaughn Testifying at Senate Investigation
Scopenote: Presidential Military Aide, Major General Harry H. Vaughan, was the star witness today before the Senate Committee investigating so-called "five percenters."  General Vaughan told the committee he had given assistance to business concerns only as a matter of "extending aid whenever that could properly be done."  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Jess Larson, head of the General Services Administration
Scopenote: Photo of Jess Larson, head of the General Services Administration, appearing before the Senate Five Per Center Investigating Committee. He warned them not to create any more red tape in their effort to stamp out the "five per center," because it would make it difficult for the legitimate, honest and well-meaning businessman to deal with the government. From: Beth Gore.

title: British Foreign Minister Bevin, and French Foreign Minister Schuman
Scopenote: British Foreign Minister Ernest Bevin, left, and French Foreign Minister Robert Schuman, as they arrived at the State Department for a conference with Secretary of State Dean Acheson.  From: Beth Gore.

title: French Foreign Minister Schuman and French Ambassador Bonnet
Scopenote: Early arrivals for the meeting of the representatives of the 12 Atlantic Pact Nations were French Foreign Minister Robert Schuman, left, and French Ambassador to the United States, Henri Bonnet.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Portrait of Associate Supreme Court Justice, Tom Clark
Scopenote: A formal portrait of Associate Supreme Court Justice, Tom Clark, made in his chambers at the Court. It is the first time the new Justice was  photographed in his robes.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Associate Justice of U.S. Supreme Court, Tom C. Clark
Scopenote: An informal picture of new Associate Justice of the United States Supreme Court, Tom C. Clark. This picture was made in his chambers at the Court.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of the Navy Francis P. Matthews appearing before the House Armed Services Committee
Scopenote: Secretary of the Navy Francis P. Matthews appearing before the House Armed Services Committee. The Secretary had asked that the hearings be held in secret, but Rep. Carl E. Vinson (D) GA, refused the request. Later in the hearing Rep. Vinson reversed himself and agreed to hear some of the testimony in secret.  From: Beth Gore

title: Dean Acheson talking with Senator Tom Connally and Philip Jessup
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson today told the Senate Foreign Relations Committee what progress he is making in formulating a new policy on China.  Acheson, center, is shown with Senator Tom Connally, Chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, and Ambassador-at-Large Philip Jessup, left, who heads a three-man special committee on China Policy.  From: Beth Gore

title: A Photo of General Clifton B. Cates speaking before the House Armed Services Committee
Scopenote: General Clifton B. Cates, Commandant of the U. S. Marine Corps, telling the House Armed Services Committee that the Army General Staff has dealt "A severe and telling blow" to national security in its efforts to cripple the Corps as a fighting force. He said the blow at their service was planned more than four years ago by General J. Lawton Collins, now Army Chief of Staff.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson appearing before the House Armed Services Committee
Scopenote: Replying to Navy charges on unification before the House Armed Services Committee, Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson said that, contrary to Navy testimony, he killed the Navy's super aircraft carrier project after lengthy study and with full approval of President Truman.  From: Beth Gore  From: Beth Gore

title: Ambassador Eugenie Anderson
Scopenote: An informal photo of Mrs. Eugenie Anderson as she arrived to be sworn in tomorrow as Ambassador to Denmark.  She will be the nation's first woman Ambassador.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo Shows Swearing-in of John R. Steelman as Special Assistant to the President
Scopenote: Photo shows swearing-in of John R. Steelman (right) as Special Assistant to the President at the White House.  Left to right, Frank K. Sanderson, Administrative Officer of the Executive Office, and John R. Steelman.  From: Beth Gore.

title: A sketch of Army Chief of Staff J. Lawton Collins
Scopenote: Sketch of J. Lawton Collins drawn by Associated Press Newsfeatures artist H. E. Munhall.  Army Chief of Staff J. Lawton Collins believes "the air has been cleared considerably" by the armed forces row. He qualifies as an expert in combat. He earned his reputation as "Lighting Joe" on two fronts in the last war.   From: Beth Gore

title: A sketch of Admiral Forrest P. Sherman
Scopenote: A sketch of Admiral Forrest P. Sherman, the 53-year old Naval Airman, who succeeded Admiral Louis E. Denfeld as Chief of Naval Operations in the wake of the "rebellion" of high Navy officers over defense policies. The sketch was drawn by AP Newsfeatures artist H. E. Munhall.  From: Beth Gore

title: A portrait of Oscar L. Chapman
Scopenote: A portrait of Oscar L. Chapman, the present Undersecretary of the Interior, who has been named by President Truman to succeed J. A. Krug as Secretary of Interior. Krug resigned.

title: Rep. Edith Norse Rogers and Gen. George C. Marshall
Scopenote: Rep. Edith Nourse Rogers of Massachusetts stands with General George C. Marshall.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Portrait of Admiral Forrest Sherman, Chief of Naval Operations
Scopenote: Portrait of Admiral Forrest Sherman, Chief of Naval Operations.  From: Beth Gore

title: Senator Arthur H. Vandenberg News conference
Scopenote: Holding his first press conference since recovering from a long illness, Senator Arthur H. Vandenberg (R-Mich.) today told newsmen that Communist China must demonstrate its competent control as well as its willingness to observe the rules of International Law before it can qualify for recognition. From: Beth Gore.

title: Senator Arthur H. Vandenberg at a news conference
Scopenote: Looking chipper and hearty after his long illness, Senator Arthur H. Vandenberg (R. Michigan) today held his first press conference since his return to the Capitol.  Among other things, he told the newsmen that he does not believe the Communist government of China "now qualifies for recognition."  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Senator Ton Connally (D), Texas, speaking to the press
Scopenote: Senator Tom Connally, Chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, telling the press that "sizeable" cuts in foreign aid spending are needed next year. The Texas Democrat also said that he had received assurance from Secretary of State Dean Acheson that there will be no American recognition of the Communist regime in China without full consultation with the Senate Committee.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of Leon H. Keyserling, Vice Chairman of the President's Council of Economic Advisers
Scopenote: Photo of Leon H. Keyserling, Vice Chairman of the President's Council of Economic Advisers, reviewing charts on economic conditions which were included in the Council's report to Congress.  From: Beth Gore

title: Ladies of the Senate at Business Meeting
Scopenote: Ladies of the Senate today held their first business meeting of the year, with Mrs. Alben Barkley becoming president of the group. She succeeds the late Mrs. Allen J. Ellender, wife of the Louisiana Senator. Shown Left to Right: Mrs. William F. Knowland, wife of Senator from California, Mrs. Styles Bridges, New Hampshire, Mrs. Alben W. Barkley, and Mrs. Millard E. Tydings of Maryland. From: Beth Gore.

title: Senator Millard Tydings and Admiral Forrest P. Sherman
Scopenote: Armed Services Committee Chairman Senator Millard Tydings of Maryland and Admiral Forrest Sherman, shown as the Committee began hearings on Admiral Sherman's appointment as Chief of Naval Operations.  From: Beth Gore

title: President Truman conferring with John J. McCloy and Dean Acheson
Scopenote: President Truman shown as he conferred on the German situation with John McCloy, U. S. High Commissioner in Germany, and Secretary of State Dean Acheson.   From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of President Benjamin F. Fairless of the United States Steel Corporation
Scopenote: President Benjamin F. Fairless of the United States Steel Corporation, told the Joint Economic Committee today that the corporation had not made a fair return on its sales or investment for the last 20 years. He blamed the recent price rise on the new employees pension system and the boost in Federal Social Security taxes.  From: Beth Gore.  From: Beth Gore

title: James Boyd speaking to the Senate Labor Committee
Scopenote: James Boyd, Director of the U.S. Bureau of Mines, speaking before the Senate Labor Committee regarding the status of coal stocks.  From:  Beth Gore.

title: Photo of British Ambassador Sir Oliver Franks signing an agreement
Scopenote: Photo of British Ambassador Sir Oliver Franks  signing the first of a series of agreements that will start a $1,000,000,000 flow of American arms to Atlantic Pact partners. The ceremony took place at the British Embassy and Ambassador Franks was given the honor of the being the first to sign. John W. Foley, State Department Treaty Advisor, looks over the Ambassador's shoulder as he signs the document.  From: Beth Gore

title: Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder as he explained the President's tax program to the House Ways and Means Committee
Scopenote: Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder as he explained the President's tax program to the House Ways and Means Committee.  The proposal was to cut excise taxes $655,000,000 a year, but to boost business, estate, and gift taxes to give the Government an actual net increase of $1,000,000,000 in new revenue.   From: Beth Gore

title: Press Secretary Charles Ross giving reporters the details of the President's Executive Order invoking the Taft-Hartley Act in the soft coal dispute
Scopenote: Presidential Press Secretary Charles Ross, shown as he gave reporters the details of the President's Executive Order invoking the Taft-Hartley Act in the soft coal dispute. The order came as a first step in getting a Federal court to order 400,000 striking coal miners back to work. The President appointed a board of inquiry to examine the dispute and report to him by next Monday. From: Beth Gore.

title: ECA Administrator Hoffman (right) talking to Senator Tom Connally
Scopenote: European Cooperation Administrator Paul G. Hoffman (right), shown talking to Senator Tom Connally, (Democrat, Texas), Chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee.  Mr. Hoffman had appeared before them regarding a cut in the Marshall Plan spending.  From: Beth Gore

title: Dr. Vannevar Bush speaking with Senator Millard Tydings
Scopenote: The Senate Armed Services Committee called Dr. Vannevar Bush for a closed door conference on Post-War progress in military weapons.  Bush, head of the Carnegie Institution was Director of Research and Development Board until he was replaced by Dr. Earl T. Compton.  Bush, left, is shown with Senator Millard Tydings (Democrat Maryland) Chairman of the Committee.  From: Beth Gore

title: John L. Lewis, President of the United Mine Workers, leaving the just terminated Fact-Finding Board hearings
Scopenote: John L. Lewis, President of the United Mine Workers, shown leaving the just terminated Fact-Finding Board hearings.  This termination paved the way for President Truman to seek a court order sending striking miners back to work.  From: Beth Gore

title: Prince Bernhard of the Netherlands at a Press Conference
Scopenote: Prince Bernhard of the Netherlands is shown at a press conference held at the Washington National Press Club.  The Prince is  in Washington for a two day informal visit; he will leave Washington on the 10th for Ottawa, Canada.  From:   Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson with William Webster
Scopenote: Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson (right)congratulates William Webster after he was sworn in today as Chairman of Research and Development.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Dr. Philip C. Jessup, U. S. Ambassador-at-Large, arriving by train from the Far East
Scopenote: Dr. Philip C. Jessup, U. S. Ambassador-at-Large, is shown with Mrs. Jessup as he arrived in Washington after a hurried trip from a Far East survey. He hurried home to answer charges by Senator Joseph McCarthy, (R., WI) that he (Jessup) has "an affinity for Communist organizations".  From: Beth Gore.

title: Vice President Alben Barkley and UN Secretary General Trygve Lie
Scopenote: Vice President Alben Barkley (left)and United Nations Secretary General Trygve Lie as guests of honor at the Triennial Dinner of the B'nai B'rith at the Statler Hotel in Washington, D. C.  In Mr. Lie's address, before a crowd of 1,000 guests, he called for a 20 year truce in the Cold War.  From: Beth Gore

title: Mrs. Esther C. Brunauer speaking before the Senate Subcommittee on Foreign Relations
Scopenote: Mrs. Esther C. Brunauer of the State Department  denying Senator Joseph McCarthy's charges against her as she appeared before the Senate Subcommittee on Foreign Relations.    From: Beth Gore.

title: A Photograph of Sir Basil Brooke and Sir Oliver Franks
Scopenote: Sir Basil Brooke (left), Prime Minister of Northern Ireland, arrives in Washington. Shown in the car with Sir Brooke is Sir Oliver Franks, British Ambassador, who met the Prime Minister on his arrival.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Chilian President Gabriel Gonzalez Videla speaking to Vice President Alben Barkley
Scopenote: President Gabriel Gonzalez Videla (right) of Chile is pictured with Vice President Barkley following an address he delivered in the Senate.  From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman, Bess Truman, Mrs. Gabriel Gonzales Videla, and Gabriel Gonzalez Videla of Chile
Scopenote: President and Mrs. Truman attended the reception and ball last night given by the President of Chile. Shown just before the formation of the receiving line are (left to right): President Harry S. Truman, First Lady Bess Truman, Senora Gonzalez Videla, and President Gonzalez Videla. From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Attorney General J. Howard McGrath as he appeared before a Senate Commerce Subcommittee
Scopenote: Attorney General J. Howard McGrath was the first witness appearing before a Senate Commerce Subcommittee on a bill to outlaw interstate transmission of gambling information. Attorney General McGrath told the Committee that he did not know of any nationwide crime syndicate, but the Federal Government wants to help the states suppress "organized" gambling activities.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Senora Gonzales Videla, First Lady of Chile
Scopenote: A new portrait of Senora Gonzalez Videla, wife of the President of Chile.    From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of the Interior Chapman asking for Alaska statehood
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman urged the Congress to grant statehood to Alaska to make her ties with the union stronger "in this period of the Cold War".

title: Photo of Admiral Forrest P. Sherman as he called on the White House
Scopenote: Admiral Forrest P. Sherman, Chief of Naval Operations, had asked Congress for authority to start a Navy building and conversion plan costing about $335,000,000. Among the 112 vessels to be built would be four new type submarines including one driven by atomic power. Admiral Sherman is shown by a car as he called at the White House later that day.  From: Beth Gore

title: President Truman with reporters and photographers in new press conference room at Old State Department building
Scopenote: Still and newsreel photographers were permitted today for the first time to photograph President Harry S. Truman's meeting with reporters in the new press conference headquarters in the Old State Department Building (later known as the Old Executive Office Building). From: Beth Gore.

title: Portrait of Ambassador Jean Chauvel of France, at the U.N. Security Council
Scopenote: Portrait of Ambassador Jean Chauvel, of France, President for May of the United Nations Security Council.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Archibald S. Alexander sworn in as Under Secretary of the Army
Scopenote: Archibald S. Alexander, Bernardsville, New Jersey, was today sworn in as Under Secretary of the Army by Secretary of Army Frank Pace.  Left to right:  Secretary Pace, Mrs. Alexander, and daughters Susan, 14, Emily, 18, and Jean, 11 look on admiringly as Mr. Alexander takes the oath.  From: Beth Gore.

title: President Truman; Byron Price, U. N. Assistant Secretary-General; U. N. Secretary-General Trygve Lie; and Secretary of State Dean Acheson
Scopenote: United Nations Secretary-General Trygve Lie and Secretary of State Dean Acheson conferring with President Truman at the White House. Lie, who had met earlier with the Secretary of State at the State Department for a discussion of the Cold War problems, reiterated that he brought no message from Soviet Premier Joseph Stalin. Left to right: President Harry S. Truman; Byron Price, United Nations Assistant Secretary-General; United Nations Secretary-General Trygve Lie; and Secretary of State Dean Acheson.  From: Beth Gore

title: Photo of U.S.S.R. Representative Ambassador Yakov A. Malik
Scopenote: Photo of U.S.S.R. Representative Ambassador Yakov A. Malik (Center), meeting with reporters in the Lake Success' Delegates Lounge just before he assumed  his turn as President of the United Nations Security Council.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Andrei Y. Vyskinsky, U.S.S.R. Minister for Foreign Affairs and Ambassador Yakov A. Malik, U.S.S.R. Representative to the U.N
Scopenote: Photo of chief delegates of the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics to the Fifth Session of the United Nations General Assembly, seen before a plenary meeting: Mr. Andrei Y. Vyskinsky, right, Minister for Foreign Affairs and Delegation Chairman, and Ambassador Yakov A. Malik, Permanent Representative to the United Nations.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of General Mark W. Clark
Scopenote: General Mark W. Clark, Commander of Army Field Forces, holds a press conference at the Fairmont Hotel in San Francisco.  From: Beth Gore

title: John L. Lewis, President of the United Mine Workers, walking down street
Scopenote: Photo of John L. Lewis, President of the United Mine Workers, carrying a cane as if to depict the big stick he is holding over the nation.  From: Beth Gore

title: John L. Lewis, President of the United Mine Workers, talking to reporters
Scopenote: John L. Lewis, President of the United Mine Workers, as he appeared before photographers who had been hunting him for two days. He told them to "take your time, you've earned it."   From: Beth Gore

title: Portrait of Michael Vincent Di Salle, Director of the Office of Price Stabilization
Scopenote: Portrait of Michael Vincent Di Salle, Director of the Office of Price Stabilization, 1950-52, and Administrator, Economic Stabilization Agency, 1952.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of the Honorable Walter J. Donnelly, U.S. Ambassador to Austria
Scopenote: The Honorable Walter J. Donnelly, U.S. Ambassador to Austria, is shown boarding the plane in Vienna for a visit to Germany to visit John McCloy.   From: Beth Gore.

title: An airbrushed portrait of General Mark W. Clark
Scopenote: An airbrushed portrait of General Mark W. Clark.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Phil Donnelly, Democratic candidate for Governor of Missouri
Scopenote: Phil Donnelly, Lebanon, Missouri, is the Democratic candidate for governor of Missouri.  From:  Beth Gore.

title: A photograph of Representative Clarence J. Brown
Scopenote: Representative Clarence J. Brown, (R. Ohio) is shown appearing before the House Elections Investigating Committee regarding current violations of the present laws limiting campaign expenditures.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Bess Truman receiving a glass paperweight inscribed with the Girl Scout trefoil insignia
Scopenote: Photo of Bess Truman receiving a glass paperweight inscribed with the Girl Scout trefoil insignia as a gift from the 1,900,000 Girl Scouts of the U. S. A. Mrs. Truman has served as the organization's honorary president since 1945. Left to right are Susan Schnieder, 11, Washington, Lorretta Gallegos, 8, Bladensburg, Maryland, Joanna Rodman, 8, Arlington, Virginia, Marion East, 16, Falls Church, Virginia and Mrs. Truman. Lorretta and Joanna are Brownies. Susan and Marian are Girl Scouts.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of George M. Humphrey,(R) Secretary of the Treasury-designate with Secretary of the Treasury, John Snyder
Scopenote: Photo of George M. Humphrey,(R) Secretary of the Treasury-designate with Secretary of the Treasury, John Snyder. Mr. Humphrey is shown talking to Secretary Snyder just before their conference began.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Dr. Vannevar Bush Speaking before the House Committee Investigating Armed Services Procurement
Scopenote: Dr. Vannevar Bush, President of the Carnegie Institute, today appeared before a House Committee investigating Armed Services procurement. Dr. Bush was head of the office of Scientific Development and Research and also directed the original Atom Bomb Project. From: Beth Gore

title: A portrait of Lt. Col. Irene O. Galloway, Chief of Women's Army Corps
Scopenote: A portrait of Lt. Col. Irene O. Galloway, was named Chief of the Women's Army Corps. Col. Galloway, who is from Carroll county, Iowa, will take over her new post on January 3, 1953.  From:  Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of Agriculture-Designate Ezra Benson Meets With Reporters
Scopenote: Secretary of Agriculture-designate Ezra Taft Benson (left) talks with reporters after meeting with Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan.  Benson, stopping here during a trip around the country to see farm and industry leaders, told newsmen that he and Brannan discussed nothing of great importance to the public.  From:   Beth Gore.

title: James P. McGranery speaking with Herbert Brownell
Scopenote: Attorney General James P. McGranery, left, explains the workings of the Justice Department to Herbert Brownell, the newly designated Attorney General in the Eisenhower Cabinet.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Harlow Curtice, Mrs. C. E. Wilson, and C. E. Wilson at GM Motorama
Scopenote: With orchestra, ballet, and chorus arrayed on a two-level mechanized stage at New York Waldorf-Astoria Hotel, General Motors opened its seven-day Motorama of 1953 Saturday. In its display, GM introduced seven special cars built exclusively for the show--four with glass fiber reinforced plastic bodies. Photo shows: Harlow H. Curtice (left), Acting President of General Motors, greeting Mrs. C. E. Wilson (center), and C. E. Wilson, former GM President and Secretary of Defense designate. From: Beth Gore.

title: John Foster Dulles Addresses State Department Employees
Scopenote: Secretary of State John Foster Dulles, bare headed in a chill wind, stood on the rear steps of the main State Department Building to speak to several thousand employees assembled in a parking lot. He told them he always felt there is "no service one can render to his country that is higher or more valuable" than to be in the foreign service or the State Department.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of Army Chief of Staff J. Lawton Collins
Scopenote: Army Chief of Staff J. Lawton Collins, appearing before a House Armed Services Committee, where he said an over zealous public relations officer "made a mistake" in putting a fancy cover on the official time table for "operation smack" but asserted the ill-fated assault was soundly conceived and fully justified.  From: Beth Gore

title: Secretary of Defense Charles E. Wilson, left, greeting the Canadian Defense Minister, the Honorable Brooke Claxton
Scopenote: Secretary of Defense Charles E. Wilson, left, greets the Canadian Defense Minister, the Honorable Brooke Claxton, at the Pentagon.  Secretary Wilson was host at luncheon for Mr. Claxton.  From: Beth Gore.

title: General James Van Fleet with Chairman Dewy Short of the House Armed Services Committee
Scopenote: General James A. Van Fleet, 60-year-old former 8th Army commander, told Congressmen this morning that the Korea deadlock is a sit-down of our own choice. Van Fleet, appearing before the House Armed Services Committee, also suggested the draft term be lengthened from its present two years "to 30 or 36 months." In this double photograph, on the right, Committee Chairman Dewey Short (R-MO) greets Van Fleet upon arrival at the hearing, and left is Van Fleet as he testified. From: Beth Gore.

title: General James Van Fleet with General Edward M. Almond
Scopenote: General James A. Van Fleet, left, and Lt. Gen. Edward M. Almond, former 10th Army Corps Commander, snapped at a Senate Armed Services Subcommittee hearing today where they were questioned about the recent serious ammunition shortage in Korea.  The Committee is trying to fix the blame for the shortage.   From: Beth Gore.

title: Photo of diplomat John Paton Davies after being fired by Secretary of State John Foster Dulles
Scopenote: Photo of career diplomat John Paton Davies after he was fired by Secretary of State John Foster Dulles.  Mr. Davies had been counselor of the U.S. Embassy in Lima, Peru. The firing was the result of a decision by a five member special security hearing board whose finding was that Davies's continued employment would go against the interests of national security.  From: Beth Gore.

title: Secretary of State John Foster Dulles and Mutual Security Administrator Harold Stassen
Scopenote: Secretary of State John Foster Dulles (left) and Mutual Security Administrator Harold Stassen are boarding a plane at Washington Airport for a nine-day tour of seven European nations. Before leaving, Dulles reiterated that he was not going to make "new commitments" but gather information on the "common problems" facing the Atlantic community.  From: Beth Gore
